loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Beldine

texts.en: Beldine O. is a full-time tailor at her clothing business. She started this business in 1994 and has not looked back since then. She intends to use this loan to restock sewing materials for the business and acquire more equipment. Beldine would like a loan of KShs. 30,000.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and equipment

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov C. lives in Trapaing Tnaut village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a piece of land she owns. Her husband, Mr. Kak Pann, is a construction worker. This couple has two children, one of whom is a security guard in a garment factory and the other is attending the local school. Since their first child’s work place is far from their home, they face an obstacle because they usually pay for the motorbike taxi fare. Thus, Mrs. Pov C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her first child to drive to work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her first child to drive to work.

loans.name: Fe Y Progreso 3&4 Group

texts.en:
Yngris, 32, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Fe y Progreso (Faith and Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Yngris and her husband have four children and live in a small community called Batey Las Baja with the other borrowers from the group. Bateyes are rural communities that were built by sugar companies for their workers. They are isolated and lack any kind of reliable electricity, running water, or medical facilities. Despite these difficulties, Yngris runs a successful business selling clothing to her friends and neighbors. With this loan, her eighth with Esperanza International, she will purchase new pants, blouses and shoes. 

Yngris originally came to Esperanza because she had seen others with loans and the success it gave them. She and her husband decided that they could not miss this opportunity, and now Yngris is on her way to her dream of having her own boutique. Her business came slow before, but now with extra capital her business is progressing. With your support, Yngris can achieve her dream of growing her business. Thank you for lending to Yngris and the Fe y Progreso group!

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, and shoes

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde sells foodstuffs and eggs. She is married with four children, and she is 54 years old. Her husband is a Dry-cleaner. She hopes that her business will grow bigger in the future, and improve her family's standard of living. She needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000. She will use this loan to invest in her business of selling drinks and eggs. She will buy in bulk to get a better price. Kehinde hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.fr: A. Micheline est née en 1958 à Tori au Bénin. Micheline vit depuis environs 8 ans à Sékou à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Micheline est mariée à GBASSI Rémi, un cultivateur. Le couple a huit enfants, dont seulement un est à leur charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Micheline vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Micheline n'a pas été à l'école. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Micheline vend du maïs à Sékou à Allada. C'est à Houègbo et à Sékou, que Micheline s'approvisionne. Micheline mène cette activité depuis 12 ans environs, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Micheline a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits qu'elle a obtenus de ALIDé. C'est pour renforcer son capital et augmenter le stock de son produit, que Micheline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Micheline A. was born in 1958 in Tori in Benin. She has been living for about 8 years in the neighborhood of Sékou in Allada, in the department of Atlantique. Micheline is married to Rémi Gbassi, a farmer. They have eight children, of whom only one is in her care. Some of their children attend school. Micheline lives with this child and her husband. The parents provide together for their family. Micheline did not attend school.

To help her husband, Micheline sells corn in the neighborhood of Sékou in Allada. She gets her supplies in Houègbo and in Sékou. She has been in this business for about 12 years. This is her third loan from Alidé. She repaid her previous two loans on schedule. Now Micheline came to Alidé and applied for her third loan to boost her working capital and stock up on corn.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of 50 kg corn

loans.name: Mbathio

texts.fr: Mbathio T. est mariée, 35 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus. Avec les revenus générés par  cet activité, elle pourra prendre en charge sa famille en santé et en scolarité.
texts.en:
Mbathio T. is married, 35 years old, and the mother of 3 children. She sells cloth for a living. With the income earned in this business, she will be able to better care for her family's health and pay school expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beverages.

loans.name: Sauiluma

texts.en:
Sauiluma F. is 38 and married with no children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Sauiluma has 4 years of experience in this business.  Sauiluma needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Sauiluma joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sauiluma's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Sauiluma F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun K. is 43 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is married with two school-aged children.  Her husband helps take care of their family by working as a company security guard.

To make a living, Lun K. owns a few looms that she uses to weave silk skirts. She then sells the finished products to middlemen, who deliver them to the market.  

Lun K. has run out of material, and she wants to replenish her stock. She is asking for a loan to buy silks in order to produce more silk skirts.

loans.use: To buy silks in order to produce more silk skirts.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary Traoré  est marié à deux femmes, père de 6 enfants ,il est né vers 1977 à Tiébiziédougou un des villages de la préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative du Mali. Il vit dans une famille polygame avec ses épouses et leurs enfants à Kadiolo /Tiébiziédougou.
Il est commerçant  depuis 7 ans en ayant comme créneau la vente de céréales et  des  articles divers  de boutique. Expérimenté en raison des années d’activité, il le fait avec beaucoup de réussite. 
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, deux tonnes de maïs sur place à Tiébiziédougou et dans les villages avoisinants Kadiolo. Il vend au comptant, souvent à crédit (en gros et en détail) à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Kadiolo ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Bakary Traoré has two wives and is the father of six children. He was born around 1977 in Tiébiziédougou, one of the villages in the Kadiolo Prefecture, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. He lives in a polygamous family with his wives and children in Kadiolo/Tiébiziédougou. He has been a merchant for the past seven years, specialising in the sale of grain cereals and various shop items. After years of acquiring experience, he enjoys much success in what he does. This is his first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. With the loan he wants to buy two tons of corn, locally in Tiébiziédougou and in neighboring Kadiolo villages. He sells for cash and often for credit (both wholesale and retail) to a customer base of men and women. He hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 50,000 FCFA, of which part will be used to increase his working capital and the rest put into savings. His ambition is to build a dwelling in the town of Kadiolo.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ousmane N.  est un banquier en retraite depuis 2006. Agé de 57 ans et père de 8 enfants, il sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour  régler des frais d’assurance et de mutation d’une voiture qu’il vient  d’acheter.
texts.en:
Mr. Ousmane N. is a retired banker since 2006. He is 57 years old and the father of eight children. He is requesting a loan for 150,000 FCFA to cover the insurance and other acquisition fees for a car he has just bought.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay insurance and acquisition fees

loans.name: Sinuon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinuon Y., age 49, is the leader of a group loan consisting of five members. Each member of the group loan will use the loan for different business purposes. 

Mrs. Sinuon Y. is from Kampong Tuol village in Kandal province. She is a widow, and she stays at home to take care of her children. One of her children works in construction and the other two are employed as seamstresses in a garment factory.

She is requesting a loan in order to build a kitchen for her home.

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Zenewe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Zenewe de l’association Benkadi est composé de 4 femmes mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage et la  parenté. 
Elles exercent  la vente de diverses marchandises telles les condiments alimentaires et la transformation  tels Jacqueline.
Jaqueline D. s’est spécialisée dans la transformation des graines de néré en Sounbala qu’elle vend. 
Elle s’approvisionne en graines de néré à la foire de Kimparana, une fois les graines arrivées Jaqueline les met dans une grande marmite en les faisant bouillir toute une soirée après cette activité  elle  met les graines cuites dans un grand panier et emballés fermement pendant 72 heures. Ces deux actions terminées elle les met  en  pâte dans le mortier pour bien mélangé, ensuite elle les coupe en petit morceaux. 
Jaqueline  a une clientèle constituée de femme et espère obtenir un bénéfice de 26 000 FCFA qui sera essentiellement  réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
The “Zenewe” group of the Benkadi is composed of four married women in the town of San, Segou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). The members of the group live in extended traditional families. They know each other as neighbors and relatives. They sell various goods such as food condiments and prepared foods, as for example, Jacqueline does. Jaqueline D. specializes in preparing "sounbala" [a West African condiment] by processing the seed pods of “néré” [a leguminous shrub whose seeds transformed into a local food products by cooking and fermenting]. She purchases her supply of néré seeds at the Kimparana market. Once she has bought the seeds, she put them in a big pot and boils them for the whole evening, after which she puts the cooked seeds in a big basket and keeps them tightly wrapped for 72 hours. After these two steps are done, she crushes the seeds into a paste in a mortar and cuts it into small pieces. Jacqueline has a customer based composed of women. She hopes to achieve a monthly income of 26,000 West African francs, which will be largely reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing the seeds of nere, an African shrub plant used in food production

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita S. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old, is married, and has seven adult children.

Sanita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years already.

In May 2009, Sanita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Sanita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her fifth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Miriam Margot

texts.es:
Miriam es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de sus clientes concentrados en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y el comercio, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de uniformes escolares. Ella vende uniformes, buzos, zapatos y ropa en general a sus clientes, Miriam ofrece sus productos de acuerdo a la temporada del año y adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, Miriam ha llegado a tener clientes fieles que a su vez han promocionado su negocio, lo que ha generado un crecimiento en su demanda, por ello ha creído conveniente adquirir mas uniformes para ampliar su negocio y de ese modo percibir mayores ganancias. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Miriam es una persona trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam, 44, is a mother who lives with her family in the Olmos district, a district known for having the majority of its clients concentrated in rural areas with much distance between them. The main economic activities in this area are agriculture and business. It belongs to the Lambayeque province and is located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years Miriam has sold school uniforms. She sells uniforms, jumpers, shoes and general clothing to her customers. Miriam offers her products according to the season and acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo. Thanks to the amount of time she has spent working in this sector, Miriam has gained loyal customers who have promoted her business, which has generated a growth in demand; so she has seen fit to buy more uniforms to expand her business and earn more income. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan of 2000 soles with Edpyme Alternativa. Miriam is a hard-working person who is devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a businessperson to be able to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Uniforms to expand her business

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora. María O. es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive en la parroquia Santa Ana la misma que es reconocida por su belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y también a la ganadería.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, es divorciada y en su unión ha concebido 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 22, 19 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan  en los gastos del hogar, su última hija estudia en la escuela de la localidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que por el momento vive en una casita prestada por un pariente.

La Señora María se dedica a la limpieza de casas hace muchos años, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. y también se da su tiempo para criar animales.

 Es nuestra socia hace 6 años siendo incentivada por una amiga que pertenece a la banca comunal,  su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María O. is a member of the communal bank "10 de Agosto." She lives in the Santa Ana parish, which is known for its natural beauty. Here the people work in agriculture and livestock production. Maria is 36 years old and divorced. In her marriage she conceived 3 children who are now 22, 19 and 11 years of age. Her oldest two children work and help her with the household expenses. Her youngest daughter studies in the local school. She does not have her own house, at the moment she lives in a small house that she rents from a relative. Maria has worked cleaning houses for many years. She works from Mondays to Fridays from 8am until 6pm, and this also gives her time to raise animals. Maria was motivated to join the communal bank 6 years ago by a friend who belonged to the group. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of chicken and chicken feed. Her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken feed

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en: Liezl V. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 25 years old. Liezl is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Liezl runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Liezl has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Liezl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezl is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Liezl from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
From the town of Trento, Maria S., a 49-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises hogs for fattening and manages a sari-sari store. Maria says, "I want my family to have a better living standard; that's why I work hard to give it to them."

Maria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new one in the amount of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure, livestock feed, and additional store inventory. Maria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure, livestock feed, and additional store inventory

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in a small city called Borewala located in south Punjab Pakistan. She is 47 years old and has been living in this city for the last 13 years with her husband, an electrician,  and four children. One daughter is a teacher in nearby school; her eldest son is also an electrician.  Razia owns and operates a sewing business to support her family financially. She takes orders for clothing from her nearby community and generates income by completing them. 

Razia’s husband wants to expand his business by buying more electric tools so that both he and her son will be able to serve for more customers. Presently, they both use the same tools resulting in one of them having to wait for the other to be finished with the tools.. Razia is hopeful that they will be able to successfully upgrade their business and improve the family’s financial condition. She is in her second loan cycle and is a responsible loan user of Asasah. 

Note: In this photo, Razia is showing one of her dress which she sews by herself.

loans.use: Purchase electric tools

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha L. is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old and is single. Editha owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Editha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Editha plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jessica Rocio

texts.es:
Jessica de 20 años, tiene una tienda pequeña pero bien surtida de víveres, vive en  una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Debido a la demanda de los víveres ella comenzó a comprar enlatados, arroz y aceite ya que el papa fue una motivación para que ella tuviera su tienda, poco a poco con esfuerzo y algunos sacrificios, ahora trabaja en su propio negocio a tan corta edad. Tiene un hijo de un año y por el trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar un congelador para su tienda, en el futuro quiere ampliar mas su negocio y así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica is 20 years old and has a small store that is well-stocked with provisions. She lives in an urban area called “Las Orquídeas”, which was named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered.

As a result of the demand for provisions, Jessica began buying canned goods, rice, and oil. Her father motivated her to open her store. With a little bit of effort and some sacrifices, she now works in her own business for someone who is so young. Jessica has a one year old child and works every day from 7:30am until 10pm.

She plans to use the loan to buy a freezer for her store. In the future, she wants to expand her business so that she can secure her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun C. (photo), and her husband, Mr. Chhorn Kek, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1978. 

Savun and her husband are rice farmers. The couple hopes to supplement their income by starting a new business farming fish.  Savun is asking for a loan of $500 to launch the business.

loans.use: To launch a fish-farming business.

loans.name: Nyubang

texts.en: Nyubang P. is currently in the business of selling bread and local brew and is requesting a loan to stock more brewing supplies. Nyubang is 39 years old and is married to a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.use: To stock more brewing supplies.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene un pequeño bebe de un año y cuatro meses. Su esposo es ebanista.

Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería  en su casa, donde realizan muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas y camas, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 17h00. Realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento y también entrega en Manta y Portoviejo en algunos  almacenes de esas ciudades. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus obras. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya seis años y le gusta por los beneficios y créditos que realizan. Sus sueños son tener su casa bien construida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the Sequita parish. It belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous Manabitan canton full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish where the residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.  

In this place, we find Maria. She is 24 years old, married and has a four and a half month old baby. Her husband is cabinetmaker. 

Her husband has a cabinetmaking workshop in their house where they do a lot of work in wood such as furniture, chairs and beds. She works Mondays through Saturdays from 8 am until 5 am. She does work for people from their establishment and also deliver to Manta and Portoviejo at some stores in those cities. She buys the wood at a lumberyard in Madera.  

This loan will be used to buy raw materials to do the work. She has been in the communal bank for six years and she likes the benefits and loans that they do. Her dreams are to have a well built house and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Jenniffer

texts.en: Jenniffer is a 29-year-old married lady with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is to develop her business and educate her children. Jennifer is a tailor. In four years, she has managed to purchase a sweater machine and a sewing machine. She has the challenge of limited capital and seasonal tenders. That is why she intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children to avoid being chased from school.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida lives in a historic city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Nawaz Moore. 

She is a 35-year-old lady who gave birth to 2 sons and 2 daughters.  Only her daughter is able to get an education and is studying in 3rd class. Her elder son operates his own business and the younger one works in a factory.
 
Her husband has a business selling fruits and vegetables. His shop is located in the market from where he operates his business.  Zahida herself is a seamstress. She works fulltime, receiving orders from her neighboring clients and sewing beautiful clothes to earn an income for the family. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more seasonal fruits & vegetables to sell  through his shop. He has been doing this business for over 20 years and Zahida is hopeful that after an investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him larger profits. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sylvend

texts.fr: Sylvend K. est agriculteur de canne à sucre.  Il a 46 ans, il est marié, et il a 5 enfants entre 1 an et 16 ans.  Il a une éducation primaire, et 3 de ses enfants vont a l’école.    Il va utiliser son prêt pour l travail de cultiver les cannes a sucre, et payer la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir la modernisation dans la plantation des cannes à sucre, et augmenter la main d’œuvre des cultivateurs pour avoir une bonne récolte.  Il voudrait élever la récolte de canne a sucre au maximum possible, et se mettent ensemble, étant comme des cultivateurs des canne a sucre pour cherche d’autre marché des canne a sucre.  Pour la famille et la vie, il voudrait assurer le bien être de sa famille, scolarise les enfants en payant les frais scolaires, épargner de scolariser les enfants, et habiter dans un endroit confortable.
texts.en:
Sylvend K. is a sugar cane farmer. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 children between the ages of 1 and 16 years. He has a primary education, and 3 of his children attend school.

Sylvend is going to use his loan for the work of growing sugar cane and paying the labor costs. His strategy for the growth of his business is to modernize the sugar cane plantation and expand the farming workforce in order to have a good harvest. He would like to increase the sugar cane harvest as much as possible and get together with the sugar cane farmers in order to seek out other sugar cane markets.

For his family and his life, Sylvend would like to assure the well-being of his family, educate his children by paying their educational fees, save to send the children to school and live in a comfortable place.

loans.use: The work of farming sugar cane, paying labor costs

loans.name: Maama

texts.en:
Maama Y. is married and has seven dependents. She cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) and yam at Abura and sells it by moving from one area to another. 

Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  

She will use the loan to purchase more yams to cook for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

In this photo, Maama is showing the cooked yam.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to cook for sale

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a 60-year-old widow who supports her family by selling vegetables and spices. She lives in Aborlan, Palawan. Ma. Luz joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Luz has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy vegetables and spices to sell at the market to continue to save up for future family needs. Ma. Luz is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Charles S. est agriculteur.  Il a 29 ans, célibataire, et né a Rwanda.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 600 kgs de pommes de terre, 1 pompe pour l’insecticide, 300 kgs d’engrais, 150 kgs de détanes (type d’insecticide0, et payement de main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’augmentation de fonds, utilisation de semences sélectionnées, et il cherchera le matériel de transport dans son business.  Il voudrait l’amélioration de la capacité de son activité, et mettre et chercher le comptoir de vente de ses produits dans son district.  Il voudrait aussi assurer le bien-être de sa famille tout en améliorant la politique d’épargne.  Charles et agent d’AGROFA (organisation Rwandais pour les agriculteurs), et aussi élévateur des vaches.
texts.en: Charles S. is a farmer. He is 29 years old, single and was born in Rwanda. He will use his loan to buy 600 kilograms of potatoes, a pump for insecticide, 300 kilograms of fertilizer and 150 kilograms of détane (insecticide), as well as hire workforce. His strategy for the growth of his business consists in increasing his working capital, using first-class seeds and looking for adequate transportation means. He would like to improve his production capacity and select an appropriate sales spot in his district to sell his products. He wants to provide a good living standard to his family and at the same time save more money. Charles is a representative of Agrofa, a farmers' organization in Rwanda. And he rears cattle.

loans.use: To buy 600 kilograms of potatoes, a pump for insecticide, 300 kilograms of fertilizer and 150 kilograms of détane (insecticide), as well as hire workforce

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es: Silvio se dedica a una joyería, hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Inicio con la ayuda de su hermana ya que siempre se ha preocupado por proporciónale a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Su mayor desafío es la compra del oro que es muy cara, pero con el paso el tiempo es que ha logrado que sus proveedores le brinden este producto a un precio accesible.  Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues han sido de gran ayuda para mantener activo su negocio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de oro pues actualmente tiene cierta demanda.
texts.en: For the past 18 years, Silvio has made his living as a jeweler.  He started the business with the help of his sister and has always been concerned about providing his family with the necessary income.  His greatest challenge is the purchase of gold, which is very expensive.  However, over time, its suppliers have been able to offer this product at an affordable price. This is not the first time that he has requested loans as they have been a great help in keeping his business active.  This loan is for the purchase of gold because it is currently in demand.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn, maseca cornmeal, beans, wood and pork to make nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and increase tortilla sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 40 years old and married with one child.

Irma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Irma has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from a carenderia/eatery.

Irma aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. is a 32-year-old married woman and mother. She lives in Kompong Cham and she and her husband have three children who live with them. Mao is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since her children were young. Currently, she earns a living by cultivating different kinds of crops on a plot of land that she owns. Her husband helps her in the farming business. 

Mao is requesting a loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house. This is a good location for farming and she will rent out the land to farmers for a fee. Her loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Karina Del Milagro

texts.es:
Karina tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en Puerto Eten, un distrito pequeño urbana rural que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Sus actividades principales en esta zona son la pesca, comercio, crianza de animales de engorde y artesanía.

Karina se dedica a la confección de gorros para confeccionistas mayoristas. Tiene su pequeño taller en su vivienda. Recientemente ha adquirido una máquina de coser, la cual le ayuda a realizar con más eficiencia su trabajo. Cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana menor. Tiene más de 06 años en esta actividad y sus principales clientes son vendedores mayoristas de gorros y prendas de vestir de la zona. 

El destino del crédito será para la compra de materiales y otros implementos para la confección de sus gorros ya que le generará un mayor ingreso y ayudará mejorar su calidad de vida. El mercado para su producto es muy bueno y rentable. Karina desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para crecerlo y un día tener su propia tienda donde puede vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old, single, and has no children. She lives in her parents' house, which is located in Puerto Eten, a small rural/urban district that belongs to the province of Chiclayo. Her main activities in this area are fishing, trade, raising and selling animals. and artesanal rafts.   

Karina makes hats for wholesale clothing makers. She has her own small workshop in her home. recently, she has acquired a sewing machine, which helps her do her job more effciently. She has the help of her younger sister. She has been doing this activity for 6 years and her main customers are wholesale merchants of hats and clothing in the area. 

The loan will be used to buy materials and more tools to make her hats since this will generate more income and help her improve her quality of life. The market for her job is very good and profitable. Karina wants to keep investing in her business to grow it and one day have her own store where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy materials and more tools to make hats.

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es: Iccel es casada su esposo trabaja como conductor, con su apoyo ha puesto su propio negocio una pulpería siendo de una gran importancia económica para los beneficio de su familia. Sus planes que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente, en el negocio captar mayores clientela. En su pulpería vende productos de uso diario. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería en mayores cantidades y variedad como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, jabones, detergente,  lampazos, variedades de bisutería, cereales, refrescos, lácteos entre otros productos que le generara mayores ganancias ofreciéndole a su familia mejores beneficios.
texts.en: Iccel is married and her husband works as a driver.  With his support she set up a general store because it is very important for the financial needs of her family.  Her plans are that her children study to be professionals.  In her business she wants to  have more customers and she sells a variety of everyday items in her store.  She will use the loan to buy larger quantities and a greater variety of merchandise such as: rice, beans, oil, soaps, detergent, mops, different types of costume jewelry, cereals, soft drinks, dairy products and other items that will give her higher earnings so that she can offer more to her family

loans.use: To buy products to stock her general store

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en: Rhona lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, six of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Rhona has had a business selling firewood and charcoal in the market for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bundles of firewood. Her main business challenges are the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to have a tailoring school and also to start sewing bridal gowns. Rhona lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Mère de 03 enfants et âgée de 31ans, Mme Ayélé a démarré son activité (vente de mais, huile, farine) en 2007.  Elle a 03 enfants et mariée à un frigoriste. Elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Akodessewa et revend de façon ambulante. Elle veut renforcer son activité, avoir son propre magasin et prendre soin de ses trois enfants c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce troisieme crédit pour acheter des stocks.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ayélé is 31 years old. She is married to a refrigerationist, and they have three (3) children). She sells maize, oil, and flour, an activity she launched in 2007. She buys her stock at the Akodessewa market and sells door to door. 

She is seeking a third loan to stock up on merchandise and strengthen her business, acquire her own store, and take care of her three children.

loans.use: to buy maize and oil for resale

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Liwayway works hard to support her family.

She has a buy & sell of dried and fresh fish business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from raising hogs.. Liwayway is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried & fresh fish to sell for her business.

Liwayway has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to purchase a motorcycle for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of dried & fresh fish to sell,

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz comes from the village of Sagholasheni, Kareli District. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, Inga, 20 year-old daughter and 18 year-old son.  The son and daughter are in school.  Teimuraz and Inga earn a living through farming activities. They cultivate a  family-owned 1.5 hectare plot of land. They grow tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, onions, haricot beans and strawberries. Harvested vegetables and berries are sold locally in the village to the green grocery retailers, as well as to the local population. 

This is the high season in farming.  Teimuraz requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers and insecticides as well as for paying workers who help the family fertilize and treat vegetables with different parasites. The family will get a better harvest and a good income from sales. Teimuraz and Inga plan to use part of the income for the children’s education and the other part for covering the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides and to pay workers

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura de 57 años, natural de la ciudad de San Miguel,  vive en su propia casa al lado de su amado esposo Efraín de 60 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena estabilidad para el mejor porvenir de ellos. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar, ella la ayudaba a labrar la tierra, pero a medida que iba desarrollándose se aparto de sus padres y monto su propio negocio, venta de carnes de res, por el cual no se arrepiente por nada. Ella usualmente se levanta a las 04 de la mañana para llevar al camal sus animales para luego derivarlos a su carnicería y expenderlo a sus clientes,. Se siente contenta con su puesto de ventas, por que gracias a ello educa a sus hijos y a la vez compró su propio lote de terreno donde cobija a toda su familia. Maura desde que se enteró sobre los créditos que la institución MFP brinda apoyo a las personas con miras a progresar, no dudo en participar y solicitar su crédito. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, es por ello espera de su colaboración para poder comprar lo solicitado, a la vez se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros prestamos posteriormente. Con el dinero que solicita, comprará un par de reses para luego engordarlos y  posteriormente sacar provecho.
texts.en:
Maura, 57, is from the city of San Miguel.  She lives in her own house with her beloved husband, Efraín, 60, and their three children for whom she wants to provide optimum stability for their future benefit.  When she was young, her parents taught her the meaning of hard work and she helped them plow the fields.  But as she grew up and became independent from her parents, she set up her own business selling beef and she has never regretted it.

She usually gets up at 4:00 a.m. to begin her daily task of attending to the livestock and opening her butchery and attending to customers.  She is very happy with her sales business and has been able to educate her children thanks to her income.  She also has bought enough land to take care of all the family.  Since Maura found out about the loans granted through the MFP institution for people wanting to get ahead, she had no doubts about participating and requesting a loan.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is counting on your support.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time because she would like to request future loans.  She plans to use this one to buy two cows for future sale.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Rene Adalid

texts.en: Rene lives in Choluteca, Honduras where he runs a metalworking shop. He has had this business for the past 8 years and works for commercial customers as well as private homeowners. Rene is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL to purchase materials.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, corrugated tin, iron, and solder

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years old and blessed with four children. For eleven years, she has been operating a cafeteria. She was previously employed, before she went into the business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business. This is because she has been trained in business management skills.

Margaret dreams of owning a big hotel in the future. She needs 30,000 Kenya shillings to expand her business premises.

loans.use: to expand her business premise.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.en:
Pablina is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has two grown children. She weaves various products out of lampakanay plant, an aquatic herb used in making mats, ropes, baskets, etc. Her husband is working too but is impermanent and this activity primarily helps them to cover everyday needs. She is able to earn an approximate totals of PHP 2,500 a month.

In 2010, Pablina became a GDMPC member. For the second time around, she is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to acquire raw materials for weaving. She has orders to work on and be delivered at the agreed time. She hopes to finish them earlier and develop new product designs to distribute in the marketplace or in point of sale areas. Pablina plans to obtain enough of this resource and expand business operations to gain more income for the household.

loans.use: To acquire raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a businesswoman who is married and blessed with six children. For the last 13 years, she has been tailoring to earn a living. In the next five years, she wants to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine and fabric. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 44 years of age, married and has four children. Her husband operates their tricycle for passengers’ transportation. 

Juanita is determined mother who has the attitude and dreams to succeed. She has been managing her sari-sari store business for 10 years. She usually sells snack foods and drinks to people in their village. Through the income she generates from the business, Juanita sustains her children's necessities. 

Juanita is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coffee, sugar and milk to sell. Juanita hopes to get higher profits to further support her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar and milk to sell.

loans.name: Kisiwa B Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Kisiwa B group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Beatrice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to attain food security for her family and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a very good maize yield harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Kisiwa B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Beatrice is pictured above with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela es socia D. banco comunal Las Triunfadoras D. Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos mayores de edad.
Se dedica al negocio de las decoraciones, ya sea con telas o globos, depende D. gusto D. cliente, y para trabajar con comodidad tiene que invertir en la compra de insumos de primera calidad, de esa manera brindar un buen servicio.
Con su nuevo préstamo  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 metros de tela color dorado, 3 metros de tela color rojo,3 metro de tela color verde limón, 3 metros de tela color naranja, 3 metros de tela color amarillo, 3 metros de tela color morado, 5 metro de tela color blanco, 10 metros de tela morado, 10 metros de tela color rosado.
Al tener variedad de colores le va ser más fácil realizar su trabajo contando con una gama de variedad.  Este trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de su hijo,  quien es el que se encarga de transportar las cosas que necesitan para decorar el local solicitado.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the communal bank Las Triunfadoras, ‘The Winners,' from the Calleria District, Ucayali Department. She is 50, married, and has two grown children. 

She has a decorating business using fabric or balloons, depending on the tastes of her clients. To make her work more convenient, she has to invest in the purchase of the best quality materials to offer good service. 

With her new loan of 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles she will purchase 3 meters each of gold, red, lime green, orange, yellow, and purple fabric. She will also purchase 5 meters of white fabric, 10 meters of purple fabric, and 10 meters of pink fabric. 

Having a range of colors makes it easier for her to do her work. She does her work with the help of her son, who is in charge of transporting the decoration supplies to the area requested.

loans.use: purchase wholesale fabric

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Nilda; es conviviente; la socia tiene 31años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia sigue teniendo una tienda de abarrotes,ella sigue vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y fideos,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,fideos y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nilda, 31, has a spouse and three children.  She continues running her grocery store selling basic staple items like sugar, rice, milk and noodles.  She works from 6am until 10pm and is able to support her children with this business.  She wants to expand the grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles and cookies at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy staple merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Thiane

texts.fr:
Mme Thiané Seck est une vendeuse de fruits et légumes, elle est basée chez elle , et elle fait en même temps de la marchande ambulante,elle s'active depuis plus de 20 ans dans ce secteur d'activité. 
 Elle s'approvisionhne au niveau de Kounghél et a dakr parfois,elle fait des voyages de genres une fois toues les semaines, et la semaines suivante ellle revient vers thiés ^pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientéle de thiés. 
 Avec ce prêt elle veut réalisér un bénéfice afin de pouvoir acheter un lit pour sa fille et réinvestir le reste comme fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Thiané Seck sells fruits and vegetables. Her business is based at her home, but she also sells on foot. She has 20 years of experience in this business. Thiané obtains her supplies in  Kounghél and sometimes in Dakar. She travels once a week and the following week, returns to Thies to meet demand from her local customers.

With this loan, she wants to make a profit so that she can buy a bed for her daughter and reinvest the rest as working capital.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 37-year-old father of four children. He is a proprietor of a bicycle repair shop in Buguta, Voi, that has been in operation for the last nine years. The business is doing well.

Jackson has requested a second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the money, he plans to purchase spare bicycle parts to make his business a one-stop shop for repairs and spares.

With the anticipated profits, he will expand his business and educate his children. Jackson hopes to purchase a commercial plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik, age 50, lives in Ddmashen village in the Sevan area with his mother, wife, son, and daughter. Gagik’s mother is a pensioner and his wife is unemployed. His daughter is a nurse, but at present she is working as a shop assistant. Gagik’s son is a student at the Gavar branch of Yerevan State University. Gagik himself graduated from Yerevan water conservation technical school, and after that he worked at different organizations. Now he is a pensioner. 

Since 2010, Gagik has been engaged in farming. On his farm he has four cows, two calves, and 20 chickens. Part of his agricultural produce (milk, meat, and eggs) he sells to his neighbors. Gagik’s wife helps him a lot and thus they provide for their family and pay for their son’s education. 

This is Gagik’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he has never been delayed in his repayments. Now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan in order to buy fodder for his farm animals, and he will also purchase a number of sheep, which will allow Gagik to develop his farm and to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and to buy a number of sheep

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en: Feliza is 53 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a single parent with two children, both of whom are married. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living by running a farm where she grows pineapples and bananas. She sells her goods to people who live in her community and earns about PHP 400 a day. She is applying for a loan for PHP 39,000 to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her farm. Her goal is to grow her business in the coming years. She regularly attends our fellowship meetings, where she studies the bible, builds social capital and repays loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ms. Ty is 30 years old with two school-age children. For five years, her main business activity has been buying and selling scrap products. Every month, she gets a stable income from this business. Since joining SEDA's credit program in 2007, she has used loans to expand her business. She is currently requesting a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy scrap products in bulk. With this, she can improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy scarp products  at big quantity

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia de 62 años de edad, esposa de Guillermo de 65 años, fruto de ese amor tiene a su único hijo que se quedo junto a ella  y viven en su propia casa. Para Mauricia su único objetivo es salir adelante; de niña empezó a estar metida en la chacra de sus padres, lo ayudaba sin cesar, y de jovencita ella vendía los productos que cosechaban sus padres y ganaba sus primeras propinas;  hoy tiene su propio terreno de cultivo, específicamente en la producción de Cacao, por el cual agradece profundamente a sus padres por el apoyo y las enseñanzas que lo dieron durante su permanencia; a ella le encanta trabajar. Mauricia se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno, una vez terminado con sus quehaceres se va a su chacra, conjuntamente con su esposo, desde muy temprano hasta el atardecer del día, casi todos los días de la semana, solo que ocasionalmente los Domingos deja de laboral para cuidar a su hijo que es un joven invalido. Regularme su producto los vende en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad, en efecto adquiere buenas ganancias, con la finalidad de que pueda cubrir su canasta familiar. En el futuro quiere ampliar su terreno de cultivo con el propósito de producir en grande cantidades y venderlos a precio de mercado. Este es su crédito numero 03 con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su banco comunal por la buena dirección que deciden. Con el dinero solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá en el mantenimiento idóneo de su terreno de cultivo como desyerbar y comprar abono, para que así prevenga riesgos que puedan contaminar su producto.
texts.en:
Muricia, 62, is Guillermo’s, 65, wife.  Her only son lives with her in their own house.  Mauricia’s only objective is to get ahead.  She started helping out in her parents’ fields when she was still a little girl.  She’d help them unceasingly and as a young girl would help them sell the products her parents harvested and started earning her first tips.  Today, she has her own field specifically used to grow cocoa beans that she profoundly thanks her parents for the support and knowledge they gave her while still here; she loves to work.

Mauricia rises very early to prepare breakfast and when she finishes her household chores she heads out to her fields with her husband working from very early until nightfall almost every day of the week although on Sundays she occasionally stops working to care for her son who is an invalid.

She normally sells her crops to the local gathering center and earns good profits actually to be able to buy basic family staples.  In the future, she’d like to expand her field to grow larger amounts to be sold at market prices.

This is MFP loan #3 that she commits to repay faithfully.  She thanks her communal bank for the good direction they decide on.  She will use the requested 2000 new soles to invest in the maintenance that’s fit for her type of soil like weeding and buying manure to prevent risks that could contaminate her products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 21 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con su pareja Yuri de 26 años en su casa alquilada. El trabajo al que Marleni se dedica, es a sus cultivos de cacao, café y coca. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en la ciudad de San Francisco en su propio negocio, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos la enfermen. Por ello desea ejercer otro rubro donde pueda tener más ingresos, como es la venta de zapatos exclusivos para poder vender a la gente de San Francisco. Este es el crédito numero 02 con MFP,  manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su negocio. En su banco comunal es muy querida por que siempre mantiene su carisma. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar zapatos y tener su tienda donde pueda vender más tranquila.
texts.en:
21-year old Marleni is a hardworking woman who lives with her 26-year old husband Yuri in a house that they rent. Marleni earns her living growing cocoa, coffee, and coca. Early every morning she starts work in her fields as she knows that the money she earns from the crops depends a lot of the quality of the harvest. 

She sells the produce in her own store in the town of San Francisco where her customers pay more.  She most enjoys harvesting the produce as she feels that the months of work have paid off. She’s been doing this work for five years; the most difficult part of the work is spraying the crops because there is always the danger that the chemicals will cause sickness.

For this reason Marleni would like a different line of work where she will earn more money such as selling shoes to the people of San Francisco. This is her second loan with MFP. The money will help her achieve her goal of starting a new business. She is well-liked by the members of her community bank because she is always good-natured. With the S/.2,000 she plans to buy shoes, open a store, and have peace of mind.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her new business

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is a 57-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 22 and 23. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family.

To earn a living, Apolonia buys and sells scrap materials such as bottles and plastic containers. She has been in this business for 5 years. Apolonia works hard to improve her earnings and help provide for her family's needs. She has requested this loan to buy more scrap to sell.

In the future, Apolonia hopes that her family's living situation will improve.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Grellanita

texts.en:
Cyrus Jay is 20 years old and is fourth of four children in the family. 

Grellanita a member of NWTF and a mother of Cyrus Jay (a student who is in the picture) is borrowing 6000 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of school year 2014-2015.

Cyrus Jay is currently in the 2nd year of the 4-year Bachelor of Science in Criminology program.

When he graduates, Cyrus Jay plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Courageuse et très dévoué, cette dame a une parfaite maitrise du travail parce qu'elle a une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama, âgée de 51 ans est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont 01 garçon et 01 fille. Elle possède un restaurant ou elle vend les différents repas ( petit déjeuné, déjeuner et diné).

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs de 50 kg de riz à 13500f l'un et 40 litre d'huile raffiné à 1000f le litre.Après préparation, le plat est revendu à 800f pour le déjeuné et 700f pour le diné.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’une part de payer ses intérêts et d’épargner, d’autres part de participer à la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
There are good relationships between the members of this group created on December 6, 2010. The women have been living in the same village for a long time, and nurture bonds of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Mariama, 51 years of age and standing all the way to the right, is the group’s highlighted borrower. She is married and a mother of two, a boy and a girl. She buys cows that she resells to butchers at the weekly markets. She is expert in this business.

With her new loan, she plans to purchase three cows at 150,000 XOF each, for an individual resale price to butchers of 165,000 XOF.

Profits will allow her on the one hand to repay her loan and to save, and on the other to contribute to the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase three cows to retail to butchers.

loans.name: Nelson Ramon

texts.en:
I have been selling milk products for two years which has helped me support my family. My business is well known for the high quality of product I sell. It is very well liked by my clients. My major buyers are the owners of small corner stores and my neighbors.

Loan Use: Purchase butter, curd and milk

Vendo lacteos desde hace 2 años y me genera ingresos necesarios para sostener a mi familia. Mi negocio ahora es bastante conocido ya el producto que vendo es de alta calidad y es bastante gustado por mis clientes. Mis mayores compradores son los dueños de pulperias y vecinos de mi colonia.

loans.use: Compra de queso, mantequilla, cuajada, quesillo y leche.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 30 year-old woman who lives at Abokobi, Accra, Ghana. Her dream is to own one of the biggest supermarkets in her community. Kraban Support Foundation's (KSF's) TEACH program has helped her open a retail shop. Now she wishes to take another step toward her supermarket focus, and she is seeking a loan of $1000.00 to grow her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Wathoni would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Marcos G. first went into business about ten years ago with a simple food stand. He sells encebollados (a stew made with yuca and tuna) and other dishes. His wife and daughter help run the business. He has built up a good clientele, and today he has two business locations.

Purpose of Loan

He would use the loan to buy supplies, tables, and chairs for his business. Now that his clientele is growing, there isn't enough room to serve his clients well.

About the Applicant

Mr. G. is fifty-four. He has four children. One daughter is in school. He lives in a cane house, and his goal is to own a large business that his children will someday run.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Don Marcos empezó su negocio hace 10 años el se inicio vendiendo en una carretilla como ambulante, vende encebollados los mismos que le ayudan con la atención su esposa y su hija pues su negocio a desarrollado notablemente a tal punto que hoy cuenta con dos locales.

Uso del Préstamo

Con el crédito a que se le otorgue quiere comprar mas mercadería para su local y realizara adecuaciones tales como compra de mesas y sillas ya que sus clientes han aumentado y el espacio es muy pequeño para poder atender con excelencia.

Información Personal

tiene 54 años y cuatro hijos de los cuales una de ellas estudia s u vivienda es de caña y su meta e tener un local grande para que en el futuro sus hijos puedan administrarlo.

loans.use: Purchase of tables, chairs, and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Laura Maria Luciano

texts.pt:
Laura is a mother of 5 children and she lives with her children's father. She joined the credit program in 2006. She prepares meal in a parking lot for travelers and she has seen her business grow steadily. She uses the profits from it to help her husband pay for heir living expenses. She also pays for their children education cost since they all go to school. He future plans include opening up her own restaurant if business continue to grow in the same manner.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

laura e solteira e mae de 5 filhos. Ela vive com o pai dos seus filhos.Laura entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Ela confecciona refeicoes numa praca de autocarros para os viajantes.O negocio dela esta a crescer.Cm os rendimentos ela ajuda o marido a pagar todas as despesas da casa. Ela paga tambem a escola dos seus filhos pois que todos eles vao a escola. Ela pensa no futuro abrir um restaurante se tudo continuar a correr como tem corrido ate entao. mas isto e um plano de futuro.

loans.use: Laura wishes to purchase products to prepare more meals.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla B. (pictured on the left) makes traditional Azerbaijani carpets with the help of her business partners in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She currently lives in Devechi with her husband and child. This will be Leyla’s fourth loan from Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that she is one of our valued customers. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that she can purchase more of the high-quality supplies she utilizes in making these beautiful traditional carpets.

loans.use: To purchase supplies used in the carpet-making process

loans.name: Delia Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita's husband had to go to the United States to look for a beter future for their family. However Margarita's husband took a long time to be able to find a job. It is because of this that in order to pay the daily expenses of her children, she began to sell clothes at a market close to her house in order to make money. And little by little she began to get customers, actually continuing to work in this business since her husband sent her money once a month and on occaision more time would pass between when he would send her money.

Actually Margarita is requesting a loan of US $300 that she is arranged to pay back in a four month term, and with this money Margarita will be able to purchase merchandise in order to have a greater variety in her merchandise. Since the clothing she has in not for winter and her cutomers are looking for winter clothes. With your help Margarita will be able to stay ahead of her children and help her husband to go forward while he looks for a better life for them all.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El esposo de Margarita se tuvo que ir a Estados Unidos a buscar un mejor futuro para su familia. Sin embargo el esposo de Margarita tardó tiempo para poder conseguir un empleo. Es por eso que para poder pagar los gastos diarios de sus dos hijos, comenzó a vender ropa en un mercado cerca de su casa para poder sacar dinero. Y poco a poco comenzó a hacerse de clientes, actualmente sigue trabajando en este negocio puesto que su esposo le manda dinero cada mes y en ocasiones pasa más tiempo en que le envía dinero.

Actualmente Margarita está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Margarita podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener más variedad en su mercancía. Puesto que la ropa que tiene no es de invierno y sus clientes andan buscando ropa para invierno. Con tu ayuda Margarita podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante por mientras él busca una mejor vida para todos.

loans.use: Purchase winter merchandise - Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Burhonjon

texts.en:
F. Burhonjon is 41 years old. He is married with three children. 

Burhonjon inherited his business and has already been involved in the confectionary business for 32 years.  He specialises in producing confectionary such as lump sugar, and the national sweets known as “nabot” which is made of sugar syrop and cooked in a huge cauldron for several hours and then left for hardening up to 2 weeks. People say it is very healthy. This business is the main source of income for Burhonjon’s family and provides him with a stable business in which to support his family.

Burhinjon has been working with IMON since 2005. For the entire period he has never had any problems managing his loans. This time Burhonjon requests 600.00 US Dollars in order to purchase the input materials for his production such as flour, sugar. Part of the loan will also be used to improve his working conditions. Burhonjon is confident that he will be able to pay the loan back in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials like flour, sugar and improving the conditions of work.

loans.name: Bulwa C Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Pollin K.. She has a business frying and selling snacks and is requesting a loan to boost her business. Pollin is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 6 children ranging from age 9 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Pollin makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees. Pollin has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in order to invest in her business and she paid the loan back on time.

Pollin is joined in her small group by Ruth N., Harriet Z., Elizabeth N., and Ruth N.. Ruth N. has a retail shop and wants to purchase a refrigerator. Harriet Z. has a pharmacy and wants a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. Elizabeth N. raises poultry and sells vegetables and wants to purchase more poultry feed. Ruth N. is a tailor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth and fabric.

loans.use: To add in snack business

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Hortencia M. sells clothing and shoes, an activity that she started more than 10 years ago when a friend invited her to help her sell. Later, she started to sell alone at a time when her husband was unemployed. She had to move ahead with paying to support their children, such as paying for bills and their education.

Currently, she needs a credit of $475, which she will repay in 6 months, to supply seasonal footwear and have a better sales opportunity. With your support, Hortencia will continue contributing to the well-being of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hortencia M. se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos actividad que inicio hace mas de 10 años cuando una amiga la invito a ayudarla a vender y después ella empezó sola en ese tiempo su esposo se quedo sin empleo y tenia que sacar adelante los pagos de la manutención de sus dos hijos, así como recibos de servicios y escuela.

Actualmente ella requiere un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir calzado de temporada y tener una mayor oportunidad de venta. Con tu apoyo Hortencia seguirá contribuyendo la bienestar de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dalamoiya Group

texts.en:
Bockary C. is 38 years old and is married with 4 children. He is the leader of this group, whose livelihood depends on farming. The group is happy that Kiva can provide loans for agricultural activities.

The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000 ($700 USD) to increase their farm activities. The loan will be mainly used for purchasing rice and vegetable seeds, fertilizer and hiring labourers. Bamba M. and Hawa K. would like to grow vegetables to sell.

All members of the Dalamoiya group are engaged in farming as their source of income. They all want to improve their yields and expand their farms and hope to use a loan from Kiva to do so.

loans.use: To buy rice and vegetable seeds and fertilizer and to hire labourers.

loans.name: Imam

texts.en:
Imam is 51-years-old, lives in the town of Khachmaz with his wife and two children.

He has repaired houses for five years and is requesting a loan of $975 to purchase the necessary materials for improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase home repair materials

loans.name: Abdellatif

texts.en: Abdellatif B. is 32 years old, single and lives in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. He is a hair stylist and barber for men, and is known for the special creativity and cleverness with which he approaches his work. He has applied for a loan of $1,200, his first from Al Majmoua, to buy the ingredients he needs to make his own line of hair gel.

loans.use: To buy raw materials needed to make hair gel.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
