Stella is 21 years,She is a married woman with 2 children aged 5 and 4. Also take care of 2 other children ages between the 5 and 4 years old. She became a a poultry owner in 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Stella now hopes for a loan to buy more poultry for her business.

loans.use: To increase her poultry stock.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
For the past six years, Gladis has had a general store in her home. For 16 years she sold cosmetic products and clothing on order, but since she had to start taking care of her grandchildren, she decided to start a general store in her house. She offers all kinds of basic commodities.

The loans she has requested have been used to stock her store with products and to buy a display cabinet.

Gladis would like to have a larger cabinet and a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 6 años, Gladis tiene una bodega en su casa. Durante 16 años ella vendió cosméticos y ropa por pedidos, pero como tuvo que empezar a cuidar a sus nietos, decidió instalar una bodega en su casa. Ella ofrece toda clase de productos de primera necesidad.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para surtir su bodega con productos y para comprarse una vitrina exhibidora.

A Gladis le gustaría adquirir una vitrina más grande y un congelador.

loans.use: stock her store with products and to buy a display cabinet (Para surtir su bodega con productos y para comprarse una vitrina exhibidora.)

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run S., 26, is married and resides with her two children in Battambong, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been selling groceries to earn a living and is able to make around US$ 6 in profit each day. Her husband, Uth Dam, 36, is a teacher in the village and normally he makes US$ 3 each day as well to support the family. Both their children are enrolled in school.

Run would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to add to her inventory of grocery products. She says that in the village there are many vendors who operate similar businesses so she needs to diversify her products, otherwise she will lose her customers.

loans.use: To add to her grocery's inventory

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
Maria Elsa S. es una comerciante qeu se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras teniendo su propio establecimiento en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Estelí de donde es originaria.

Con la necesidad de mantener a sus dos hijos por requerir el apoyo de su madre, se ha esforzado cabalmente en la venta de sus productos para obtener mejores ingresos y así mejorar la situación de su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Por esta razón es que hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar las frutas y verduras y así ofrecerlas en el mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Elsa Maria S. is a trader dedicated to selling fruit and vegetables and has her own establishment in the municipal market in the city of Esteli where she is from. With the need to support her two children who require the support of their mother, she has worked fully selling her products to obtain better income and thus improve the situation of her family that requires her support. For this reason she has sought support from Ceprodel to obtain credit with which to buy fruit and vegetables to offer them in the market of her community.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Iver

texts.es: LA FAMILIA DE IVER ESTÁ COMPUESTA POR DOS PERSONAS, ÉL Y SU HIJITO DE CUATRO AÑOS DE EDAD. IVER SE DEDICA AL TRANPORTE DE PASAJEROS CUENTA CON DOS VEHICULOS PARA PODER OFRECER ESTE SERVICIO. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITÓ ES PARA PODER TERMINAR  LA CONSTRUCCION DE SU DOMICILIO. SU COMPORTAMIENTO EN LOS ANTERIORES CREDITOS QUE SE LE OTORGARON FUE MUY BUENO YA QUE TIENE UNA EXCELENTE CALIFICACIÓN POR LA PUNTUALIDAD EN SUS PAGOS.
texts.en:
The Iver family is comprised of two people: Iver and his little son who is four years old. Iver is dedicated to passenger transportation. He has two vehicles that he uses to offer this service. The loan that he has requested is to finish the construction of his home. His behavior with previous loans that were granted to him was very good since he has excellent qualifications due to the punctuality of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction.

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Nubia G. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a laborar en su negocio de venta de comestibles  tales como gaseosas, galletas y meneítos comercializados en el Mercado Oriental a la intemperie y con la necesidad de tener su propio tramo. 

Es importante destacar que ella es originaria del municipio de Ciudad Sandino y para llegar a su establecimiento en el Mercado Oriental, todos los días se levanta dese muy temprano para abordar los buses y estar puntual en su establecimiento.

La razón por la cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para su respectiva comercialización en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
With great effort Mrs. Nubia G. works selling food products such as soda pop, cookies, and snacks in the open air Oriental Market and by necessity has her own selling area. It is important to note that she is originally from Sandino City, and to arrive at her place in Oriental Market, every day she gets up very early to board the buses and be on time to her business. The reason she is seeking Ceprodel’s support is to obtain a loan that will allow her to buy the products she sells in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products to sell

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Originaire de Porto-Novo la capital politique du BENIN, dame H. Henriette est née en 1965 à Hlacomey un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou où elle vit actuellement avec son mari du nom de SAGBO Prosper un mécanicien  moto et ses deux filles dont la benjamine seule est scolarisée et est en classe de CE2. Elle vend des torchons, des serviettes, des plastiques et des habits pour enfants. Elle distribue certains de ses produits à ses clientes et va après trois jours recupérer ses fonds. Elle va s'approvisionner régulièrement au NIGERIA. Elle est à son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
A native of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, Mrs. Henriette H. was born in 1965 in Hlacomey, an outlying neighborhood of the town of Cotonou, where she lives at present with her husband, Prosper Sagbo, a motorcycle mechanic, and her two daughters, of whom only the younger is enrolled in school, in 3rd grade. She sells floor cloths, napkins, plasticware, and clothing for children. She distributes certain of her products to her customers and goes to get paid three days later. She goes regularly to stock up in Nigeria. This is her second loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of floor cloths, napkins, plasticware, and outfits for children

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: El sr. Juan de Dios,  tiene 52 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería que con mucho esfuerzos  pudo poner con ahorros y créditos desde hade nueve años, reside en laureles sur, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad,  que estudian la primaria, sus planes es poder comprar un vehiculo para no pagar en taxi cuando va de compra para llenar inventario de la pulpería, por  que lo de mas los camiones repartidores pasan, con este préstamo va  reforzar en productos enlatados como insumos diarios, y espera poder dar un mejor servicios a sus clientes, ya que gracias a estos préstamo de Afodenic puede hacer crecer su negocio. Que espera mas adelante hacer más grande, a si como ayudar a sus hijos puedan terminar el ciclo de estudio.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan de Dios is 52 years old. His business is running a local store which, with much effort, he was able to build up with savings and loans over the last nine years. He lives in Laureles Sur and he and his wife have 2 children, 7 and 14 years old, who are primary school students. His plan is to be able to buy a vehicle in order avoid paying for a taxi when he goes shopping to fill the inventory of the store because he is not on the route of most of the delivery trucks. With this loan he is going to increase the daily supplies he carries, like canned goods. He hopes to provide better service to his customers and thanks to this loan from Afodenic be able to make his business grow. He hopes later to make it larger, and help his children complete primary school.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy canned goods to supply his store.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City is a community where small-scale mining is prevalent and is the main source of income for the locals. But Melodina does not rely only on the income from her husband's gold panning because it is inadequate to raise their five children, four of whom are already in their primary education.

To help support her family, Melodina engages into food peddling in their village. Fortunately, she was able to acquire a loan from Kiva partner HSPFI, which she used to put up a carenderia (food stall). She plans to expand her food stall so she can accommodate more customers, and therefore she is requesting an additional loan from HSPFI amounting to PHP 11000 ($250 USD). She hopes that with the success of her carenderia business, she will be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: To expand her carenderia (food stall).

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hưng ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Gia đình chị có 2 con nhỏ và đều đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2006. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị là từ công việc rửa, sửa xe của chồng và từ chăn nuôi, làm ruộng của chị với thu nhập 3.500.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000 để mua thêm đồ nghề sửa xe cho chồng, mở rộng cửa hàng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. lives in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. She has two small children who are going to school. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2006. Currently, the income of the family is from bike wash, bike repair by the husband, and farming, livestock raising by herself with a total income of VND 3,500,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND 9,000,000 to buy additional tools for bike repair for her husband and to expand the workshop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for bike repair and expand the workshop

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is a 45-year-old mother of five. Her husband Eddie used to make charcoal. They live in a mountainous part of the village of Ilaures, Bugasong, Antique, on the island of Panay. After typhoon Frank, the strongest typhoon of 2008 that hit the province, damaging thousand of hectares of forests and rice fields, the couple felt guilty at what they are doing to the trees, just to feed their family when they sold the charcoal they were producing. 

When they heard of ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), entering their village providing loans to the poor, the couple got interested and applied for a loan to start a better business. Luzviminda applied for a loan to buy one pig for fattening, 10 chickens to raise and buy one sack of rice to sell. 

The couple is hoping to put up a business more friendly to the environment and is very optimistic to overcome the poverty by sending their five children to school to have a degree, and be a better citizen in the future.

loans.use: To buy a pig for fattening, 10 chickens, and one sack of rice for retail

loans.name: Mukaramakhon

texts.en:
Mukaramakhon K. is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Mukaramakhon's lack of a stable job and the slow productivity of her husband's business as an ecologist did not leave enough money to meet family expenses. For this reason, 10 years ago, Mukaramakhon decided to start her own business, selling fabrics for local cultural dresses. Little by little she made her business grow and by offering her clients a way to pay in installments greatly increased her revenue. Now her business is running smoothly. However, she would like to continue increasing her business so that her situation would be more stable in the future. She is asking for a loan of $ 800 USD that she will pay back in 6 months. With this money, Mukaramakhon will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for the local cultural dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fabrics for local cultural dresses.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice A. is the 30-year-old married mother of five children between the ages of 5 and 16. All of her children are in school. She lives in Dunga with her husband, who is currently unemployed. Eunice sells vegetables, purchased from Kibuye market in her town, but says that right now not many people can afford them and many rot. She hopes to use the loan for her children's school fees as well as to expand her business.

Eunice recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a Community Health Worker, she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To improve her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo R. is from the village of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old, married, and has one adult child. Wilfredo owns and operates a business selling fish to the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Wilfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica S. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao. She is 61 years old. Veronica is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Veronica operates a family member's business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. Veronica has been engaged in her business for more than 18 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Veronica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Veronica from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Venecia

texts.en:
Venecia M. is from the village of Lilo-an, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Venecia is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Venecia owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from hauling away plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Venecia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Venecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venecia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase used bottles, plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Venecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase used bottles, plastics and other recyclables to resell

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Sory S. is a 47-year-old village man who has had the job of fish-seller since he was single. Since early 2000, he has sold fresh fish that he buys from the people who earn a living as fisherman along the Tunle Sap River. He runs his business with his wife in the market and earns approximately $3 a day. The humble couple has four children who are going to school and are dependent on their parents’ income.

Sory S. has accumulated a number of clients but his stock of fish is not enough to serve them all. Therefore, he would like a loan to accumulate a larger quantity of fish to better meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of fish to better meet his customers’ needs

loans.name: Edjidodo Group

texts.fr: Cette association a vu le jour en 1999, elle est composée de 4 dames très dynamiques qui sont toutes mariées et mère de famille. Elles exercent toutes dans le commerce de produits alimentaires. Cette association a beaucoup d’expérience dans les œuvres sociales. Les membres de cette association veulent augmenter leur stock de marchandises pour gagner plus d’argent et réaliser des activités d’entraide raison pour laquelle l’association sollicite un crédit pour acheter divers produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
This association dates back to 1999. It is composed of 4 very dynamic women who are all married and the mothers of families. They all sell foodstuffs. This association has a lot of experience in helping others. The members of this association want to grow their stocks of merchandise so that they can earn more money and be able to continue to help others, the reasons why the association is requesting a loan to buy various foodstuffs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: San

texts.en: San K. is a single mother, as she is divorced; she has 5 children, two are single and the other 3 are married and live away from home.  She is 49 and lives in Sam Reap Province, the best territory for tourism. One of her sons, Chorn Vanna, 26, drives a motor taxi for a profit, and is shown in the photo. San K. sells food to students who study in the local secondary school. She requests a loan to enlarge her business in order to gain more valued customers. She will use her loan to buy extra essential ingredients and some attractive furniture.

loans.use: To buy extra essential ingredients and some attractive furniture

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Mrs. Kamala R. lives in Thikedewal, Lalitpur. She has one son and three daughters. Her son is in grade 12, her two older daughters are studying for a BBS (Bachelor in Business Studies) degree and her youngest daughter is in grade 7. A few years ago, her husband, Bal Ram R., died. She now has sole responsibility for her four children.

Mrs. R. makes different types of artificial flower decorations and sells her flower decorations in the local flower shop. She trained for one month at the flower training institution.

Mrs. R. is requesting a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy materials for her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 43 years old and married with six children aged between 12 and 20 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with seven people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Jesca works in a semi-urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall in Owino market selling cassava which she buys from suppliers who get it from villages. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale, and works six days a week. She pays transport costs to and from home. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises but only pays daily market dues of 500/=.

Jesca is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of food due to droughts in many parts of Uganda.

Jesca has been in this business for three years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her tenth loan and working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of cassava and potatoes. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to owning an established business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of cassava and potatoes

loans.name: Beth Njeri

texts.en:
Beth is 46 years old and married to Simon and they have two adult daughters. Beth moved to Gatundu, her current home town, due to post-election clashes which occurred in Kenya in 2007/2008. Her family lost everything they had invested but decided to move on with life. Her family members gave her a small amount of capital to start a business. Beth had been a teacher for fourteen years before deciding to venture into business making teaching-aid graphics for kindergarten.

Beth has been operating an art-class business for the past twelve years. She plans to expand her business and buy more materials with the loan she receives: i.e. plywood, paints and sealing papers.

Beth was introduced to Kiva partner KADET through an existing KADET client. She is applying for her first loan with KADET. With the extra profits, Beth intends to buy a piece of land and build a residential house.

Beth’s hopes and dreams are to open her own teaching-aid-graphics manufacturing company and to create job opportunities for the people in her community. She describes herself as an industrious lady, very innovative, and hardworking.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy plywood, paints and sealing papers for the art class that she teaches

loans.name: Member Good Group

texts.en:
The people you see here make up the Member Good group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who do business in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan to further strengthen their businesses. These entrepreneurs have received previous SMT/Kiva loans, for which they have thanked God because those loans have helped them feed their families, pay school fees and medical bills and more. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan to further improve their businesses.

Aminata S. (seen here in the middle) is the leader of the group. She was born in Robuya Romende, in northern Sierra Leone, and is 34 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is a police officer. Two of their children are in primary school, while the third is not yet of school-going age. Aminata sells ready-to-wear-clothes for children, and has been in this business for 19 years .

loans.use: To further strengthen and improve several small businesses

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La panadería de la señora Silvia es muy visitada por los clientes porque se ha caracterizado por elaborar todo tipo de pan como pan simple y pan dulce para ser comercializado en su establecimiento en el departamento de Chinandega. Ella es una dama muy trabajadora y tiene a su cargo unos trabajadores que le ayudan en la elaboración y horneado del pan. 
Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano se realiza la distribución del pan en diferentes partes y por medio de ese viaje se va entregando y ofreciendo en diferentes lugares. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar la materia prima para elaborar el pan para su respectiva venta en su localidad.
texts.en:
Silvia's bakery in Chinandega department is very popular with her customers because it has been known for making all kinds of bread, both savory and sweet. She is a very hard-working lady and has under her supervision some laborers who help her make and bake the bread. Every morning, from very early, bread is distributed to various parts and during the trajectory bread is delivered and offered for sale in different places. She requests financing to buy raw materials to make the bread for subsequent sales in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread-baking ingredients.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 40 years old, is married with two children, and takes care of three dependents. Both the children and dependents are aged between 11 and 14 years. Francoise and her family live in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

Francoise owns a public secretariat service where she deals with different computer services, such as typing, printing, photocopying, and other services. This is her ninth successful year in the secretarial business! The hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Although Francoise has been in the business for nine years, the profit is still too low for her to expand meaningfully. For that reason, she believes that additional capital would enable her business to progress. To end this, Francoise is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional computer accessories.

With this additional equipment, Francoise hopes that she will expand her business through hiring other people to assist in service delivery, as well as by improving the services provided to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional computer accessories

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Cecilia tiene 34 años y tiene tres hijos. La socia Cecilia es natural de la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa. La ciudad de Urcos se encuentra a 45 Km. de la Ciudad del Cusco aproximadamente a 45 minutos de viaje. 

La socia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su esposo y sus hijos. La socia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar tiene que ir a atender su puesto de venta que esta afuera del “Mercado Unidos de Urcos”. La socia vende todo tipo de artículos para la casa como por ejemplo espejos, escobillas, candados, chapas, sogas, focos, crema de zapato, jaboncillos, detergentes, etc.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de artículos del hogar y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El esposo de la socia es músico y toca el instrumento del acordeón en el grupo “Los delfines del Amor”. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un equipo de mezclador y ecualizador de pistas de música para apoyar a su esposo, pues necesita este equipo para animar fiestas de fin de año.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Cecilia is 34 years old and she has three children. Cecilia is a native of the city of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis, the department of Cusco and she belongs to the Asociación Arariwa’s Communal Bank “Qori Orcco”. The city of Urcos is located 45 Km. from the city of Cusco, approximately a 45 minute trip.

The member wakes up very early in order to do household tasks, like for example preparing breakfast for her husband and her children. After doing her household tasks, the member has to go to attend to her sales post which is outside of the “Mercado Unidos de Urcos”. The member sells all types of articles for the house like for example, mirrors, padlocks, plates, rope, light bulbs, shoe polish, detergent, etc. Now she has several years working in home goods sales and things have been going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. The husband of the member is a musician and plays the accordion in the group, “Los delfines del Amor”. The member needs the loan in order to buy a sound mixer and a track equalizer for music to support her husband who needs this equipment to liven up the end of the year parties.

She is grateful for the opportunity given through this resource and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a sound mixer and a track equalizer for music

loans.name: Kely Iris

texts.es:
La Sra. Kely vive en casa propia en la zona de Esmeralda norte -sacaba , como actividad economica tiene una tienda de barrio que esta ubicado en su domicilio, la cliente es de clase sencilla y humilde, es madre de cuatro niños, Ella mantiene el hogar.

En la tienda tiene una variedad de productos para vender entre ellos son : pan , leche ,refrescos , arroz , fideos otros, todos ellos de uso domestico.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Kely lives in her own house in the Esmeralda Norte neighborhood in Sacaba. Her source of income is a small store that she has in her house. She is an unassuming and humble person and is the mother of four children. She is the provider for her household. In her store she has a variety of products for sale, such as: bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, and noodles, among others. Everything is for household use. She is very grateful to Emprender [Kiva Field Partner] and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in her and for granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her small store.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el sector Cerro Santa Rosa del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de maracuyá (fruta tipica), ella tiene instalado en su terreno plantas que dan este fruto y cada cierto tiempo las cosecha y comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Olmos. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para solventar sus gastos personales.

María ha instalado recientemente media hectárea de cultivo con nuevas plantas, pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para brindarles el mantenimiento que necesitan, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y hacerse conocida en el medio.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, single, and lives in the Cerro Santa Rosa section of the District of Olmos, located two hours and fifteen minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than five years, María has been growing and selling passion fruit. She raises this crop on her own land and, at harvest time, sells the fruit at the market in the city of Olmos. This business is her only source of income, which enables her to cover her personal expenses.

María recently planted a half hectare of new plants, but she does not have enough money for the continued maintenance that is necessary. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 soles.

María is a hardworking and responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and become well-known in her occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her latest of crop of passion fruit

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es una mujer trabajadora de 51 años, está casada con Enrique de 47; ambos viven junto a sus 2 hijos: Estrella de 17 y Julio de 12, en su casa propia.
La atención de su bodega es su principal actividad y gracias a ella puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, puesto que él se dedica a la carrocería y esto no alcanza para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. 
Desde muy joven, Aurora se acostumbró a trabajar en variedad de oficios y gracias a la experiencia ganada en todos ellos optó por tener algo propio, es así que inició con su bodega, la cual le da la ventaja de permanecer en su casa realizando las labores del hogar, atender a sus hijos y a la vez lograr ingresos para su casa
Aurora se siente feliz de realizar su trabajo y es por ello que le pone mucho empeño en abastecerlo con todas las necesidades de su clientela; por tal motivo, también vende carne de pollo y verduras, para que así sus clientes no deban caminar hasta el mercado y le compren a ella.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y le gusta mucho su trabajo con sus compañeras de grupo, porque todas se conocen y son buenas amigas. Debido a la campaña escolar, con el dinero que solicita y aprovechando la ocasión, quiere vender útiles de escritorio en su tienda, para incrementar sus ganancias de estos meses.
texts.en:
Aurora is a hard working 51 year old woman. She is married to Enrique, 47 and they live together in their own home with their two children: Estrella, age 17; and Julio, age 12. Her main activity is attending her store and thanks to it, she is able to help her husband with the household expenses. He works on vehicles and his income is not enough to meet the needs of his family. Aurora became accustomed to working in different areas when she was young. Thanks to this experience she decided to start her own business, so she opened her store in her home. This way she is able to stay home, do her household chores, care for her children, and earn an income at the same time. Aurora is happy being able to run this business and puts a lot of effort into stocking it with all her customers’ needs. She also sells chicken and vegetables so that her customers will not have to walk to the marketplace. This will be her first loan through MFP. She really likes the work they do and likes the rest of the members of the group because they all know each-other and are all friends. Given the school campaign, she would like to use the money from this loan to stock her store with writing supplies in order to increase her income during this period.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy writing supplies for resale

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina C. is a single parent in Elmina and has no educational background. She stays with her two children in a rented apartment. Augustina cooks rice with tomato sauce for sale. The general welfare of her children is done by her alone. Her loan, which will serve as additional capital, will be used to buy bags of rice and ingredients for stew for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and ingredients

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito.
Maria es casada, tiene 59 años y 7 hijos, Maria tiene un cafetín dentro D. las instalaciones D. una institución estatal, en donD. venD. comida, bebidas, golosinas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the San Benito Communal Bank. She is 59 years old, married, and has seven children. Maria has a small café located on the premises of a state institution where she sells food, beverages, and candy. She manages this business with the help of her daughter.

Maria needs a loan of 1200 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of improving her business and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: D. Antoinette est née en 1965 à Lokossa au Bénin. Mariée à TOSSAVI Romain, Antoinette est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis douze ans à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Antoinette n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de 15 ans que Antoinette prépare et vend de la nourriture (igname préparé) de façon ambulante. Antoinette achète son produit à Comé et à Lokossa au Bénin. Antoinette a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts à ALIDé, prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans l'optique de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
D. Antoinette was born in 1965 in Lokossa in Benin.  Married to TOSSAVI Romain, she is the mother of four children, who all attended school.  The family has been living for twelves years in Agla, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Antoinette helps out her husband and, along with him, makes sure that the various family expenses are covered.  Antoinette never attended school.  For nearly fifteen years, she has been making and selling food (cooked yams) door to door.  She purchases her supplies in Comé and in Lokossa, in Benin.  She has already benefited from two ALIDé loans, which have all been repaid.  With the aim of bolstering her business and growing her customer base, Antoinette is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of yams

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul T., 24 years old, runs a bakery shop at a local market called Bayangol. She has been operating her business since 2005, and has built a loyal customer base. Her husband, Batsaihan, helps at his wife's business, except during summer when he manufactures blocks to sell. They own their own house and live with their two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Their two-year-old daughter attends a local kindergarten. 

With her earnings, Munhzul was able to purchase a car for her family. She has been using it to transport her products as well as using it for her family's transportation needs. 

Munhzul is an industrious person and has many plans for the future. She and her husband have been planning to expand their product line at the shop in order to sell ham and eggs at an additional counter. She would also eventually like to support her husband in an effort to create his own block manufacturing workshop. 

Munhzul is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more baked goods and cakes for resale at her bakery shop.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her bakery

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima P. is a married businesswoman. She is a farmer keeping poultry at Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. She keeps broilers (for meat). Her poultry farm consists of poultry cages partitioned where chicks are kept. The business income generated is used to meet the daily family needs and capitalize the business. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to further capitalize the business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to boost the business

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang B. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Chanthorn Mob, live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, across the Mekong River. They were married in 1990 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. 

Samnang has been a mason for more than sixteen years and he does this work in the village and nearby provinces. His wife has just started a business selling vegetables. 

Samnang has requested a loan of US $600. He will use $500 of the loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting and he also will use $100 of the loan to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena B. M. cuenta con un negocio de Abarrotes llamado “Mi tiendita Mili” con una antigüedad de 1 año. Este negocio ofrece abarrotes en general, refrescos, botanas, lácteos, galletas y más. Para poder seguir dando mejor servicio a su clintes ellos requieren de capital para poder tener mayor variedad en su negocio para incrementar las ventas y así ofrecer a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magdalena B. M. has been managing a grocery store called “Mi Tiendita Mili” for one year. In addition to groceries, her store sells soft drinks, snack foods, dairy products, cookies, and other items. Magdalena needs additional capital so that her business will have a greater variety of merchandise. This will allow her to continue offering good service, increase her sales, and provide her two children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada 20 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante ha hecho que se dedique a la venta ambulante de comida en un carrito especialmente diseñado para esta actividad. Empezó viendiendo hamburguesas y salchipollos en la puerta de su casa y actualmente ha decidido instalar su puesto de venta en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque, los platos que prepara tienen mucha acogida, debido a la buena sazón con la que los prepara.

Rosa prepara los alimentos con la mayor salubridad posible, ya que es consciente de la responsabilidad que conlleva preparar estos alimentos. Actualmente ella desea adquirir mas insumos para preparar más comida, lo cual le permitirá satisfacer la demanda de su nueva zona de trabajo, para esto ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora, responsable y muy entregada a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con el fondo Kiva y gracias a esta ayuda pudo trasladar su negocio de la puerta de su vivienda a donde vende actualmente. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus pequeños hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior con la que se aseguren un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, separated, and is caring for two children. She lives with her family in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. In order to get her children ahead, she works as a street vendor, selling food from a cart which has been specially designed for that purpose. She started out selling hamburgers and salchipollos [fried potatoes with shredded chicken and hot-dogs] in front of her house, but has now decided to setup her business outside the Lambayeque city market. All of her foods are very well received by her customers, owing to the delicious seasoning with which she prepares them. Rosa is quite aware of her responsibilities when preparing food, and does so in the most sanitary manner possible. She would now like to acquire some additional equipment so that she can prepare more food, and thereby satisfy the demand of her customers at her new location. For this reason she has requested a loan of 2000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa is extremely hard working, responsible, and dedicated to her family. She has previously worked with Kiva, and thanks to this previous help, she was able to move her business from the front of her house into its current location. Her biggest wish is to give her little ones the opportunity to study a good career, so they can enjoy a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients and equipment  used for the preparation of hamburgers and salchipollos.

loans.name: Naseem Shakil's Group

texts.en:
Naseem S. lives in the city of Riwind, in Pakistan, with her husband and two children. Both of her children attend school.  Her husband has a job in the factory while she sells milk and has some buffaloes at her house. She wants to buy another buffalo because she thinks that she can increase her income by increasing the amount of milk and making more clients. 

There is potential in her business because milk is the product which is used in every house and if she has more milk to sell then she can earn more money. 

She is applying loan for her second loan from Asasah. Her first experience was good and she is hopeful that the results from this loan will be even better.

Note: "In this photo, Hamedi,  the group member, is doing her household work and other members are helping her except Amna who is doing embroider works".

loans.use: Purchase another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta N.'s main source of income comes from selling roasted pig by the kilogram in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Vicenta has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Vicenta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vicenta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing vegetable seeds

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion S. is a 50-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing and fish vending. She lives in Nylon Shell, Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts, by working hard in her businesses.

Concepcion is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Concepcion is now borrowing 13,000 PHP so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Concepcion aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (Dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They are indeed "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. To help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines, you can join our team by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 32 años, por lo que su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Comenzó a trabajar por la falta de oportunidades ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo, ella trabaja todos los días por lo que tiene ciertos clientes que le hacen muchos pedidos. Para seguir con las ventas ella quiere compra con el préstamo pantalones, camisas, ropa interior entre otras cosas. En el futuro quiere ofrecerles a sus clientes el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 32 years old and sells clothing. She’s been in this business for more than four years and started it because there were no other opportunities available. She cares for her two young children and works every day and has regular customers who make many requests of her. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, undergarments, and other things in order to continue with her sales. [Martha] wants to be able to offer better service to her customers in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy K. (see photo) and her husband, Mr. Sroing Sang, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1964 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. All of their sons are married and live outside the family home. One daughter weaves silk at home, and the other two are garment factory workers.

Chhoy and her husband are farmers. They grow bananas and cucumbers. The couple is old, but they are still strong enough to work. Chhoy is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy fabric for her son who is a tailor and purchase weaving materials for her daughter to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her son, a tailor, and weaving materials for her daughter to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy K., 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. sells fruit, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 10 per day. The family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water, and USD 50 on other necessary expenses every month.  

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new car to operate her husband's business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph because K. was not available.

loans.use: buy a car to operate his taxi business more efficiently

loans.name: Jose Ángel

texts.es: El señor Jose Ángel S., tiene la edad de 34 años es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar, ellos tienen un hijo pequeño de 6 años que estudia el preescolar, él labora como guarda de seguridad, desde hace mas de 10 años, habitan en un humilde barrio y su vivienda está en deterioro, por las inundaciones que dejo la temporada de invierno,  siendo esta la razón principal del préstamo para la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de su hogar, el préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a  cabo estas mejoras y favorezcan en la forma de habitar y seguridad de la familia para su mejor desarrollo socioeconómico.
texts.en: Mr. Jose Angel is 34 years old, married and his wife is a housewife. The have a small son that is six years old. He goes to preschool. Jose Angel has worked as a security guard for the past ten years. He and his family live in a modest community. His house is falling down, caused by the floods that occurred this past winter. He is asking for this loan in order to build a wall at the back of his house. The loan will be used to buy construction materials, which will allow him to finish these improvements. The social and economic security of his family will be improved.

loans.use: He will build a wall for his house.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda C. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 47 years old. Erlinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda sells AVON products such as cologne, lotion, watches, etc., in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Joseph Muchiri

texts.en:
Joseph has operated his bread shop for three years in Njabini town.  He is 26 years old and married to Lucy Wangui. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy more bread to sell to his retail clients.

In the future, Joseph hopes to build his own bakery in Njabini town.

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi B. M. is 42 years old, married and has five children between the ages of two and 22.  His business is located at Changamwe estate in Mombasa,Kenya, which is the coastal region of Kenya and well known for its many tourist attractions as well as the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He owns a hardware store in which he sells such items as lubricants and paints to the local residents.  He has been in this business for the last three years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he faces is financial constraints. He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy more paints and lubricants to expand his business. He hopes to own a big yard where he will locate a bigger business. He describes himself as a very determined and focused man.

loans.use: To purchase paints and lubricants

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en: Maksim D., 58 years old, lives with his wife and two sons in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His youngest son, 21, attends university, his other son is disabled and his wife is retired and stays at home with the son. Maksim operates a taxi service. He began his business in 2008 and has gained much experience over this short period. He has found success with his transportation business and his earnings have enabled him to buy a car and pay off half of it. Maksim is a modest person and says, "I plan to drive my current car for 2 years and after that, I'll change it for a bigger truck for the future." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to pay down the last half owing on his car.

loans.use: to pay the remaining money owing on his car

loans.name: Vong's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up this village bank loan. They are located in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. This village loan selected Mr. Vong T., 35 years old, as the village bank president. The members hope to increase their income and improve their familys' standard of living through this loan.
 
Mr. Vong T. is a security guard, receiving a small salary to support his famiL.. His wife, Mrs. Din SarO., is a congee and balut egg seller in the local village. (Congee: rice porridge - Balut: a nearL. developed chicken or duck embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell)

Due to the fact that his wife's business has been doing well, and in order to increase their income to improve the famiL.’s situation, he is asking for a loan to buy more balut eggs and more rice to expand his wife's business activities. 
 
This couple is working hard to support their three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is attending a local school, and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy more balut eggs and more rice to expand his wife business activities.

loans.name: Dickson Paletuan

texts.en:
Dickson has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 30 years old, married to Jackline K., and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 50,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy wheat seedlings and fertilizer for planting.

In future, Dickson hopes to practice mixed farming, that is, start rearing cows for both meat and milk.

loans.use: To buy wheat seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es: Laureana tiene 46 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Fernando, de 46 años y sus 3 hijos menores de los 4 que tiene en total. Hace más de 5 años Laureana,  realiza diversas actividades para salir adelante. En temporadas de verano  vende raspadillas (hielo con esencia de frutas), en un parque industrial de su distrito y, en las épocas de invierno, vende desayunos, cancha blanca, papa rellena. Siendo así la mas conocida y jovial de este contorno, por lo que tiene muchos clientes. De esta manera  esta trabajadora madre de familia vende de todo e hizo que su negocio le resulte rentable,  con los que pudo educar a sus hijos y enseñarles a trabajar. Por ello, a su segunda hija le gustó el negocio, por lo que le compró su propia carreta y ahora vende como ella y les va muy bien. Por ello Laureana, se siente muy  feliz y, ahora también se ha propuesto comprar otra carreta para su otra hija, quien actualmente le ayuda y, de ese modo deje de preocuparse por ella. Es su 1er crédito que tiene con MFP y,  se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a los integrantes de su grupo, quienes la invitaron a ser parte del crédito, y dice “que con confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente” De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará otra carreta, para que trabaje su hija y se genere sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Laureana is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Fernando, 46, and their 3 minor children of the 4 total they have.  For more than 5 years she has engaged in different activities to get ahead.  In the summer she sells raspadillas (ice with fruit flavors) in an industrial park in her district and in winter she sells breakfasts, white cancha [a type of Andean popcorn made from a special kind of corn called maíz chulpe] and stuffed potatoes.  Since this hard-working mother is the most known and friendly in her neighborhood, she has many customers, making her business successful and profitable.  As a result, she was able to educate her children and teach them  to work.  Her second daughter liked this business so Laureana bought her her own cart and she now sells like her mother.  Thing are going well for her.  Laureana is happy and now wants to buy a cart for her other daughter, who is currently helping her, and this way she won't have to worry about her. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making all her payments as she doesn't want to let down the other members of her communal bank who invited her to take part in this loan.  They says that " they have placed their trust in her and they are sure that she will make her payments on time."  With the loan she is requesting she will buy another cart so that her daughter can work and generate her own income.

loans.use: To purchase a cart so that her daughter can start her own business selling raspadillas

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia tiene 46 años, es una piadosa y trabajadora mujer. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Nelson de 39 años y sus 2 hijos aún menores. Después de haber vendido productos de belleza por muchos años, cambió de giro su negocio hace un año. Desde entonces vende prendas casuales para todas las edades a solicitud de sus clientes, y le va bien, por lo que tiene clientes conocidos de su anterior negocio.  Por lo tanto su negocio le resulta rentable; abasteciéndose cada fin de semana en el emporio comercial del centro de Lima, mientras la prendas como buzos y shorts se provee de una vecina que confecciona, ya que le deja a precios cómodos. Le gusta el negocio que realiza por lo que se entretiene mucho, por ello en adelante piensa incrementar su mercadería para vender al contado, y poder captar mayores utilidades, de ese modo poder educar a sus hijos. Ella pertenece a un pequeño grupo comunal, y este es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, demostrando compromiso y éxito con los integrantes de su asociación. Herminia, cada mes compra la mercadería necesaria de acuerdo el pedido que le hacen, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará pantalones, polos, shorts, para abastecer sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Herminia, 46, is a pious, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Nelson, 39, and their two minor children.

After having sold beauty products for several years she changed her occupation a year ago.  Since then she’s been selling casual clothes for all ages according to her customers’ requests.  She does well because she has customers still from her previous business.  Because of this the business is quite profitable.  She stocks up every weekend at a commercial merchandise mart in Lima and gets the sweatshirts and shorts from a neighbor who manufactures them and sells them to her at good prices.

She likes the business because she amuses herself quite a bit with it so she plans in the future to increase her stock in order to sell for cash and earn higher profits and be able to educate her children.

She is a member of a small communal bank and this is her 10th loan with MFP; she has shown success and commitment toward her fellow group members.  

Herminia buys necessary merchandise monthly according to orders placed with her so will use the requested loan to buy pants, polo shirts and shorts to fill those orders.

loans.use: To stock up on shorts, polo shirts and pants.

loans.name: Beug Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEUG FALLOU est créé le 03 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois De B.

Madame Aissatou N. (la seule femme debout sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne en demi gros et revend dans le village. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche bovine. Elle est bien expérimentée dans ces domaines d'activité pour les avoir pratiquées depuis plus de cinq ans. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin de gagner plus de revenus.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group BEUG FALLOU was founded on December 3, 2007.  It is made up of 15 women from the same village.  They organized themselves by their neighborhoods and similarities.  The group is a part of the Banc Villageois of B..

Mrs. Aissatou N. (the woman standing in the photograph) is the leader of the group. She is married and mother of two children for whom she is responsible.

She has a small business selling vegetables.  She buys stock from a distributor and then resells in her village.  She also grazes cattle.  She has a lot of experience in these businesses as she has worked in them for over five years.

The new loan will allow her to grow the business in order to increase revenues. Her goal is to meet her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to grow and promote her business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman from Banga, South Cotabato. She is 41 years old and has 2 children, aged 18 and 13.

Shirley started farming 3 years ago. She grows rice to sell to her community. Aside from rice farming, she also grows pigs and ducks, and runs a sari-sari store.

Shirley's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nav

texts.en:
Mrs. Nav is a married woman who has 5 children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending local public school. The children also help with the family business. She and her husband, Mr. Sre, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they can grow both rice and vegetables. They sell part of the crops and with the rest they support their family. Mrs. Nav has some problems because the soil in her field is infertile and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Nav is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and with the rest of the loan she wants to dig a well. 

Mrs. Nav is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 43 años de edad. Es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en el Caserío Santa Isabel, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior  de su domicilio. Francisca alimenta sus animales con polvillo, purina, maíz, etc. Ella vende quincenalmente sus animales en los mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como albañil y agricultor. Con los ingresos de su negocio, Francisca puede ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Francisca solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de animales y sus respectivos alimentos. Por ello, ha acudido a Edpyme Alternativa y los prestamistas de Kiva para su préstamo. Es cliente recurrente de Edpyme y canceló sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Francisca is 43 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in her own house in the Santa Isabel settlement, located 15 minutes from the city of Mórrope. Her work is raising and selling animals, which she raises in pens located outside her home. Francisca feeds her animals rice bran, Purina feed, corn, etc. She sells her animals every two weeks at the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque. Her husband works as a mason and also a farmer. With the income from her business, Francisca is able to help her husband support the family economically. Francisca is requesting a loan to invest in buying animals and appropriate feed for them. For this reason, she is turning to Edpyme Alternativa and the Kiva lenders for her loan. She is a repeat client of Edpyme, and she made her previous payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy more animals to fatten up and to buy balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly S. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Jolly has a piggery firm, which she has run for eight years.
To help expand her business, Jolly has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jolly hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for resale.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es una madre de familia de  31 años de edad, vive con sus   hijos, tiene casa propia la cual cuenta con el  servicio sólo luz, ubicado en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura aproximadamente.  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola, ganadera y artesanía que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Eulalia a colocado en la parte de adelante de su casa su tienda donde productos de primera necesidad  (papel higiénico, huevos, aceite, leche, lejía, detergente y todo tipo de golosinas, etc.), con el negocio que tiene en su domicilio trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia, ya que han incrementado sus ventas.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda con más mercadería para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementar  sus ingresos para su hogar.  Eulalia es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo,  trabajo dedicación.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 31, is a mother living with her children.  She owns her house which only has electricity located in an urban part of Tambogrande District about 40 minutes from Piura Department.  These zones are noted for the high levels of commercial activity, farming, livestock raising and crafts that their residents engage in.

Eulalia has installed a grocery store in the front part of her house.  She stocks basic need items (toilet paper, eggs, oil, milk, lye, detergent and all sorts of snacks, etc.)  Through her home-based business she strives to provide a better standard of living for her family.

Since her sales have increased she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to stock her store with more merchandise to continue meeting customer demand and at the same time increase income for her home.

Eulalia is known by her neighbors for being a cheerful woman always willing to help others and for being a responsible mother whose only objective is that they succeed as a family thanks to their effort, work and dedication.

loans.use: to stock her store with more merchandise.

loans.name: Darwin Stalin

texts.es:
Darwin Stalin tiene 24 años, Es soltero vive con la madre, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Darwin se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Darwin Stalin is 24 years old.  He is single living with his mother in Vantanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “La Unión” (Unity) communal bank is located in Aguas Frías de Medellín which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

Darwin farms corn and rice.  His purchases are done in Ventanas and his sales at daily farmers markets, especially Sunday’s.

He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are competition and weather variations.  

His dream is to buy land.  He enjoys going out on excursions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a caring & supportive lady by nature. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well and also supports her husband in his grocery store business. 

Her husband runs a grocery store in the market where he sells household items such as sugar, spices, cooking oil, rice etc. to his clients at reasonable rates. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to buy groceries in larger quantities, which will help him to meet the timely needs of his clients and earn better profits. 

Najma hopes that an investment will help him improve the financial condition of his business and the living standards of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a grocery store business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a mother of six children who ages range from 2 to 13 years old. All but the youngest two are in school. Joyce's husband is a businessman. Joyce owns a general store in which she sells different items such as rice, beans, sugar, etc. She has run this business for five years and it has enabled her to feed her children and pay their school fees. Joyce needs a loan to in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Laura Del Rocío

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mejía. Ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Laura, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 3 años. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una joven madre que para obtener sus propios ingresos hace 7 meses decidió ingresar al banco comunal para con el crédito empezar su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde sus clientes llegan cuando tiene nueva mercadería, nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las tardes, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. La mercadería  se la trae su marido desde los Estados Unidos ya que él viaja a menudo hasta ese país porque es residente Americano.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Mejía, located a few kilometers from the city of Portoviejo, the Mejía Community Bank meets every two weeks. In this city many people work in farming and in growing and selling coconuts.  

Here we meet Laura. She is 24 years old and is in a common law marriage with a 3 year old daughter. Her husband is a merchant.
 
She is a young mother who in order to have her own income 7 months ago decided to join the community bank to start a business with the loan. She sells all types of clothing door to door. She also sells from her house and her customers arrive when she has new merchandise. She tells us that she works via orders. She works three days a week especially in the afternoons. She sells on credit to her customers and collects every two weeks. Her husband brings the merchandise from the United States since he travels to that country, as he is a US resident. 

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the community bank for two cycles and she likes it because of the ease of getting the loans.
 
Her dream is to keep growing her business.
