loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
Las reunión del banco comunal “Patrón Santiago De Santiago” son cada treinta en la ciudad de Cusco y conocimos a la socia Hernestina y nos cuenta:

“Nací en la ciudad del Cusco, tengo 38 años edad, soy madre soltera y tengo un  hijo y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y donde desarrollo mi actividad económico principal que es la venta de verduras y frutas”. 

Hernestina tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el mercado de Mojospata donde vende verduras y frutas. Ya son cuatro que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Hernestina requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo frutas y verduras. Su sueño de la socia es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank holds its meetings every thirty days in the city of Cusco. Here we meet the member named Hernestina, and she tells us:

"I was born in Cusco city. I am 38 and a single mother of one child. I live in the city in which I was born and this is where I have my main job: selling fruits and vegetables."

Hernestina has a small stall in the Mojospata market where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has had this business for four years and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work that she puts into her job. At the moment, Hernestina needs this loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as, for example, fruits and vegetables. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as, for example, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Victor Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor Victor es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es separado. Él se dedica a la distribucion de todos los periodicos del país, también tiene una empresa de transporte que transporta mercaderías. Se inicio en este rubro con un tío que tenia el negocio de distribución de mercaderías, con mucho esfuerzo logró independizarse y logró montar su propio negocio.
Él se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ejemplo de su lucha es que, pese a las adversidades pudo independizarse y montar su propio negocio. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia y de todos quienes de él dependen.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para la reparación de los vehículos que son su elemento de trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Víctor is from the city of San Lorenzo; he’s separated.  He’s a distributor of all the country’s newspapers and he also has a merchandise transportation firm.  He started in this line of work with an uncle who had a merchandise distribution business.  With much effort he was able to go off on his own and start his own business.

He defines himself as a hardworking, tenacious person.  An example of that struggle is that, despite adversities, he was able to become independent and start his own business.  He comments that everything he does is for the benefit of his family and of all those that depend on him.

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts to repair his vehicles which are his work tools.  He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it provides him.

loans.use: to buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Rizel

texts.en:
Rizel is 30 years old. She has four school-aged children to love, discipline and scold when needed. They live in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines where her husband is driving for a living. Two years ago, she got into the motor repair line of business to add to their daily income. Every month she gets PHP 5,000, which is divided equally to satisfy their needs.
 
This year, she joined GDMPC to have a way into financial services. She initially applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to equip her business with tools and devices for motor repair. She hopes that this investment will improve the service quality and she will have more customers to deal with.

loans.use: To buy tools and devices for his motor repair business.

loans.name: Flor De Luz

texts.es:
La señora Flor de Luz vive en un barrio donde se celebra la fiesta de San Mateo, ella es casada con el señor Gilberto y con quien procreo  dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

   Ella solicito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para su estética como tintes, tijeras, etc; lleva practicando ésta actividad 22 años y cuatro meses.

   Ella se inspiro en esta actividad  ya que  su mamá la mando a cursos en en la ciudad cercana a su comunidad y cuando logró su especializacion y le otorgaron sus reconocimienro ella comenzpo a cortar cabello.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad pueda seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus hijos que están estudaindo.
texts.en:
Flor de Luz lives in a neighborhood where the festival of San Mateo is celebrated. She is married to Gilberto, and they are still raising their two children.

She is seeking this loan in order to invest in materials for her salon such as dyes, scissors, etc.  She has been in this business for 22 years and four months.

She was inspired to go into this business when her mother sent her to take courses in the city close to them. When she completed her course and earned her degree, she began to cut hair.

What she wants most is to be able to continue working in this business in order to support her children, who are now in school.

loans.use: to buy products and materials for her salon.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, a 40-year-old married father of four sons and two daughters, has a stone-cutting facility as the main source of family income, supplemented by  his work in agriculture. Mahmoud wants to prepare for the coming agricultural season by purchasing seedlings, and so is requesting a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. The loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, will enable him to prepare well for the coming season, thereby leading to increased crop yields and income improvement that will benefit his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings to prepare for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Yoel

texts.es: Yoel, de 24 años convive con Tatiana, su esposa. Ambos tienen 1 hijo, Luis de un año. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Yoel, es la agricultura; ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a ello. Su producción consta de la siembra de café, plátanos y maíz híbrido. Lo que más le gusta a él, es poder dedicarse al trabajo que sus padres le enseñaron desde niño. Según afirma, “sabe todas las técnicas de cultivo” y para mantener la calidad de sus cosechas. Con frutos, grandes y muy  dulces, él abona constantemente sus sembríos, ya que asegura que a más fertilizantes el fruto crece más, porque necesita de nutrientes. Está técnica le es muy provechosa, ya que los vendedores mayoristas que constantemente visitan su localidad, compran sus productos a buen precio. Por ello más adelante quiere seguir innovando en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos; con ahorro e inversión lo conseguirá. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Buenos Aires” y esto es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está seguro que con el apoyo de su asociación, donde le recibieron con mucha alegría, podrá lograr sus objetivos. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Yoel de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Yoel, 24, lives with his wife Tatiana.  They have a one-year-old son, Luis.  The family lives in their own house, located in the town of Sanchirio del Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).

Yoel works in agriculture; he has been doing this work for four years.  He grows coffee, bananas, and hybrid corn.  What he likes most about this work is being able to do what his parents have taught him since he was little.  

He affirms that he "knows all the techniques of cultivation" to maintain the quality of his harvests.  He constantly fertilizes his sown fields with large and very sweet fruits, since he guarantees that the product grows more with more fertilizer, because it needs nutrients.  This technique is very profitable for him, since the wholesalers who constantly visit his town buy his products at a good price.  Because of this, later he wants to continue making changes in the maintenance of his crops; with savings and investment he will achieve it.

He belongs to the Buenos Aires Communal Bank, and this is his second loan with MFP.  He is sure that he will be able to achieve his objectives with the support of his association, where they very happily welcomed him.  Because of this he promises to be punctual with his payments.

If he receives his support, Yoel will use the requested money to buy natural fertilizers to spread on his coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Doris; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es soltera; La socia se dedica  a la venta de jugos la socia tiene su stand en uno de los mercados en la ciudad, y la socia compra frutas para realizar los diferentes jugos diarios para los clientes que ella recibe, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito en la compra de vasos, otra licuadora, coladores, servilleteros y otra mena jeria para implementar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mena jeria para implementar el negocio de venta de jugos.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Doris is 28 years old and single.  Her business is selling juice and she has a stand in one of the markets in the city.  She buys fruit to make her different daily juices for her customers.  On this occasion, she would like to invest her loan in buying cups, another blender, strainers, napkin holders and other utensils to equip her business.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying utensils to equip her juice business.

Doris is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying utensils to equip her juice business

loans.name: Elvin Jose

texts.es: Elvin Jose de 30 años de edad es soltero, habita en casa de su mamá junto a su hija de 14 años que estudia la secundaria. Elvin trabaja para la municipalidad como Operario de Limpieza desde hace 10 años, esta solicitando su 3er credito para continuar mejorando su vivienda, repellando su cuarto y embaldozandolo. El mayor deseo de Elvin es poco a poco acondicionar la casa para brindarle a su hija las mejores condiciones posibles y que ella estudie hasta que llegue a ser una profesional que le sirva a su pais, pues el estudio es la mejor herencia que le puede dar.
texts.en: Elvin Jose, 30, is single and lives with his mother and 14-year-old daughter who is in middle school.  Elvin has worked for the municipality as a Cleaning Operator for ten years.  He is requesting a third loan to continue improving his home by putting up drywall and tiles.  His dream is to provide better living conditions for his daughter so she can complete her studies and become a professional who serves her country.  He feels an education is the best inheritance he can leave her.

loans.use: To put up drywall.

loans.name: Rutilia

texts.es:
La señora Rutilia tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, reside en la comunidad de Milla 4, en el municipio de Omoa; Cortés.
En su vivienda convive con una de las hijas y dos nietos. Hace aproximadamente 12 años, ella junto con un grupo de mujeres de su comunidad recibió por parte de ODEF OPD  capacitación y asistencia técnica   en bordado de prendas de vestir y de uso domestico (manteles de cocina). 
Además recibió cursos sobre mercadeo y organización y liderazgo, logrando  la apertura de su propio negocio (bordado de prendas) con el apoyo crediticio de ODEF Financiera S.A.
En la actualidad ella ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de materia prima como ser: tela de manta, hilo y revistas de diseños.
La comercialización la realiza a través de pedidos y también ofrece el producto a turistas que llegan a las playas de su comunidad.
Su sueño es seguir creciendo con sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias para apoyar económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Rutilia, age 51, is a single mother with two children.  She lives with one of her daughters and two grandchildren in the Milla 4 community in the Omoa municipality, Cortés.

Approximately 12 years ago she joined a group of women in her community, and they received training from ODEF OPD and technical assistance in embroidering clothing and tablecloths.  

She also took courses about marketing, organization, and leadership.  She managed to open her own business (embroidering garments) with the help of a loan from ODEF Financiera S.A.

She has currently requested a loan to buy supplies like blanket fabric, thread, and design magazines.  She sells by orders, and she also offers her products to tourists who come to the beaches in her community.

Her dream is to continue growing with her sales and to increase her income in order to financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy blanket fabric, thread, and design magazines.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “La Esperanza” está integrado por 21 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, actualmente están  en el Cuarto Ciclo. Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas  y responsables, tienen un gran espíritu emprendedor, pues no temen a ningún desafío. 
Una D. ellas es la señora Nancy, ella se dedica a la venta D. joyas D. todo tipo. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, tanto hombres como mujeres, lo cual le trae buenos ingresos.  Ella comenta que por medio D. este trabajo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, unos D. sus sueños es poder tener una joyería bien abastecida donD. pueda tener todo tipo D. joyas, lo cual le permitirá atraer a más clientes. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. cadenas, anillos, pulseras, aros y otro tipo D. joyas, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad D. joyas. Gracias a la oportunidad que le da kiva y la fundación, ella se encuentra a un paso más D. cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
The committee called La Esperanza, or “Hope,” is composed of 21 hardworking, enterprising women. They are currently in their fourth cycle. This group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united and responsible. They have a great entrepreneurial spirit. They are not afraid of any challenges. 

One of the members is Nancy. She sells all kinds of jewelry. She says that she has a lot of customers, as many men as women, which brings her a good income. She says that through this work, she has been able to get ahead and help her family. One of her dreams is to have a well stocked jewelry store where she can have all kinds of jewelry, which would allow her to attract more customers. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase rings, bracelets, chains, earrings, and other kinds of jewelry that she will use to offer a greater selection of jewelry. Thanks to the opportunity provided to her by Kiva and the foundation, she finds herself a step closer to realizing her dreams.

loans.use: Purchase rings, bracelets, chains, earrings, and more

loans.name: Changamka Group

texts.en:
Douglas is the facilitator of the Changamka group. Douglas and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Douglas takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Douglas had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Douglas was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Douglas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Douglas will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Changamka group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Josephine has been in this business for twenty years. She earns more income from retailing rice and farming rice.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has eight children ranging from 13 to 32 years old. She describes herself as an honest and go-getter woman. She runs a grocery store and has sold kale, tomatoes, bananas, carrots, etc., for the last two years. 

Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to expand the grocery store. She will use the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes and carrots. Esther hopes and dreams to be a supplier and increase the number of her customers in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, una humilde comerciante de 46 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, madre de dos hijos de 28 y 17 años de edad respectivamente. Ella vende tortillas, este negocio lo empezó a los 26 años de edad desde entonces este ha sido su primer negocio además que fue una opción para generar ingresos y mantener a sus  hijos. Ella vende sus tortillas de maíz en el mercado de la estación de buses. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar leña y maíz para hacer tortillas. Pues desea comprar materia prima al por mayor para obtener un buen precio y reducir los costos de producción sin perder la calidad ni el sabor de sus tortillas. Ella desea ir mejorando la infraestructura de su cocina poco a poco y seguir trabajando por tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, a humble storekeeper who is 46 years old, lives in the city of León.  She is the mother of two children who are 28 and 17, respectively.  She sells tortillas.  She began this business when she was 26 years old.  Since that time, this has been her main business as well as a way to make an income and take care of her children.  She sells her corn tortillas in the bus station market.
She is requesting the loan to buy firewood and corn in order to make tortillas.  She wants to buy wholesale raw materials to obtain a good price and reduce the costs of productions without losing the quality and flavor of her tortillas.  She wants to continue improving the infrastructure of her kitchen little by little.  She also wants to continue working to have a better level of life.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is 33 years old. She has three children who are aged between 6 and 11. All of her children go to school. She runs a bar and, at the same time, sells cows. She has been running this business for the past three years. With the loan, she will buy more beer to sell in the bar. She plans to use the profits for providing food for the family and to pay school fees for the children. She dreams to become a distributor of beer in the locality.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.en:
Silvia is very entrepreneur woman, she is a single mother and love to learn and study, and for this reason she studied to be and stylist and open her own beauty salon business. She started 15 years ago because she had to maintain her daughter and she has a lot of clients. Silva is requesting for a loan of US$ 550 to purchase materials that she use in her business and offer a better services to her clients. She is thinking to pay this loan in 4 months.

** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Silvia es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella es madre soltera y le gusta mucho aprender, es por eso que tomo cursos de capacitación para ser estilista y poder iniciar su negocio de salón de belleza. Hace 15 años inició su negocio para poder sacar adelante a su hija, y ha tenido muchas satisfacciones, ya que sus clientes la prefieren. Silvia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 550 USD para la compra de materiales que utiliza en su negocio para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela, y piensa pagar el crédito en un plazo de 4-8 meses.

loans.use: To purchase materials and merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is a very active 48-year old member of her community. She has lived in one of the slums of Kisumu, Kenya, for the past thirteen years. She is a widow and heads a household of five school-aged children, two of whom are orphans due to AIDS. She was trained by UNICEF as a community health worker in 1993. In 1997, she received training from KMET for home-based HIV/AIDS care, TB ambassadorship, and community-based distribution of oral contraceptives.

Florence is very well-known within her community for her compassionate work and also as a politician. She is the women’s representative for the Liberal Democratic Party in Kisumu District, where her principal role is to speak to women, raise awareness, and encourage their involvement in the political process to fight for their rights. As an expert in the art of making traditional baskets, Florence initiated a basket-weaving income-generating project for a group of women within her community five years ago, and she continues to lead and support this group. Her main business and source of income, however, is her community pharmacy which she has managed for the past eight years.

Thanks to her reputation and the location of her pharmacy within the community, her business has flourished. The most commonly purchased drugs in her pharmacy are those to treat malaria, diarrhea, asthma and upper respiratory infections. Florence credits her success to hard work and the assistance she has received from KMET through two previous microfinance loans. She plans to use the funds from her next loan of US$600 to expand both of her businesses. She will invest in a bulk stock of drugs for her community pharmacy and will purchase basket-weaving materials.

loans.use: Increase the pharmacy's drug stock and purchase materials for weaving baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Catherine Mwangi would like to buy a pig

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is 35 years old; she is married and has 5 small children. She works as a farmer on Dekhkan farm. She is paid very little and it’s not enough for life. Her husband works in Russia and sends her some money. On the side, she buys fresh apricots and dries them with her family every year. At the end of July she keeps ready apricot and at the beginning of December sells it on the local market. She came to Microinvest a year ago and got her first loan. Now she wants to ripen apricots for the new season and she wants to get $1200 for 12 months, to buy more apricot in order to get more profit.

loans.use: to buy and dry apricot

loans.name: Thuc

texts.en: The mother had heart problems and  stays home. The father and his two oldest children, a boy and a girl, work as day laborers while his youngest daughter attends the 9th class. They plant 120 trees of green dragon fruit. Their average income is $12.50 per month/person. They want to borrow $75 to invest in their green dragon orchard and will pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise green dragon fruit

loans.name: Warde

texts.en: Warde lives with her husband and her 3 children in Ain El Deleb, in Saida (South Lebanon).  Warde is a very well respected lady in her community being the wife of the village's priest but she is also respected for her handicraft.  Warde is a perfectionist when it comes to her accessories and her craft work.  She needs 300$ to purchase the necessary material for her creations.  Warde is part of a group with other women from the same village who will all benefit from this loan.

loans.use: buy material for her handicraft work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her hotel business.

loans.name: Padi Bali Indah Group

texts.id:
Problems faced by I Made C., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Ketut S., I Nengah D., I Gede Nyoman W., I Wayan S., I Nengah D., I Ketut M., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Nengah Sukabratra dan I Wayan W. in their farming activity are quite similar. Pests caused by rats is the biggest problem happening in their rice farm. They have made many efforts to overcome the problem such as placed striped colored ribbons-similar to grass snake's skin color that rats are frightened- on their rice farms. Also, they grew tadpoles to invite the snakes. They also planned to invest some of the loan on an ultrasonic device - rats can not stand the noise - to evict the rats. The value of the device is Rp 300.000,00.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Permasalahan yang dihadapi oleh I Made C., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Ketut S., I Nengah D., I Gede Nyoman W., I Wayan S., I Nengah D., I Ketut M., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Nengah Sukabratra dan I Wayan W. sebagai petani tidak jauh berbeda. Hama tikus merupakan masalah yang besar bagi lahan pertanian mereka. Berbagai upaya telah mereka upayakan, antara lain : meletakkan benda yang berwarna belang – seperti warna ular sawah yang ditakuti oleh tikus – di lahan mereka dan memelihara kecebong untuk mengundang kehadiran ular. Mereka juga berencana untuk menginvestasikan sebagian pinjaman mereka untuk alat ultrasonik – tikus tidak tahan mendengar suara ini - guna mengusir tikus senilai Rp 300.000,00.

loans.use: to invest some of the loan on ultrasonic device to evict rats (pests) from rice farms

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. S., age 24, is a housewife. Her husband is a blacksmith making about $6 each day. They have one child. She would like to request this loan of $1200 in order to purchase more metals to increase the number of products the blacksmith shop can produce.

loans.use: Sok would like to purchase more metals to increase a number of products the blacksmith shop can produce.

loans.name: Taku Liguèye De Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Having had the benefit of an initial loan, which we shared among thirty or so people, we decided this time to create a smaller group so that we could start up a sustainable business with a limited number of members. On this occasion we want to make a business of forest and fishing products that we intend to buy from producers and resell in town or at village fairs that take place every week around our village. Through SEM and Kiva we have been able to pursue activities that have brought us a small income and this time we hope to do better. 

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Après avoir bénéficié d'un premier prêt, que nous avons partagé entre une trenteine de personnes, nous avons décidé pour cette fois ci de créer un groupe restreint pour pouvoir mettre sur pied une entreprise durable avec un nombre limité de membre.
Pour cette fois-ci nous voulons faire du commerce de produits forestiers et halieutiques que nous comptons acheter chez les producteurs et ensuite les revendre en ville ou dans les foires villageoises qui s'organisent toutes les semaines autour de notre village.
Grâce au SEM et à Kiva nous avons pû faire des activités qui nous ont rapporté un peu d'économie et pour cette fois, nous espèrons faire mieux.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and forest products

loans.name: Sdao Kanleng Iii Group

texts.en: Sdao Kanleng III Village Bank consists of 30 members. The Village Bank President, Mrs. Chim L., born around 1964, is a housewife with no children. Mr. Rotha Chem,  Chim's husband, is a house constructor who can generate an income of about $3 a day. As prices have increased in Cambodia, due largely to increasing fuel costs, their living conditions have deteriorated, and Mrs. Chim is finding it more difficult to support her family. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy more food to improve their standard of living. This loan will be shared amongst the other group members.

loans.use: To buy more food.

loans.name: Norvy Daniela

texts.en:
Norvy Daniela Z. R. runs a general store in the village of Salpo located high in the sierras of La Libertad Region.  The store is located in the center of town, so it can be accessed easily.  The town is a stop along a bus route, and many of Norvy’s clients include commuters.  She is always friendly and stocks her store with the popular products clients want.

Norvy is 25-years old, married, and has one child.  She is happy to have her store because she never had the opportunity to study and become a professional.  She loves building relationships and saving for her child’s future. 

A member of the community bank Virgen De Las Mercedes, Norvy is requesting a loan of $550 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to restock her store with her best selling goods such as sugar, corn, and oil.

loans.use: To restock general store with goods such as sugar, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bulk-buy women's clothing to restock her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria learned to knit handbags in a community center five years ago. Since, she knits approximately ten handbags per week, with the help of an assistant.

Victoria then sells the handbags to friends or acquaintances at the local market and as a side activity, she also does farming.

With the loan, she will buy thread and other material she needs to knit her handbags and will pay her assistant as she would like to have more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria aprendió a hacer carteras en un centro vecinal. Por esta razón, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la confección de carteras a base de hilo. p> Ella teje alrededor de 10 carteras a la semana, con la ayuda de una compañera. Ella vende las carteras a sus amigos y conocidos que tiene en el mercado. Asimismo, Victoria también se dedica a la agricultura. p> Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los hilos y materiales que necesita en la confección de las carteras, y para pagar a su ayudante. Ella quisiera poder conseguir más clientes.

loans.use: To buy thread and other material to knit hanbags

loans.name: Esta's Eden Group

texts.en:
Esta M. is 49 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 17 and 3. Esta owns a small general store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Esta now hopes for a loan of $525 to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has business dealing with banana and milk sales.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her stock

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Tacumbu Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed thanks to Julia Benítez, who is a former counselor of city of Asunción. She invited her neighbors for an informative discussion. The afore-mentioned lady spoke to them about the Program, which she knew of from an information bulletin that she had received.

The women are very active in collaboration with the community. Some are part of a neighborhood commission of the neighborhood of Tacumbú and others work in the Divino Maestro chapel, which is found close to their homes.

We can speak of some of them, such as the case of Tomasa Zladívar, who is a single mother. In order to support her son and pay the expenses of the household where she lives, Tomasa is dedicated to the sale of jewelry and delicacies in a spot set against the door of a school where she has a small cart where she exhibits her merchandise to the students.

She rises very early in the morning, walks from her residence located in the Saxony neighborhood and arrives at the center with a bag full of things to sell. Things that are colorful, sweet and salty sell well. Now Tomasa can already withdraw a loan of 1,200,000 Guanaris. thanks to her good payment history she can agree to this total. She tells us that she will use it to grow her merchandise even more and to vary the products that she offers since spring is approaching.

The members carry out many extra activities such as raffles and food fairs, among others, to be able to pay some expenses of beautifying their neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo gracias a Julia Benítez, quien es ex- Concejala de la ciudad de Asunción, ella invito a las señoras para una charla informativa., pues son vecinas suyas. La mencionada señora les hablo acerca del Programa, pues ella tenía conocimiento através de un boletín informativo que recibió.

Las señoras son muy activas dentro de la colaboración con la comunidad, algunas forman parte de la comisión vecinal de Barrio Tacumbú y otras colaboran en la capilla Divino Maestro que se encuentra muy cerca de sus casas.

Podemos hablar de alguna de ellas, como el caso de: Tomasa Zaldívar quien es madre soltera, y para mantener a su hijo y solventar todos los gatos de la casa donde viven, Tomasa se dedica a vender bijouterie y golosinas frente a la puerta de un colegio donde tiene un pequeño carrito donde exhibe sus mercaderías a los alumnos.

Ella se levanta bien temprano todas las mañanas, va caminando desde su domicilio ubicado en el Barrio Sajonia y llega al centro con un bolsón repleto de cosas para vender, cosas coloridas, dulces y saladas para de ese modo salir adelante. Hoy día Tomasa ya puede retirar un préstamo de 1.200.000 Gs. gracias a su buen comportamiento de pago puede acceder a este monto y cuenta que desea utilizarlo para aumentar aun más sus mercaderías y variar los productos, pues se acerca la primavera.

Las integrantes realizan actividades extras además como rifas, ferias de comidas entre otros, para poder pagar algunos gastos de embellecimiento del barrio de ellas.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Julia Benítez, who is a former counselor of city of Asunción. She invited her neighbors for an informative discussion. The afore-mentioned lady spoke to them about the Program, which she knew of from an information bulletin that she had received.

The women are very active in collaboration with the community. Some are part of a neighborhood commission of the neighborhood of Tacumbú and others work in the Divino Maestro chapel, which is found close to their homes.

We can speak of some of them, such as the case of Tomasa Zladívar, who is a single mother. In order to support her son and pay the expenses of the household where she lives, Tomasa is dedicated to the sale of jewelry and delicacies in a spot set against the door of a school where she has a small cart where she exhibits her merchandise to the students.

She rises very early in the morning, walks from her residence located in the Saxony neighborhood and arrives at the center with a bag full of things to sell. Things that are colorful, sweet and salty sell well. Now Tomasa can already withdraw a loan of 1,200,000 Guanaris. thanks to her good payment history she can agree to this total. She tells us that she will use it to grow her merchandise even more and to vary the products that she offers since spring is approaching.

The members carry out many extra activities such as raffles and food fairs, among others, to be able to pay some expenses of beautifying their neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for sale such as meat, sugar, oil, fruits, vegetables, sweets, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar baji is the wife of M. N. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi food. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her youngest son goes to school.

Parveen baji's husband has a furniture-making and selling business. He has been in this business for the last 15 years. Parveen baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her children. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (wood, tools) to expand her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: La quarantaine dépassée,maguette est commerçant ambualant marié et pere de plusieurs enfants.Chaque matin,il arpante les rues de la ville de mbour pour vendre des vétements de fripperie .Il fait ce travail depuis plusieurs années sans aucun soutien ,avec le pret,il va renforcer son activité .
texts.en:
Now in his 40's, Maguette is a traveling merchant. He is married and the father of several children. Each morning, he walks up and down the city streets of Mbour to sell second-hand clothing. He has been doing this work for several years without any support at all. With this loan, he is going to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Miriam del Socorro S. S. tiene la edad de 47 años su estado civil es casada, esta señora tiene 4 hijos 1 varón de la edad de 25 años que labora en el hospital, otro varón de de la edad de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 2 año de secundaria, otro varón de 23 años que estudia y trabaja por cuenta propia y su hija mujer tiene la edad de 20 años y cursa el 1 año de su carrera, su compañero de vida labora como ingeniero civil, en sus deseos esta el darle a sus hijos una casa propia donde ellos puedan establecerse en un futuro y que esta represente las condiciones necesarias como propósito esta el mantener activo su negocio  a pesar de la difícil situación que pasa el país actualmente.


El tiempo que lleva en este negocio es de 20 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de calzado, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia  por lo que ella siempre se mantuvo activa en los negocios y le gustaba trabajar de forma independiente y es así como forma su propio negocio, el financiamiento lo solicita para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de mas calzado ya que el producto lo transporta desde Managua y algunas veces de Chinandega y de esta forma puede obtener mas ingresos para su familia por lo que de esta manera hará la compra al por mayor después obtenido su producto realiza la entrega de sus productos a los diferentes clientes.
texts.en:
Miriam del Socorro S. S. is 47 years old. She is married and has four children: a son (25), who works in a hospital, another son (16) who has just entered the second year of secondary school, another son (23) who is studying and is also self-employed, and a daughter (20) who is in her first year of university. Miriam's common-law husband is a civil engineer.

She wants to give her children a home of their own where they can establish a family in the future. For that reason, she wants to keep her business running despite the difficult situation in Nicaragua right now.

She has been in business for 20 years, selling shoes. She has always been self-employed and likes the independence that this brings. She wants the loan for working capital to buy more shoes, since she ships the merchandise from Managua and occasionally from Chinandega. This will enable her to increase her household income by buying merchandise wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María J. está muy agradecida con todos ustedes, por el gran apoyo que recibió en el préstamo pasado; con ello pudo emprender un negocio de abarrotes en su propia casa y de esa manera ya no tuvo que dejar a sus hijos y así prestarles una mejor atención. 
 Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de productos y nuevamente solicita su colaboración para invertirle y hacerlo crecer para mantenerse por largos periodos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria Juarez is very grateful for the great help she received through her past loan. With it, she was able to start a small grocery business that she runs out of her own home which allows her to stay with her children and care for them during the day. She needs to add a greater variety of products to her business and she is requesting another loan in order to invest and increase her stock so it lasts for longer periods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her small general store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr:
Madame A. Lydia vend les boissons et elle sollicite ce troisième crédit afin de renforcer son activité.  Elle dit que son activité ne va pas mal mais elle a vu une mévente à cause de la crise économique.  Malgré cette difficulté, son entreprise est en train d’accroitre, et les crédits qu’elle a déjà reçu ont change son qualité de vie.  Avec ce troisième crédit, elle espère de capitaliser assez de sous pour débuter la vente de divers en gros.

Madame A. a 39 ans et elle est mariée avec monsieur TAMADAHO Boniface.  Ils ont trois enfants, dont deux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. Lydia sells beverages, and she's seeking this loan to bolster her business. She says that her business is going well, but she experienced slow sales due to the economic crisis. In spite of this difficulty, her business is growing, and the loans she was previously granted have changed her quality of life. With this third loan, she hopes to capitalize enough money to start various wholesale activities. Mrs. A. is 39 years old and is married to Mrs. Boniface TAMADAHO. They have three children, out of which two go to school.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell beverages

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa vende comida rápida en la escuela de su comunidad a los niños estudiantes.  También tiene una 	venta de comida en el mercado de la localidad.  Ella tiene 3 hijos y todos están estudiando el mayor tiene 17 años de edad y esta estudiando para maestro.  Ella necesita el préstamo para compara mas productos como aguas gaseosas, verduras, arroz y fríjol.  Su sueño es hacer mas grande su negocio y tener mas ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos con una buena educación, ella no cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, su familia ha salida adelante gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa sells fast food to students at her local school. She also sells food in her community market. She has 3 children who are all in school. The eldest is 17 years old and is studying to become a teacher. She needs this loan in order to purchase more products, such as soft drinks, vegetables, rice and beans. Her dream is to expand her business and increase profits so that she can help her children get ahead with a good education. She does not have financial support from her husband. Her family has been able to move forward thanks to God, her efforts, and her job.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for fast food business

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa E. raises pigs. She has been in this business since 1990. She loves raising hogs; moreover, she uses the profit she makes to raise her family. Her husband, Jessie E., is very much supportive of her. She is 40 years old; all of her three children attend school. She finds it hard to budget their resources. The pigs that she raises have helped her pay the tuition fees and books.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will also help Milagrosa buy more piglets and increase the size of her business. 

CEVI helps their clients grow their businesses. They give all their clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing pig feed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is currently in the business of selling eggs and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Mary is 43 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business and open up a shop

loans.name: Noeuy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan  for four women who are living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Noeuy P., 30, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. Mrs P. currently grows different kinds of vegetables, which she will sell  to her buyers every 2 or 3 months after growing them. She is married with one teenage child who is a student. Her husband Chy,aged 30, is a local construction worker . The mature crop season is coming and Mrs P. is lacking the money to pay for harvesting her crops. In order to make that possible, she needs for a loan from HKL. The other three borrowers are:
You L. is a vegetable seller requesting a loan to repair her broken motorcycle for transportation.
You S. works as a building worker and she needs for a loan to buy piglets to raise.
You M. raises poultry from her home and she applies for a loan to pay poultry raising costs.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting her crops

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували 41 год. Женат и отец пятерых детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Жена домохозяйка. Занимается домашней работой, смотрит за крупно-рогатым скотом дома. Днем у него скот находится на пастбище, и поэтому во время мониторинга не было возможности запечатлеть скот на снимке. Абдували на снимке в день выдачи. Абдували хочет потратить свой займ на покупку двух бычков.
texts.en:
Abduvali, 41, is married and has 5 children. Abduvali has a high school education. He raises and sells cattle. Abduvali's wife is a house maker. She helps Abduvali feed cattle. During the day, Abduvali is herding cattle, but on the photo he is shown at the loan office. He plans to use this loan to purchase two bulls.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan M. is a 45-year-old trader who sells a variety of cosmetics in the central street of the city of Agsu. Elkhan is married and has three children. He started his business ten years ago. Now, with a loan through Aqroinvest, he could expand his business. Elkhan has recommended himself as a trusted client. He has applied for this loan to purchase more items to sell, and increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase more items for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 51, and her husband, Leonardo Sr., live in Barangay, Liwayway Diffun Quirino. They work very hard at their charcoal-making business to meet their daily needs. Josephine requests a loan of PHP 5,000 as working capital for her business. Aside from making charcoal, Josephine also sells vegetables and will use a part of her loan to increase this business as well. She hopes to expand her business so that someday her children will lead a better life. She is blessed with four children and a good husband and is very thankful to all of them. Josephine believes that patience and hard work can make her successful someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Laurinda Isaura

texts.pt:
Laurinda Isaura B. de 42 anos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, estudou até nona classe e teve de interromper os estudos por ter ficado grávida. Solteira e mãe de um filho que ainda é estudante. 

Laurinda viveu no distrito de Moamba e depois veio para Boane por motivos de trabalho, onde passou a trabalhar até hoje, tendo passado por várias empresas. Vive na casa própria e nunca viveu com o pai do filho. Trabalha numa empresa pública como dactilografa e aufere como salário mensal 2,900.00MT.

É terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e sempre pagou sem grandes dificuldades. Com o valor de 12,000.00MT, tenciona comprar cimentos, pedra e areia para dar continuidade com a construção da moradia familiar.

No futuro assegura que vai solicitar outros empréstimos para terminar com as obras da moradia familiar.
texts.en:
Laurinda Isaura B. is 42 years old and was born in the city of Maputo. She went to school through ninth grade and had to interrupt her studies when she became pregnant. She is a single mother of one child, who is still a student.

Laurinda used to live in the Moamba district, then came to Boane for work. She found work and still works here today, having been at several businesses. She lives in her own home and has never lived with the father of her child. She works as a typist in a public company and makes a monthly salary of 2,900 MT (meticais).

This is Laurinda's third loan with Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner), and she has always paid without much difficulty. In the amount of 12,000 MT, this loan is intended to purchase cement, rocks, and sand to continue the construction of a family home.

In the future she will apply for other loans to complete the work on her family dwelling.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a family house

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es:
Josué Manuel G. G. es un joven que reciñe acaba de formar una familia, a el casi lo crió su tía por lo que ella le dio un pedazo de tierra para que fincara. G. ya levanto unos cuartos para que su esposa viva cómodamente y para que en un futuro sus hijos tengan un patrimonio y un hogar  donde no sufran las altas temperaturas. 
El trabaja de despachador de gasolina en una estación muy conocida y trabaja duro para que la economía no le afecte y tener a su esposa como ama de casa.
texts.en:
Josué Manuel G. García is a young man who just recently started a family. He was raised mostly by his aunt, who gave him a plot to build on. G. has already built a few rooms where his wife can live comfortably and which will provide an inheritance for their children and a home where they will be sheltered from the extreme heat.

He is an attendant at a well-known gas station. He works hard so that the economy won't affect him and so that his wife can be a housewife.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl C. is a hardworking rice grower in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She is 28 years old and has six children. She is helping her husband, Edito C., till a 2.5-hectare farm that she owns. The profit that she gets from growing rice is definitely used in paying the tuition, and in buying food, clothing and her family's daily costs.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of complete fertilizer and urea. The loan will help her achieve maximum harvest on her farm.

CEVI helps small business grow. They provide their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past 4 years.  She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.  She say thank you to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more provision to sell

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
La señora Yola pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta 4to grado, vive en el Barrio Nueva Esperanza Jr. Altiplano 450.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de pescado. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado y algunos ovinos para la venta en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago  y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Yola belongs to the "Nueva Flor" ("New Flower") Community Bank in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, in the Puno region. She is 28 years old, unmarried and the mother of 3 children, reached 4th grade in her secondary education and lives in the Nueva Esperanza Jr. Altiplano 450 neighbourhood. Yola has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years now, having received an initial loan of 300 PEN to buy fish. She is now asking for a loan of 500 PEN to purchase fish and a few sheep to sell at weekly markets. Her greatest wish is to continue working. She appreciates the ease of repayment and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and fish.

loans.name: Ujima

texts.en: Ujima P. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. Ujima is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She sells groceries. She is requesting for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth raises birds. She has operated her chicken business for the past eight years. She gets her stock from Ondo and sells to her customers from the local market in Benin. Through her business, Ruth has been able to develop her farm by adding goats. She is 51 years old and married with six children.

Ruth hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more birds to raise and sell. She hopes that the loan will help her meet the demands of her customers during this festivity period (Christmas). She thanks you for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more birds to raise and sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: This is Alicia G., 60 years old and the mother of six. She lives with her grandchildren in the poor neighborhood in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. For seven years now, Alicia has been attending to her general store located in front of her house, using much of her profits to support her grandchildren’s education. Her store gives her a net income of P10,000 a month. Alicia is now on her 14th loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She has applied for a new loan of P16,000 which she will use to buy more items to sell at her store. Alicia wants to see her general store in the future to be bigger than it is now so that she can help employ some of her neighbors. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Dieynaba Kémo

texts.fr: Dieynaba Kémo S. est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BIDIANKOTO depuis deux. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, avec ce prêt elle va acheter des bœufs de l'aliment bétail pour les engraisser et des produits vétos. Cette activité lui permet d'avoir des ressources pour prendre partiellement en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Dieynaba Kémo S. is a 33-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She has been a member of Village Bank of BIDIANKOTO for two years. She fattens cattle for market. With this loan, she will purchase cattle, feed, and veterinary supplies. Her business provides income that allows her to contribute to her family's financial needs.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her herd

loans.name: Haisam

texts.en:
Haisam is a 22-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

Haisam has owned a hairdressing salon for almost two years now. He also does makeup, tattoos and hair removal, and sells beauty products. He is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and his clients feel comfortable going to his salon since he offers a lot of services. But most importantly, he is good in his work and is aware of the new hairstyle fashions.

When Haisam first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties, especially since he already had faithful customers from his previous job. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists.

Haisam has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products and to make some décor changes. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products and make some décor changes

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
La señora Damiana tiene 53 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora ella vive en Mallco Chapí que es un cantón de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ella se dedica tanto a la producción de leche cruda tanto como a la agricultura.

La Señora Damiana es madre soltera, el marido la abandono con sus hijos cuando ellos eran pequeños, ella tuvo que hacerse cargo desde ese momento sola y trabajar el doble para que no le faltara nada a sus niños y darles la mejor educación y brindarles un mejor futuro, el hijo mayor está casado y ya tiene un hijo y la Señora Damiana le recomienda que jamás haga lo que su padre hizo con ellos el otro hijo está terminando la universidad y su madre está muy orgullosa porque gracias al trabajo que ella realizo su hijo termina la universidad.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de forraje para la alimentación de su ganado y  de esa manera podrá aumentar la producción de leche y podrá tener  mejores  ingresos, ya que cada año ella compra un camión de cascara de soya.

La Señora Damiana es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora es así como la educo su madre desde muy niña ella agradece ser  hija única porque siempre conto con el apoyo de sus padres los cuales ya están viejitos pero siguen viviendo con ella es una mujer admirable y de mucho respeto por ser luchadora y no quedarse abajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damiana is 53 years old and is a very hard-working woman. She lives in Mallco Chapí in the city of Cochabamba. She works in raw milk production and also in agriculture. Mrs. Damiana is a single mother - her husband abandoned her with her children when they were young. She had to take responsibility for them for that moment forward. She worked twice as hard to make sure they did not lack anything and that they had a good education and a bright future. Her oldest son is married and already has a child. Mrs. Damiana advises him not to do what his father did. Her other son is finishing university and his mother is very proud that her work has allowed him to finish his studies. She is requesting the loan to buy fodder to feed her cattle and increase her milk production and therefore her income. Every year she buys a truckload of soy. Mrs. Damiana is a very responsible and hard-working person. Her mother raised her that way. She is thankful for being an only child as she has always been able to count on her parents' support. Her parents are now older but they still live with her. She is an admirable woman and is to be much respected for being a fighter and making her way up.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for dairy cows

loans.name: Boox Xalat Group

texts.fr:
Boox Xalat  est un groupement de femmes qui regroupe à son sein 10 femmes toutes actives dans divers secteurs. Il a été créé, il y’a tout juste un an et est dirigé par Madame Ndeye Fatou S. enseignante  depuis 8 ans dans l’élémentaire. Ce groupement  qui  regroupe les femmes d’un même quartier  permet  pour ces dernières de développer   l’entre aide et  la bonne  cohésion  pour le  bien de leur fief. 
Boox xalat, un mot  wolof  qui signifie avoir la même idée  s’est adhérée  à l’IMCEC Thiès et sollicite un prêt de 500 000 FCFA que va partager à part égale  ses membres afin de financer ou de régler des besoins personnels.
Quant à la présidente Madame Ndeye Fatou Sylla, elle contracte le crédit pour un besoin personnel. Elle compte  financer  avec ce montant l’activité de sa belle sœur qui par manque de pièce d’identité ne peut  bénéficier des œuvres des mutuelles. Sa belle soeur s’active dans la vente du couscous très prisé par les habitants du quartier. Ainsi, grâce à ce financement, elle pourra acheter du mil  et  les éléments nécessaires pour  préparer  le couscous.  Madame Ndeye Fatou Sylla  très respectée par ses paires grâce à sa générosité  est mère de 2 enfants âgés de 04 ans et de 02 ans et elle  est  âgée de 32 ans.
Par contre pour tous  les autres membres du  groupe, le crédit demandé sert à  financer leurs activités.  Elles sont : Madame Boye M.  la trésorière  vendeuse de parfum et  savon,  Madame Awa D. la secrétaire générale  vendeuse  des tissus, Madame Khady N. vendeuse du poisson, Madame Aïssatou F. vendeuse de savon, Madame Marie F. vendeuse  de produits cosmétiques, Madame Sokhna L. vendeuse de petit déjeuners,  Madame Rokhaya D. vendeuse de crèmes glacées, Madame Ndeye Fatou D. vendeuse de fataya et Madame Maguette F. vendeuse de parfums .
texts.en:
Boox Xalat is a group of ten women who own businesses operating in various sectors. The group was set up just one year ago and it is chaired by Mrs Ndeye Fatou S., who has been an elementary school teacher for the past eight years. The group members are women of the same neighborhood. They help each other and share a strong feeling of cohesion for the greater good of their "private kingdom". "Boox xalat" is a Wolof expression which means "sharing a common idea". The group joined the Thiès branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC and applies for a loan of 500,000 CFA francs. Each member will receive an identical share of the loan and use it to finance her business or personal family needs. The chairwoman, Mrs Ndeye Fatou S., will use her loan for personal needs. She will invest it in the business of her sister-in-law who cannot take advantage of the institution's financial products due to lack of proper identification documents. Her sister-in-law sells couscous, which is in high demand in her neighborhood. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to purchase millet and ingredients needed to prepare couscous. Mrs Ndeye Fatou S. is highly respected by her peers thanks to her generosity. She is the mother of two children, aged 4 and 2. She herself is 32 years old. All the other group members, however, will use their loan share to finance their own activities. Mrs Boye M. (the group's treasurer) sells perfume and soap, Mrs Awa D. (the general secretary) sells cloth, Mrs Khady N. sells fish, Mrs Aïssatou F. sells soap, Mrs Marie F. sells cosmetics, Mrs Sokhna L. sells breakfasts, Mrs Rokhaya D. sells ice cream, Mrs Ndeye Fatou D. sells fataya (beef or fish pasties), and Mrs Maguette F. sells perfume.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finance their activities

loans.name: Gloria María

texts.es:
En el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Gloria M. se dedica arduamente a la venta de frutas como mangos, mandarinas, bananos, entre otros. Estas son comercializadas por ella misma en su establecimiento donde muy alegremente las comercializa a diario.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de las frutas para su respectiva comercialización y para la compra de aceite y plátanos. Ella espera que su crédito le sea otorgado sin problemas y así continuar en su desarrollo del negocio para continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Gloria M. sells fruit like mangos, mandarins, plantains, etc. in Chinandega's central market. She, herself, sells them in her establishment where she cheerfully works every day. Currently, she is asking for funding to buy fruit to sell and to buy cooking oil and bananas. She expects that the loan will be granted easily so that she can continue to develop in her business and continue to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a young mother with two children. She is twenty-three years old and married. Her oldest child is only seven years old. She started farming in 2006 and shares that her business is going well and she is thankful she now owns her own land to till. She said she wants her farm to grow to be able to sustain her family’s needs and also to enable her to save for her children’s education. She recently joined CEVI to gain access to its program in order to raise capital for her farm. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. She told CEVI she would use this loan for farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Raimot

texts.en:
Raimot is a hard-working woman. She sells colorful sarongs to make a living in Nigeria. She is a very busy woman and she is happy because she makes daily sales from her sarong business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. 

Raimot lives in Oyo state, Nigeria. She is 32 years old and is married with 2 children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their household. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Janet Ekua

texts.en: Janet Ekua A.,  a high school graduate who is married and blessed with two wonderful children, sells secondhand female skirts and tops in Elmina.   Her husband is a trader. In her business for some time now, Janet uses her profits to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy fabric materials and ladies' bags as an additional product for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business and eventually  buy land.

loans.use: To buy fabric materials and ladies' bags

loans.name: El Samaritano 3,5 Group

texts.en:
Julissa is the coordinator of her group called El Samaritano (The Samaritan).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). 

Her group is located in a rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Julissa makes her home here in a simple structure.  She is a single mother with two children.

Julissa is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to buy underwear in bulk and then resell it at retail prices in the main market.  Julissa will use the profits to support her children by purchasing shoes and by repairing the floor in her home.  She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Buy underware in bulk and resell it.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife O. is from Capucao Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marife joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Marife’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam I. is a small businesswoman. She runs a clothing shop selling various styles of clothes at Yombo Kiwalan ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods from wholesale and retail shops at Karume and Kariakoo marketing city center. She has managed to buy a plot of land for residential house construction at Vituka ward. She is requesting a loan of T.shs. 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy business goods to meet customer demand

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie H. is from the village of Pigsag in Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old. Josie is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear items like shirts, etc. in the local community. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Josie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Josie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es ÉL Sr. Jose Angel;   él tiene 41 años de edad, Él socio es conviviente y el trabaja en Turismo en el sector hotelero, Nuestro socio es auditor  y también está a cargo de la maquinaria del hotel, el resuelve todo lo concerniente a la electricidad y el manejo de las máquinas pesadas. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para reparar una maquinaria.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jose Angel belongs to the communal bank "Lideres del Tercer Milenio." He lives in the Huanchac district of the city of Cusco. Jose Angel is 41 years old, and lives with a partner. He works in tourism in the hotel sector. He is an auditor, and also is in charge of the hotel's physical plant. He resolves all issues regarding electricity and the handling of heavy machines. He is requesting a loan to repair a piece of machinery. He values and appreciates the support provided through these means, and he pledges to make the payments on his debt according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he requests a loan to repair a machine

loans.name: Gemarcinda

texts.en:
Gemarcinda B. is from the village of Maramag Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Gemarcinda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemarcinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gemarcinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemarcinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Gemarcinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemarcinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Gemarcinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia Q. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old. Roselia is married and has seven adult children. Roselia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Roselia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Roselia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Roselia is now requesting her fourth loan from HSPFI, for 13,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saran T. is 36 years old. She has been selected as the leader of a six-member group from Ampil Rieng village in Takeo province. The group is seeking a group loan, where each member will use a portion of the loan to support their various businesses in the current year. Mrs. Saran T. and her husband, Mr. Uon Chhen, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They sell the rice to support their family. She is also a pig breeder, and her husband is a construction worker. Now she has a problem with her field: the soil is infertile and it has a lot of insects. To improve rice production, Mrs. Saran T. is applying for a loan to bU. fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan she will bU. pig food. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending a local public school, while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pig food

loans.name: Psaumes Plus Group

texts.en:
“Psaumes Plus” is a group of 17 owners of small businesses chaired by Jean Claude. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Jean Claude started his business in 1987 with a capital of $15 selling pairs of slippers. After he went bankrupt from 2004 to 2006 because of theft, he decided to open a general boutique that he operates today. With hard work and determination, his business prospered.
