Jean Claude is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups.  He has already received six times the loans and his business has been reinforced through the loan he received. Jean Claude intends with the next loan to diversify his business by adding a cassava leaves pounder and other items to reinforce the inventory of his business in order to increase the profit. He is 48 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 27 of whom one goes to school. Currently, Jean Claude makes the profit of about $90 per week. His dream is someday to expand his business in different markets in Kinshasa. Jean Claude’s business is located in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and other miscellaneous items for his shop

loans.name: Jessebel

texts.en:
Jessebel P. is a 34-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing and food vending businesses. She lives in Prk. Nylonshell, Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 PHP. Jessebel is now borrowing 13,000 PHP so that she can fund business operations. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jessebel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund business operations

loans.name: Darlin Marcelino

texts.es: Darlin Marcelino se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, tiene unas cuantas vaquitas, las que le producen un poquito de leche, esta la vende en el pueblo, pero tiene mucha demanda por lo que tiene que comprar y vender más leche para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.  Por lo que solicita un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de leche y la compra de una vaca, para ir incrementando su ganado. Con esto espera obtener mejores ganancias, para mantener a su familia y el hogar.
texts.en:
Darlin Marcelino has sold dairy products for over 6 years. He has some cows that produce a little milk to sell in the village, but demand is so high that he has to buy and sell more milk to meet customer demand. That’s why he is requesting this loan to buy milk and a cow to increase his livestock. With this loan he hopes to make more profits to support his family and household.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk and a cow

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sopheap Pen, live in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1998 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and another one is still young. 

The main source of income comes from her husband, who has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. Sopheap stays at home to take care of her children. Sopheap has requested a Kiva loan in the past. Now she is applying for her second loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida T. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 63 years old. Zenaida is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rubber trees in the community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Zenaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie V. is 29 years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a food vending businesses. She lives in Railings, Brgy. Poog, Toledo City, Cebu.

Emelie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and Food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Emelie is now borrowing PHP 14,000, so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emelie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta M. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is 60 years old. Jacinta is single. To make a living, Jacinta owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Jacinta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jacinta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacinta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Jacinta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the range of products offered in her store. This loan will be Jacinta's 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support extended members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the range of products offered.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vende tortillas, su familia la conforma su esposo, sus dos hijos Ever de un año, Keyri de dos años, el negocio lo atiende tres días de la semana en la casa y tres días en el mercado municipal de San Francisco Gotera.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, ya que son su materia prima para preparar las tortillas, con este préstamo tendrá a disposición mayores recursos para realizar la venta.
Sueña con realizar mucha venta para mejorar su condición económica, y su esperanza es generar lo suficiente para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Reina is 22 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán, where she sells tortillas. Her family includes her husband and her two children, Ever, age one, and Keyri, age two. She runs her business three days a week in her home, and three days at the municipal market of San Francisco Gotera.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood, since these are the raw materials used to prepare tortillas. With this loan, she will have greater resources at her disposal to operate her business.

She dreams of making a great quantity of sales so that she can improve her economic situation. Her hope is to generate sufficient income so that she can support her children's education.

loans.use: Buying corn and firewood

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella B. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Stella has a garment shop business, which she has run for ten years. She also owns rental houses.
To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Stella hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Tharcissie

texts.en:
Tharcissie is 37 years old and is married with five children aged between 1 and 11 years old. Tharcissie sells cassava. She has been in this business for about four years and employs two people. Her business hours are from 6 am until 7 pm every day.

Tharcissie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by adding a variety of cassava. Any profits she makes she will use to buy her own boutique and purchase different products.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to sell.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with one teenage daughter. She sells women's underwear at the central market in Belaya Tserkov town. Her monthly income is about $1,530 and the net profit is around $510 per month.

Olena started her business ten years ago. He daughter was very sick and the family spent lots of money for her treatment. So, Olena bought a kiosk at the market, got some inventory and began her retail business. Her daughter’s disease progressed for several years and her husband left Olena. Being a very strong person, Olena continued to develop her business.

Today Olena owns three business locations. She uses one by herself and rents two locations to other starting entrepreneurs. Olena would like to increase her assortment and is requesting a 10,000 UAH loan. She hopes to receive additional income and will spend it for her family's needs. Olena lives with her daughter and second husband.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Tipina Ene

texts.en:
Tipina has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last year.  She is 42 years old and married to Jeremiah T.. They have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

In the future, Tipina hopes to grow her business and be able to send all her children through school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth Mercedes tiene 49 años, ella tiene un negocio que es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, de esta forma obtiene nuevos clientes para su negocio. Hace más de 10 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, sin embargo ha sido poco a poco que ha comprado una variedad de productos para ofrecer la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad con sus productos, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Últimamente han tenido muchos problemas relacionados con la inestabilidad en el precio del producto. Es por eso que este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, camisetas y trajes. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Mercedes is 49 years old and has a business selling clothes as a street vendor. By working in this manner, she is able to attract new customers for her business. She has been working on her own for more than ten years. Over time she has gradually been able to buy a variety of products to offer to her customers since they request different items. Ruth is always looking to increase her income. Lately she has had many problems related to the instability of prices for her products.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, T-shirts, and suits. Her dream has always been to expand her business so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, T-shirts, and suits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Grow her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Margarita Aracely

texts.es: La señora Margaría Z. tiene un puesto donde vende tacos y hamburguesas el cual es una de las fuentes de ingresos para su familia. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder hacerle una ampliación a su negocio, para poder darles a sus clientes un mejor servicio y a la vez atender a más gente y que su negocio siga creciendo. Ella y su esposo el señor Ismael Beltrán trabajan así que él le ayudara con los gastos de la casa así como de sus tres hijos para que ella utilice los ingresos del local para pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita Z. has a stand where she sells tacos and hamburgers; this is one of her family’s sources of income.  She is asking for a loan to expand the business in order to provide better customer service and tend to more people so that the business will continue growing.  

She and her husband, Ismael Beltrán, work so he will help her with household expenses as well as those of their three children so that she can use the profits from the food stand to repay this loan.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Consuelo's Group

texts.en:
Consuelo S. is from the village of Linglingay, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Consuelo is the group leader of a 21-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Consuelo is married. To make a living, Consuelo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Consuelo has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP every three months.

In 2011, Consuelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consuelo is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Yem L. who currently lives in Kompong Thom Province. Yem L. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop, while her husband is a firewood seller. 

They have five children, all of whom are single; they also work with her in pig raising. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Yem L. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a 30-year-old mother of five children between the ages of 1 and 11, all in school, studied through fourth grade and is married to an agriculturist. For 11 years Mary has been in business selling vegetables such as potatoes, plantains, yams, eddoes (a vegetable similar to yams), etc. She learned to conduct business from a friend who used to sell the same things and is happy when the business is moving fast, but other times when it is slow her vegetables can spoil.

Mary has requested a loan to purchase plantains, eddoes, potatoes, yams and other vegetables. She is working hard so that all of her children can attend school, and in the future she wants to save money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase plantains, eddoes, potatoes, yams and other vegetables.

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
Carlos, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y un hijo de dos años de edad.  Él es agricultor desde hace 8 años, aprendió de sus padres  trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, ya que se dispone a iniciar la siembra de maíz, esta compra es muy importante para Carlos ya que con estos insumos dará un mejor cuido.
Su objetivo es cuidar de su hijo, cuando crezca ayudarlo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. He cultivates corn and beans. He lives with his wife and their two-year old son. He has been an agriculturist for 8 years, having learned the trade from his parents. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

He requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and treatments for plagues to get ready to start his corn plantation. This purchase is very important for Carlo because with these products he will be able to provide better care to his fields.

His objective is to support his son and, when he grows up, to send him to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana es una joven trabajadora D. 26 años D. edad, elL. está casada y vive  en L. zona rural del distrito D. Túcume – Lambayeque.

Sebastiana se dedica desD. hace 6 años a L. crianza y venta D. aves D. corral (gallinas y patos) en un corral ubicado en L. parte posterior D. su casa. Sebastiana, con los ingresos obtenidos, ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. ElL. cuenta con clienteL. establecida en su zona. 

Sebastiana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1800 nuevos soles cuyo destino será L. compra D. más aves, pues elL. desea expandir su negocio para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida. Además D. L. compra D. aves, Sebastiana, utilizará el crédito para comprarle alimento balanceado a estas.

Sebastiana ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha cancelado adecuadamente sus créditos.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a hardworking youth who is 26 years old.  She is married, and lives in a rural area of the Tucume district in Lambayeque.

Sebastiana has been raising and selling barnyard fowl (hens and ducks) for 6 years in a corral located in back of her house.  With the money she earns from this activity she helps her husband with the household expenses.  She has an established customer base in her area.

Sebastiana is requesting a loan of 1,800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more birds; she wants to expand her business so that she can have a better quality of life.  In addition to buying birds, Sebastiana will use the loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for them.

Sebastiana has already worked with our institution, and she has paid off her previous loans in full.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Warawaritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WARAWARITAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Hilda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de pantalones, venta de cosméticos, venta de pollos, venta de detergentes, trenzado de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de carne. 

La señora Hilda indica que es el tercer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene una micro empresa de hilado y pollereria que inicio desde sus diez y seis años, haciendo un total de veinte años en este negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de material para el trenzado de mantas), que consiguieran por mayor de la C. Rodríguez (lugar comercial de la ciudad de La Paz) y los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The “WARAWARITAS” communal bank will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Center.  It has 8 members and is led by a governing board headed by Hilda.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses.  Among them we have:  pants manufacturing, cosmetics sales, chicken sales, detergent sales, textile weaving, grocery store and meat sales.

Hilda indicates that this is the third cycle she’s worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She currently has a textile weaving micro business and a chicken shop that she's had since she was 16 years old; she’s been in business a total of 20 years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her capital. She will buy textile weaving materials at wholesale on Rodríguez Street (a commercial area in the city of La Paz) that she’ll then sell on order.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her family in some way since she’s single and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers: the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy weaving supplies.

loans.name: Senzokuhle Group

texts.en:
Doris is 55 years old and single with four children between the ages of 17 and 25 years old. Two of her children attend school. She runs a food shop in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in business for two years selling drinks from her home. She also receives income from the goverment's child support grant. She says that she hasn't faced any challenges since starting her business and borrowing from WBD. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy drinks and chickens. Doris would like to see her business grow in the future. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her generate more income, which will make her stock more and she will be able to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To buy chicken and drinks.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo has been running a barber shop for the last two years. He supplements his income from this venture by charging phones and selling mobile-phone accessories. He is 39 years old and an aggressive businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. 

He wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine, timber and iron sheets so that he is able to expand his business.

In the next five years, he hopes to expand the business into a wholesale one.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine, timber and iron sheets for business expansion.

loans.name: María Carolina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos. Cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco  Comunal San Valentín.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 15 y 6 años de edad  los mismos que estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es Abogado.
 
Ella para ganarse algo propio y sentirse útil se dedica a la venta de  ropa, carteras y zapatos,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa hasta donde sus clientes llegan cada vez que tiene mercadería nueva. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la envían desde los Estados Unidos o si no compra en el país pero productos Norteamericanos. Lleva cinco  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar zapatos, carteras y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y agradables.
 
Su sueño es tener una distribuidora de ropa o una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank named "San Valentin" meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo. It is the capital city of Manabi and for many years it has been known as the city of the true tamarinds.

Here we meet Maria. She is 36 years old and she is married common-law. She has two children, aged 15 and 6 and they are both in school. Her husband is a lawyer.

She sells clothing, wallets, and shoes to earn her own money and to feel employed. She sells from door to door although the majority of her sales take place from her home. Her clients visit each time there is a new arrival of merchandise. She works every day and she completes her sales on credit, collecting payments every two weeks. She has her merchandise shipped from the United States or she buys from within the country, but choosing only North American products. She has been in business for five years and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to purchase shoes, wallets, and all types of clothing. She has been with her communal bank since its start and she enjoys especially because her colleagues are very responsible and friendly.

Her dream is to have a clothing distribution center or a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, wallets, and clothing.

loans.name: La Buena Union 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Evangelista is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 1-2” (The Good Union). The members are micro entrepreneurs who sell clothing, assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts and bread.  Some members also have businesses such as a beauty salon or grocery store. The businesses are located mainly in the city of El Seybo, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Evangelista makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their 4 children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is being sick most of the time due to a chronic illness. Her favorite thing to do is to be at her home. Evangelista has sold bread for about 5 years.  She makes different kinds of bread by herself and sells it. She started the business with her first loan from Esperanza. Evangelista became a Esperanza Internacional client because she wanted to work and go forward with her business.

Evangelista is very excited about receiving her tenth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous two loans satisfactorily and taking an important step toward her business’s growth. She will use this new loan to buy fresh ingredients to make the bread, such as flour, butter, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other goods.  She will use the profits to save for her family’s future, because she wants to build her house in a concrete block structure. She thanks all of you for your support. 

In this loan, we are adding two pictures to complete a picture with 10 members since it was impossible to get a photo that captured everyone.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ya que él trabajaba como ayudante con el paso del tiempo empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de llantas, repuesto y además proporcionarle ciertas mejoras. Desea sacar adelante a su familia y establecer un taller pues es así que ha logrado lo que tiene hoy en dia
texts.en:
Francisco’s business is providing transportation service.  He has had this business for over ten years.  He worked as an assistant, and in time he started to work on his own.  

The loan he is requesting is to buy tires, replacement parts, and to provide for certain improvements.  

He wants to get his family ahead and establish a workshop. This is how he has achieved what he now has.

loans.use: to buy tires, replacement parts, and to provide for certain improvements.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Gina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Gina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 38 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 4 hijos de los cuales solo educa y alimenta a 2 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Bellavista Huaracayo. A pesar de la lucha constante que tiene que hacer sola; ella saca fuerzas para continuar trabajando. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en la siembra de alverja, maíz y papa, los cuales cuida constantemente. Según cuenta, lo que más le gusta de su labor es poder pasar tiempo en el campo, “me gusta la paz que encuentro”, afirma. Además de aprovechar en el cuidado de sus animales como vacas y toros, los que cría al mismo tiempo que cuida de sus cultivos. Además de aprovechar la leche que le proporciona para realizar moldes de queso que vende a los pobladores de su zona. Su mayor dificultad es la falta de capital de trabajo, motivo por el cual hace poco cerró su tienda de comestibles; pero le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal de su localidad, donde espera lograr su objetivo, ya que quiere volver abrir su tiendita y así tener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus planes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Vilma de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de alverja y maíz, además de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Vilma, 38 years old, is a courageous single mother of 4 children.  She educates and feeds 2 of her children in their own home, which is located in the town of Bellavista Huaracayo. Despite the constant struggle she has to do things alone, Vilma draws strength to continue working. 

Vilma works in the economic activity of agriculture, and has 20 years of experience in planting peas, corn and potatoes, which she constantly takes care of.  Vilma says what she likes best about her job is spending time in the field, "I like the peace I find," she says. Besides caring for her animals such as cows and bulls, she also breeds the animals while caring for her crops. In addition to milking, she makes cheese molds for selling to people in her area. 

Vilma's greatest difficulty is the lack of working capital, which is why she recently closed her grocery store.  But she was invited to participate in her local community bank, where she hopes to achieve her goal of reopening her store and to have better earnings. Vilma belongs to the communal bank, "Señor de Muruhuay," and this is her first credit with MFP.  She hopes for all your support to continue with her plans.  She also promises to be punctual with payment of her dues. Upon receiving your support, Vilma will invest the requested loan to buy a bag of peas and corn seed, and several bags of natural fertilizer for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seed and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 47 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has a child aged  23, who lives at home and is presently in school. For the past  fifteen years, she has been selling  soap, biscuits, and  batteries  in her community. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit. Shortage of goods is the problem she is facing. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, biscuits, and batteries  for her business. She hopes  to  buy a piece of land and build her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, biscuits, and batteries  for her business.

loans.name: Vicenta Isabel

texts.es: señora Vicenta  es  cliente que ya tiene un crédito en la institución, tiene  tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, y su esposo se llama Rafael juntos trabajan  en la decoración de interiores  y re tapizados de muebles, les va muy bien en su actividad,  la cliente vive  en la zona Achachicala,  el crédito lo invertirá en la compra  de  tela por  mayor y  cuero por rollos estos materiales  le servirán para su trabajo,  ya que con el anterior crédito compraron material pero les falto comprar algunas cosas, la Sra. Vicenta esta muy contenta por trabajar junto a su esposo sin descuidar a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Vicenta is a client who already has a loan with Emprender. She has three children who are of school age. Vicenta and her husband Rafael work together in their interior design and furniture upholstery business and have done very well. She lives in the District of Achachicala.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of fabric in bulk and rolls of leather. These materials will be used for her work. With her previous loan, Vicenta purchased materials but she still lacked a few things.

Sra. Vicenta is very pleased to be working with her husband because she does not have to neglect her family. She is a hardworking individual who is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk and rolls of leather.

loans.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Aracely es una mujer muy emprendedora que les gusta el negocio por tal motivo pensó en poner venta de ropa usada  en una de las colonias de la ciudad, el cual se podría desarrollar como una buena negociante. Con el negocio ya tiene 3 años ofreciendo a su clientela una buena atención, un mejor servicio y variedad de estilos de ropa. Desde que comenzó su negocio comenzó a dar resultados por lo que siguió adelante ya que seria la forma de tener un ingreso extra aparte del que percibía por su esposo que trabaja como jefe de maquinas en una maquiladora de la ciudad.
Brenda necesita comprar ropa de temporada de invierno, por que en este momento ya sus clientes le están solicitando y ve que es una buena oportunidad de tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Brenda Aracely is a very enterprising woman who likes business. For this reason she thought of selling used clothing in one of the districts of the city. This would cause her to develop into a good businesswoman. She's had the business for three years already, offering her customers attentiveness, better service, and a variety of styles of clothing. Ever since she started her business it began to pay off, and so she went ahead with it since it would be a way to have extra income--apart from what her husband earns as chief engineer at an assembly plant in the city. Brenda needs to buy winter clothing because her customers are already asking for it now and she sees that it's a good opportunity to have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz y también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y gallinas, los animales los lleva a lugares como Saylla que queda a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de chicha y negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora para preparar chicha y también para comprar animales como chanchos y gallinas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ubaldina belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa."  This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Ubaldina is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her "chicha" business.  Chicha is a beverage made from a base of corn.  Ubaldina also raises animals such pigs and chickens.  She takes her animals to places like Saylla, located 20 minutes from the city of Cusco.  She wants to improve and expand her business selling chicha and her animal husbandry business.  She requests a loan to buy corn and yellow maize to prepare the chicha, and also to buy animals such as pigs and hens.

Ubaldina is pleased to have this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy corn and yellow maize to make chicha, and also to buy animals such as pigs and hens

loans.name: Nerva

texts.es: Nerva, de 46 años, es una mujer amable, honesta y muy luchadora. Es madre soltera de un hijo de 13 años, por quien día a día trabaja mucho para brindarle lo mejor. Ella tiene una casa propia en donde también ve por los cuidados de su madre y de su hijo. El trabajo de Nerva consiste en la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, ella posee una tienda de abarrotes, ahí vende azúcar, arroz, detergentes, leches, verduras y más. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad. Tiene dos años trabajando de está manera, tiempo suficiente para ganarse el cariño de sus clientes,  ya que con ella reciben una buena atención y sobre todo un excelente servicio. Le esta yendo bien, ya que los ingresos de su bodega son para los ahorros, mientras que percibe ingresos en un trabajo que es del estado y estos son derivados para los gastos de su casa. Espera mas adelante agrandar su negocio y así tener mejor ingresos. Este será el sexto crédito con la institución MFP, hasta ahora le fue siempre bien y espera poder seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. La ultima vez invirtió en su negocio y le dio buenos resultados, es por eso que esta vez esta con bastante expectativa es esta nueva etapa en su grupo.Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos para su bodega ya que si compra en mayor cantidad le darán a menor precio, comprará algunos sacos de azúcar, arroz, cajas de leche y otros productos mas necesarios y que salen a diario.
texts.en:
Nerva is 46 years old and a friendly, honest, and determined woman. She is a single mother of a 13-year-old son. Nerva works hard day after day so that she can provide him the best. She has her own home where she looks after her mother in addition to her son. Nerva’s work involves managing a grocery store where she sells basic necessity products such as sugar, rice, detergents, milk, vegetables, and other items. Her business is located in her home, which is situated on one of the busiest streets in the city. Nerva has been in business for two years, which is enough time to gain the affection of her customers. She provides them a great amount of attention and, above all, excellent service. Nerva is doing well. The income from her store is designated for savings while the salary she earns from her job is used for the household expenses. She hopes to expand her business so that she can have more income.

This will be her sixth loan with the MFP organization. Until now, Nerva has always done well and expects to remain punctual with her payments. She achieved good results with her last investment. Since she has reached a new stage in her group, Nerva has greater expectations. The amount she requested will be used to buy products for her store in greater quantity. This will enable to get a lower price on items such as sacks of sugar, rice, cases of milk, and other necessary products that sell on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, rice, cases of milk, and other products.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El sr. Carmelo está, casado. Es de profesión Fotógrafo. Nos comenta que lleva en el negocio alrededor de 20 años, es uno de los fotógrafos pioneros de la comunidad de Curuguaty. 
Actualmente está actualizando su taller de fotografía  por lo que ya cuenta con maquinas digitales con lo cual facilita todo tipo de trabajo, pues lo que antes le llevaba algunas horas, ahora es todo cuestión de minutos.
El señor solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas, lo cual le son para elaborar marcos para encuadrar las fotos que saca. El está muy contento por esta oportunidad que se le está brindando, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Carmelo is married. He is a photographer and has run his business for about twenty years. He was one of the first photographers in the community of Curuguaty. He is currently in the process of updating his studio with digital cameras which will enable him to take on all kinds of projects. What used to take him hours, now only takes minutes.

Carmelo is seeking a loan to buy wood to make frames for his photos. He is very happy to have this opportunity which will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy wood to make photograph frames

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents. She sells vegetables at Watreso near Abura. She has been selling vegetables for 3 years.  She uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family.

She will use her loan to buy more vegetables for sale. With the new profits, Yaa will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey has been engaged in his rice farm business for eighteen years and he usually earns P27,000 every crop season. Rey is willing to work hard every single day to lift his family out of poverty. Rey is married to Elmira who helps him manage their farm. According to him, through the income generated from his farm business, he is able to support his family’s needs and to be able to continue sending his children who are currently in school. 

At the moment, he is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain his rice production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain his rice production

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food stuffs in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Elizabeth is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase salt and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 24-year-old university student who lives with his parents and brothers and sisters. He is in his fourth year, and majored in computer science. He hopes to make something of himself one day.
In addition to being a student, Alaa also works for the electricity company in the mornings before going to his classes to help support himself and help his parents with expenses. He is requesting a loan to pay his fees for the remaining semesters so he can gain a full-time job or even start his own business and achieve his dream of making something of himself.

loans.use: to pay his fees for the remaining semesters.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia tiene 49 años de edad, soltera por viudez, tiene 7 hijos todos están casados, ella vive en la comunidad de Rio Blanquito, Choloma, Cortes, sola con su padre.
Doña Antonia es muy trabajadora, para obtener ingresos realiza varias actividades de negocio la principal es la elaboración y venta de nacatamales (son hechos de harina de maíz, rellenos de carne, papas, aceitunas, chicharos y arroz y envueltos en hoja de guineo), otra es la venta de ropa y sandalias, además vende agua a sus vecinos ya que ella tiene un pozo y en la comunidad hay problemas de agua pues ella recibe otros ingresos de allí. También tiene un apartamento que lo alquila. 
Es el segundo préstamo solicitado a ODEF y lo necesita para comprar ropa nueva y sandalias. Su plan es tener siempre productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 49, is single because she is a widow.  She has seven children, and they are all married.  She lives alone with her father in the Rio Blanquito community in Choloma, Cortes.

Antonia is a very hard-worker.  In order to get income she does several business activities.  The main one is making and selling “nacatamales” (They are made with corn flour and filled with meat, potatoes, olives, peas, and rice.  They are wrapped in a banana leaf).

She also sells clothing and sandals.  In addition to this she sells water to her neighbors because she has a well.  The community has problems with water, and she gets other income from the well.  She also has an apartment that she rents out.

This is the second loan that she has requested from ODEF.  She needs it to buy new clothes and sandals.  Her plan is to always have products to sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Kandi

texts.en:
Kandi is 35 years old.  She is married and has four school aged children.  To make a living, she does mixed farming.  She has been engaged in her farming for over eight years and earns approximately KES.5,000 a month for these activities. 

She has been a good client and this is her 4th loan which she plans to use to buy farm supplies, including fertilizers and seeds. 
Kandi hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Bidii Yetu Group

texts.en:
Redemtah's group is called the Bidii Yetu Group. It is located in the Busia District and is comprised of 15 women and three men. The group is led by Redemtah, who is pictured on the right with her hand raised. She describes her harvest last year as poor. Redemtah is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined the fund to access hybrid seed and fertilizer, obtain the best input prices, be assured of reliable delivery, and grow enough food for her family. She hopes to be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program.  
 
Redemtah is requesting a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to plant a half-acre with sorghum and maize. Group members will each receive half-acre input loans during the 2013 season. In total, the Bidii Yetu group will receive inputs for nine acres of land. Redemtah plans to use her harvest profits to repair her home, buy livestock, save for the future, send her children to school, and perhaps invest in another business.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to plant a half-acre with sorghum and maize

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María de 38 años de edad es una mujer que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años por lo que se siente muy feliz, ya que cuenta con un lugar donde vivir. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar la masa para las tortillas que elabora en su vivienda desde hace 3 años, además María posee una tienda de productos básicos, lo que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar. María desea mejorar su vivienda por lo que espera construir una acera y una cuneta frente a su vivienda, ya que el agua que cae del techo se acumula y causa malos olores y un aspecto poco higiénico en su vivienda. Por lo anterior María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una acera y una cuneta frente a su vivienda.

loans.use: Para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una acera y una cuneta frente a su vivienda.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine aged 32 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 4 and 5 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 10 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Ignitus

texts.en:
Ignitus is aged 38, a single father of 3 children and only one attends school. He deals in produce mainly buying and selling of maize,beans and rice along side operating a salon business whereby he cuts hair for both male and female. 

He intends to grow and expand his business the more only to be limited by high rental fees and price fluctuation. He is seeking for a loan facility to buy more maize for sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize for selling.

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Madam Massan D., spouse of ATCHON was born in 1954 at Ekpui, in the prefecture of Vo. She made her studies in Ghana and has always kept the Anglophone style. Married and mother of 4 children, she is a very devoted and dynamic woman in commercial activities and operates a food shop situated in Lomé, the area of N’tifafa-Komé. She has always shown the proof of good management and her previous credits have been promptly repaid and without incident. Her selling of food is coupled with the selling of the Brassiere beverages in retail. In order to increase the profitability of her activities, she needs a financing of $550 in order to be able to respond to the increasing demand of her customers. This credit will serve to constitute a stock of foodstuffs and beverage products in view of the end years activities, and especially the Christmas and New Year feasts

Madame D. Massan épouse ATCHON est née en 1954 à Ekpui dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle a fait ses études au Ghana et a toujours gardé le style anglophone. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle est une femme très dévouée et dynamique dans les activités commerciales et tient une boutique d’alimentation générale sise à Lomé quartier N’tifafa-Komé à Lomé. Elle est une femme qui se respecte et se fait respecter par son entourage. Elle a fait preuve de bonne gestionnaire à travers ses crédits antérieurs promptement remboursés et sans incident. Ce commerce d’alimentation générale est couplé avec la vente de détail des boissons de la brasserie. Le développement et la meilleure rentabilité de ces activités nécessitent un financement de $550 pour pouvoir répondre à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. Ce crédit servira à constituer un stock de produits alimentaires et de boissons en vue des activités de fin d’année, et surtout des fêtes de Noël et de Nouvel An.

loans.use: To buy and storage foodstuffs and beverages products

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Faapaia is a single 26 year old lady from the village of Levili -- about 5 kilometers from the town centre of Apia. Her business is pancakes which she is sells at the Fugalei market, which is the main market of Samoa. Faapaia is a daughter of a Minister in the Assembly Church, and her time is committed to their youth activities. Through their youth activities, Faapaia had the idea of starting a business when they visited the market one day, and experienced other ladies doing the same business becoming really successful. She then dreamed of running a business like these ladies, and it did come true last year. Her aim is become a successful business woman that will be responsible for taking care of her youth mates and especially her parents when they retire from church. She has no intension of getting married. All she wants to do is to give back her parents the love and support they gave for her in this life.

loans.use:
Buy ingredients and materials for her pancake
business

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is a local resident of Beylagan town. He has his own barber shop.

At first, he was renting the shop. He bought it in 2002. He is 24 years old and single.

He has wanted to renovate the interior of the shop since he bought it, but he has had no funds to do it.

He wants to buy new furniture and a chair, and also a pair of hair-cutting machines. This way he will be able to attract more clients and increase his income.

He has applied to Normicro's Beylagan branch for a loan. He needs $700 for the first-time loan.

loans.use: To buy new inventory

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Maria Josefina is married and has two children, who are six and twelve years old. With the birth of her last child, the costs of living increased and the salary of her husband was insufficient for all the expenses. So Maria decided to start her own business with cosmetic sales. In this way, she is able to contribute to improving her family's quality of life. The good services and the easy payment options that she offers have been very well recieved. Thanks to the recommendations of her clients, she now has lots of orders.

At this time, Maria hopes to see her business grow more than ever. The costs of raising her children have increased a lot now that they are studying, and since classes are starting soon, she needs to buy the school materials that they require. She is now requesting a loan of $200 dollars that she will use to purchase merchandise to fill the orders that she already has. She promises to repay the loan in three months. Be a part of making this business grow and help Maria. She greatly appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Maria Josefina es casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 12 años de edad, al nacer su último hijo, las necesidades del hogar se incrementaron y el salario de su esposo era insuficiente para todos los gastos, por lo que Maria decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, de esta manera es como ella puede contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el buen servicio que ofrece y las facilidades de pagos que les ofrece han sido muy bien aceptados, gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes ahora tiene muchos más pedidos.

En estos momentos Maria desea ver crecer su negocio más que nunca, pues los gastos en su hogar se han incrementado mucho por los estudios de sus hijos, ya casi es inicio de clases y necesita comprarles el material que requieren. Ahora solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, con lo que planea surtir pedidos que ya tiene, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, y ayuda Maria, ella agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to fill her orders for cosmetics

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Tinh (26) and her husband Dung (32) have a small grocery store in their home.  They sell a wide variety of items in their grocery store, including vegetables, candy, and household tools.  They use the money to raise their young 3-year-old girl.  The family is very poor.  Their house (pictured) is built from wooden sticks tied together.  They earn between 10-15,000 VND ($0.62-0.94) per day from the grocery sales.  They used to receive loans from other sources that charged high interest rates.  Most of their earnings went to pay off the interest on those loans.  They received 2 loans from Mekong Plus before, one of which was funded by Kiva, and since then, they have not asked for a loan from their old lenders.  They are now able to keep all of their earnings and save their money to send their daughter to school.  They would like to continue to work with Mekong Plus and Kiva to improve their grocery store.

loans.use: to increase the stock at her grocery store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace E. is 48 years old, married to Mr. E. with 6 children. She lives in Benin City and she sells yams. She is a faithful member of LAPO and has been in this business since 2004. She solicits a loan of $800 to enable her buy more yams for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Cesar Manuel

texts.es:
I have been selling meat for more than three years. My business is selling and delivering meat to various places in the city of Nuevo Laredo. This business is my family's only source of income. I need an additional delivery truck to be able to make more daily deliveries. I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a truck for delivery of my products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de tres años en la venta de carnes. Mi negocio es la venta y entrega de carne a varios lugares de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia. Me esta haciendo falta una unidad mas para la repartición de la mercancía y tener mas entregas. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de una camioneta para la entrega de la mercancía.

loans.use: Buy a small delivery truck

loans.name: Maasifu_A Group

texts.en: Sara, age 35, is married with 2 children (ages 6 and 11). She owns a business of selling drink items such as water and sodas. She began this business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 5:30am to 6pm. She now hopes for a loan to buy more stock of drink items. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Witness K., who sells wood and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy drink items

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tinh, 41 years old, is living in Nghiem Xa village, Cho town, and has 3 children that are still going to school. Besides breeding animals, her other activity is to sell rice in the market. Her income is pretty stable, 6.875 USD/ day. She has never borrowed money from any agencies but now, she joins the Binh Minh Microeconomic Program because she can repay in small amount and it is also suitable with her activity.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tình năm nay 41 tuổi ở thôn Nghiêm Xá, thị trấn Chờ, có 3 con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Ngoài chăn nuôi, công việc tạo thu nhập của chị là buôn bán gạo ở chợ. Thu nhập gia đình chị cũng ổn định, 110000đ/ngày. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu cả, nhưng giờ, chị tham gia Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì vốn vay ở đây được trả dần, nhỏ lẻ, phù hợp với công việc kinh doanh sản xuất của chị.

loans.use: breeding pigs

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đặng Thị Định is 40 years old. She runs a restaurant for the last 5 years. Her restaurant serves breakfast to local villagers. She is a pleasant hostess so it explains why her restaurant is always busy. Her family income is 250 USD a month. Mrs Định is married and has 3 children. They all live in Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her husband is a farmer. Their children go to school and help her out in their free time. The school fees and related expenses are high because 2 of her children are in their final years. Mrs Định is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand her restaurant, renew the menu to attract more customers. She is in her 7th year as a TYM member

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Định, 40 tuổi, làm nghề bán hàng ăn được 5 năm nay. Chị chuyên bán đồ ăn sáng phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Thái độ phục vụ vui vẻ nhiệt tình nên cửa hàng của chị Định lúc nào cũng đông khách. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình chị là 250USD. Chị Định đang sống cùng chồng, một nông dân, cùng 3 con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Các con chị đều đã lớn nên ngoài thời gian đi học cũng hộ trợ được mẹ rất nhiều. Hai cháu đang học những năm cuối cấp nên chi phí cũng khá tốn kém. Chị Định rất muốn vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thêm thực phẩm, thu hút thêm khách hàng, mở rộng hàng ăn lớn hơn. Chị Định là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma suffered the loss of her husband in a fateful car accident, which really affected the family’s emotional and financial stability. Undoubtedly, life had to go on, so Vilma had to take charge of the household and work in order to provide her children with food and an education. We found Vilma preparing her delicious mazamorras, a popular South American pudding-like dessert, which were ready to be sold in a small stand near the country’s central highway. She rents this business space, but she would like to build a small restaurant next to that business space so that she can work there permanently.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

VILMA sufrió la pérdida de su esposo en un fatídico accidente de tránsito, este suceso afectó mucho la estabilidad emocional y económica de su familia. Pero sin duda la vida tenia que proseguir y Vilma tuvo que tomar las riendas de su casa y trabajar para procurarles alimentación y educación de sus hijos.Así encontramos a Vilma preparando unas deliciosas mazamorras que estaban listas para su venta en una casita pequeña instalada en la autopista central de su país. El espacio en el que se desempeña es alquilado y tiene el deseo de construir un pequeño restaurante próximo a este espacio con el deseo de desempeñarse de manera continua en el.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer a greater quantity of pastries

loans.name: Juliana's Group

texts.es:
Maribel and Juliana have been members of Banco Comunal Urubambe for 2 and 4 years respectively. The come from the Urubamba community, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.

Maribel is 25 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She produces woven texties, such as blankets, and sells them at the market in Santa Clara. She also weaves sweaters.

Juliana is 29 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. At the weekend she sells food in her district. She also sells delicacies from Monday to Friday.

Maribel and Juliana need a loan of $525 to invest in the purchase of thread, wool, biscuits, chocolates, cigars, chewing gum and sweets.

Maribel and Juliana have two dreams: that their children do well in their careers to expand their factory and to have a grocery store.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel y Juliana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urubamba hace 2, 4, 4, años respectivamente. Ellas son de la comunidad de Urubamba que esta ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Maribel es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Maribel realiza tejidos en telar como frazadas, pasadizos y lo vende en el mercado Santa Clara. Además Maribel teje chompas.

Mientras que Juliana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Juliana vende comida en su distrito, los días sábados y domingos. Además Juliana vende golosinas de lunes a viernes.

Maribel y Juliana necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hilos, lanas, galletas, chocolates, cigarros, chicles y caramelos.

Los sueños de Maribel y Juliana son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su taller y tener una tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of thread, wool, biscuits, chocolates, cigars, chewing gum and sweets.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Her incredible dedication to the sale of music videos has made Sra. Ana into a business woman who now has two stands where she sells CDs. She has been dedicated to this business for many years and is now able to help her 3 beautiful children get ahead in life. Now Ana would like to improve and expand her business to one day have her own store where she can send her CDs. She is a single mother and works very hard to ensure that her children may get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Su ardua dedicación en la venta de videos musicales, ha hecho de la señora Ana una mujer de negocios, ya que cuenta en la actualidad con dos puestos de venta de CDS. Ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace muchos años, y gracias a ésta ocupación está sacando adelante a sus 03 hijos y se siente orgullosa de tener unos hijos lindos y buenos. Ahora Ana se encuentra deseosa de ampliar y mejorar sus negocios. Ella es madre soltera y su ardua labor como padre y madre hacen que salga adelante, quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, y con el tiempo tener un local propio y amplio para vender sus CDS.

loans.use: Increase her capital to sell more entertainment items

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34154&_tpos=4&_tpg=1

Cecilia is partner of the village bank Amaquella (Quetchua for “Don’t Loose”).

Cecilia lives with her partner and 4 children. She is 46 years old. Together with her partner, Cecilia sells “cebiche” (a typical Peruvian dish made of fish prepared with lemon) from a tricycle on the street in front of the Univesrity of Ayacucho every day, while her partner sells cebiche from his parents’ home.

Cecilia needs a loan of 1200 soles, which would be invested in buying fish, lemon and sweet potato.

Cecilia’s dream is to expand her business into a big restaurant and to build a house.

loans.use: Cecilia needs a loan of 1200 soles, which would be invested in buying fish, lemon and sweet potato.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy F. is 30 years old.She is a married woman with 3 children ages 9, 6 and 4. She became a banana seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 7.30am to 8.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Happy now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario has hand-made earrings for the past year and a half. Before that she worked making earrings and selling them independently, but the business fell apart and she decided to work for other people and offer her service of making earrings. Rosario also cooks once a week for the popular restaurant that is close to her house. The loans that she has requested will help her invest in materials that she needs to make earrings. Rosario would like to set up an internet café and copy service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario hace aretes artesanales desde hace 1 año y medio. Antes ella trabajaba haciendo los aretes y vendiéndolos de manera independiente, pero el negocio decayó, por lo que decidió trabajar para otras personas y ofrecer su servicio de confección de aretes. Rosario también cocina una vez por semana en el comedor popular que está cerca de su casa. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le servirá para invertir en la compra de los materiales que necesita en la confección de los aretes. Rosario quisiera poner unas cabinas de Internet y servicio de fotocopiadora.

loans.use: Invest in the materials she needs to make earrings

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya Y. is 45 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 5 children. She started her own business 10 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses.

Zulfiya is a market entrepreneur from Dushanbe city. She runs a stall selling candies and sweets. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Zulfiya is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again.

Zulfiya is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 800 USD for the term of 9 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a new vending facility. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Zulfiya reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Enlarging her range of goods and with the generated income purchasing a private store

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim I. sells food items at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast. Ibrahim has received a Senior High level education. He is married and has two children. His wife is a trader. Ibrahim has been selling food since 1990. He is responsible for feeding the family and the paying the utility bills and the children's school fees. His loan will be used to buy food items for resale. He hopes to reinvest the profits in his business so he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Ni Kadek Murtini

texts.id: Ni Kadek Murtini berasal dari desa kaliakah . Ni Kadek Murtini berumur 32 tahun dan suaminya bekerja sebagai petani. Ni Kadek Murtini memiliki semangat hidup sangat tinggi. Ni Kadek Murtini memiliki 2 orang anak, anaknya yang Pertama bernama Ni Putu Sri Muradiana Umur 4 tahun dan yang kedua bernama I Kade Agus Adi Angga umur 2 tahun.Kadek Murtini dari dulu sangat berkeinginan memelihara babi, karena tidak memiliki dana rencananya gagal. Saat ini harapannya kembali muncul karena ada kesempatan untuk berusaha, lewat program Dinari yang menyalurkan dana untuk program ternak dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan. Dan pembayarannya pada akhir periode pinjaman,dan akan menerima dana ini secepatnya.Modal yang didapat nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli 4 ekor babi penggemukan. Harapan Kadek Murtini supaya dana ini secepatnya bisa dicairkan.
texts.en:
Ni Kadek Murtini is from Kaliakah village. She is 32 years old and her husband is a farmer. They both have 2 children, Ni Putu Sri Muradiana (4 yo) and I Kade Agus Adi Angga (2 yo).

Ni Kadek always wants to enter the business of raising pig, however due to the lack of funding she has been postponed that plan.

She has a new hope now as she will be participate in a 6 month loan program from DINARI. She is planning to use the loan money to buy 4 piglets to be raised.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en: Mukadas K. first applied to MicroInvest in 2005. At that moment she was in a difficult business situation, but thanks to the loans she took, she improved her existing business and expanded the trade outlet to cigarettes, chewing gum and notebook selling. Her loan sums increased permanently and show her business developing and her business turnover increasing. Today Mrs. K. Mukadas trades children's wear that she brings from Istaravshan and the Kyrgyz Republic. When she goes for the parcels, every time she gets a good assortment. Currently, Mrs. K. is on the last loan repayment step, and she is going to continue working with MicroInvest, so she applied to KIVA with the request of a business development loan of 3,100 TJS for three months for expanding her trade outlet merchandise.

loans.use: To expand her store's merchandise.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi A. is 26 years old and married. She has no children. Naomi sells women's clothes and baby clothes. She plans to increase her stock to meet the demands of her customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US $700) to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more women's and baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Jacinta Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Jacinta Gonzales  se dedica a su negocio de venta de bebidas como jugos y gaseosas atendidos en su localidad en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y como toda mujer nicaragüense, siempre se ha preocupado por llevar el sustento a sus hijos los cuales requieren de su apoyo.

Es importante destacar que actualmente el negocio atraviesa una situación y es que requiere del apoyo financiero para su desarrollo por medio de la compra de las bebidas gaseosas. Por esto ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel esperando que le sea otorgado y así mejorar su condición en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jacinta Gonzales sells soft drinks, such as juice and soda, at La Terminal Market in the city of León. She is a uniquely hardworking woman and, like all Nicaraguan women, she takes great care in raising her children (all of whom are still dependent on her). It is important to understand that her business is in a situation and needs financial support to develop and purchase soft drinks. She has requested a loan through Ceprodel with the hope that it will be granted and improve her business's situation.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks.

loans.name: Rashidan Gulzar Masih Group

texts.en:
Rashidan baji, 52, is a widow and a citizen of a historic place called Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 40 years. Rashidan baji is an uneducated lady. She couldn’t get an education because her parents couldn’t bear her education expenses. Rashidan baji’s deceased husband left her with one son. She worked hard to establish her son. She has been selling clothes for 10 years and has been able to register her son in a driving school so that he was able to learn driving skills. She is still selling clothes because she has a good number of customers in the community and outside of the community. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son so that he will be able to earn a good income.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Gulshan baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. Doras I. wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell. Naseem Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
N. Harriet is the leader of Mutai group in Jinja. She is a married lady with a charcoal selling business. She sells both as a wholesaler and a retailer. She buys the charcoal from the forests, loads the lorry, and takes the charcoal to her shack, where she stores it. Since most of her customers buy in small gallons, she is able to make a weekly profit of 30,000 Ushs. As a result, she has been able to buy herself a plot of land and pay fees for her children.

Harriet needs a loan to be able to buy more charcoal for her business. Once she has access to money and more savings, she plans to construct rental houses as well as to expand her business to include firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina C. is married and has two children. She has received an education through primary school. Sabina is a trader and teacher; she sells material and clothes at Abura, which she has done since 2003. While Sabina is employed as a trader, her husband works as a nurse. Sabina uses her income to support her family by providing housekeeping money.

Sabina will use the loan to purchase silver sets, material and clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabina plans to save for school fees.

loans.use: To purchase silver sets, material and clothes to sell

loans.name: God's Will Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata B., Hawa B., Kadiatu K., Mariama K. and Rebbeca Musa, and their group name is God’s Will. This will be their third loan from Kiva through Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT). The previous loan they received from SMT was for Le 500,000 each, and was a great help to these entrepreneurs. Having repaid the last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new one of Le 800,000 each.

Fatmata B. (middle) is the leader of the group. She was born in Robuya Romemde, in northern Sierra Leone. She is 50 years old and married with four children. One of her children is in secondary school and the others are in primary school. For over ten years Fatmata has been selling 'gara lappers' – locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs. With this loan, she will buy five 'pieces' of 'brillain' (a brillian is the white cotton that is dyed to produce a gara lapper, and thirty yards of brillian is called a piece). A piece of brillian costs Le 100,000. Fatmata will use the rest of the loan to buy inks and soda powder, as well as pay experts who design styles on the brillian.

loans.use: To invest in her business by buying five pieces of brillian

loans.name: Tit
