texts.en: Tit H. is 43 years old, has owned a medium house located in the Pursat Province for years and lives with her family members. She and her husband currently cultivate a variety of crops on farmland that was inherited from their grandparents. From the farming work, the family has made an income to feed their children from the time they were young until they have ready married. The family has been farming since 1990 but they have faced a problem in plowing the farmland because they have not owned a buffalo. Therefore, Tit H. is applying for a loan to buy a pair of buffalo for farm activities. She will rent the buffalo out to other farmers for a profit. Mrs. Tit H.'s husband is pictured because she was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo for farm activities.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr:
D.  Agnès est née vers les années 1968 dans la Commune de Cotonou,  Capitale Economique de la République du Bénin. Agnès a pour époux OLOWOLAGBE Antoine.  Agnès est mère de quatre (4) enfants  tous scolarisés et respectivement âgés de 18 ans, 15 ans, 12 ans et 12 ans (jumeaux). Agnès réside à Cotonou au quartier Enagnon, un bidonville depuis plus de 25 ans. 

Depuis cinq (5) ans Agnès est dans le secteur de la restauration. Agnès s’approvisionne en différents produits dont elle a besoin pour la restauration à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin  et en produits de brasserie dans les dépôts de Cotonou. Agnès a eu déjà six prêts de ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur.  Pour répondre au mieux aux besoins sa clientèle, Agnès sollicite un septième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Agnès was born around 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She has OLOWOLAGBE Antoine for a husband and is the mother of four children, ages 18, 15, 12, and 12 (twins), who are all in school. For over 25 years, she has been residing in Cotonou in the Enagnon district, a shantytown. For five years, Agnès has been in the restaurant field. She supplies herself with different goods needed for her business from Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Her drinks merchandise is gotten from Cotonou outlets. She has already had six loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She was able to use them to raise her business to a higher level. To respond best to customer needs, she’s requesting a seventh loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 25-liter drums of peanut oil, a 100-kg sack of corn, three 50-kg sacks of rice, a sack each of cassava chips and yam chips, and ten 6-packs of soft drinks.

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị (343051311) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên.  She is married and has three infant children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Mola Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Mauufe is a member of the Mola Tubariki borrower group,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 26,20 and 15 years.

Mauufe started her own cafe business selling food 6 years ago,she works 12 hour a day and earn mothly profit approximeatrly 100,000 Tsh.

This is Maaufe second loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 450,000 in order to buy more rice,sugar wheat etc for her business.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Mauufe hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Burda is also a member of the same borrower group she requested loan amount 200,000 in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice,sugar,

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 37 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past eight years.

Joyce hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 59 years old and already a widow. She is the mother of five children and she is very proud that, through her sacrifices, she was able to send them to school and they were able to graduate from college. She is glad that they are very responsible and hard working. They also assists her in managing her general store business in their community in Zamora Street, Tuguegarao City. Leticia is doing also her best to improve her business to earn a higher income.

Leticia is very thankful for the success of her children and her general store business. She believes that this is the fruit of her sacrifices and the answer to her prayer. She wants further improvement of her business so she will not be too dependent on her children when they all have their own families. With this, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional capital that she can use for her store’s continuous development.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: A. Pierrette est née en 1970 à Sakété, dans la commune de l’Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Mariée à FALOLOU Ignace, Pierrette est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et deux enfants sont à sa charge. Pierrette réside depuis deux ans à Cocotomey non loin de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par son mari Ignace. Pierrette achète depuis trois ans des tissus et des chaussures à Lomé, pays voisin du Bénin, qu’elle vend à Cocotomey. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et accroître son activité, Pierrette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, l’obtention d’un crédit.
texts.en:
A. Pierrette was born in 1970 in Sakété, in the community of Ouémé in southern Benin.  She is married to FALOLOU Ignace and is the mother of four children, who are all in school, and two children are in her care.  Pierrette has been residing for two years in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Family expenses are covered by her husband, Ignace.  For three years, Pierrette has been purchasing cloth and shoes in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She sells these goods in Cocotomey.  To bolster her working capital and to grow her business, she's requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes

loans.name: Seik

texts.en: Mrs. Seik O. was born in 1969 and she lives in Andoung Samrith village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn for living. She is a widow with four children two of whom are duck breeders and another one is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of three years old. Since breeding duck is going well, Mrs. Seik O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more 400-duck for breeding and she would use the rest of the loan duck food for her poultry business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more 400-duck for breeding and she would use the rest of the loan duck food for her poultry business.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo Gaganto, 44 years old, is a farmer. He owns and manages a small rice field, which he hopes can provide his family food, clothing and other basic needs. He is thankful to God for pouring a lot of blessings on his family. He said that his farm is earning a lot. His family totally depends on their harvest to help pay the daily expenses in their home.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. His requested loan is to grow the size of his harvest by buying all the farming necessities. In this way, he believes he will be able to grow his income as well and support his family better.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua is a thirty-eight-year-old divorced mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town but the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Akosua is a food vendor, preparing and a local dish called banku (cooked dough) which is served hot with soup. She buys her materials from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: la Señorita Candelaria es originaria de la comunidad de chimente su fuente de ingreso  es la confeccion de playeras, camisas pantalones, mochilas dicho trabajo se lo heredo su querido padre hace cuatro años conjuntamente con sus dos hermanas como se ven en la fotografia, deciden hacelo mas grande el negocio y ellas mismas vender el producto  en el mercado de Chimaltenango y San francisco el Alto Totonicapan, visita las oficina de ASDIR para solicitar un credito que lo invetiran en la compra de forro, ciperes, conos,telas, botones. Con ello surtir su mercaderia y poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes
texts.en:
Candelaria comes from the community of Chimente. Her source of income comes from making t-shirts, tops, pants and backpacks. She inherited this job four years ago from her beloved father along with her two sisters, who you can see in the photo. Together they decided to expand the business and sell the products themselves in the markets of Chimaltenango and San Francisco el Alto Totonicapan. They visited the office of ASDIR to apply for a loan which they will use to purchase lining, zippers, thimbles, fabric and buttons. With these items they will re-stock their merchandise so they can satisfy their customer's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, Cnía. Soto a 7 Kms. de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas emprendedoras mujeres con la idea de acceder al préstamo a través del comité, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para aclarar todos los detalles sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron por la oportunidad de capacitarse, aumentar su capital de trabajo y de esa manera aumentar sus ingresos.
El comité lleva por nombre Santa Lucía, se encuentran en el décimo primer ciclo, integrada por 16 humildes mujeres, quienes hacen hasta lo imposible para mejorar su nivel de vida de ellas y de sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son señoras muy sacrificadas y activas, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Cada una de ellas se dedica de acuerdo a la facilidad con que cuenta para cada actividad, una de las madres de familias Máxima González quien se dedica a la venta de frutas. Ella se traslada muy temprano hasta los locales de abastecimiento (Mercado de Abasto) de donde trae sus productos para sus clientes.
Ella posee un pequeño puesto al costado de la calle donde expone sus productos para la venta. Sus clientes lo conforman la gente que transita por el lugar. Así como Doña Máxima Las demás integrantes se dedican a:

texts.en:
Some entrerprising women got together in the city of Paraguarí, Cnía. Soto, which is 7 km. from the Paraguarí Office. They met with the idea of accessing a loan through the communal bank. From there, we ran the meeting to clarify the details of the program. They accepted the opportunity to qualify in order to increase their working capital and increase their income. The group’s name is Santa Lucía. They are in their eleventh cycle. The group is comprised of 16 unassuming women who do near the impossible to improve the level of life for themselves and their respective families. All of the members are active and sacrificing women. They have invested their loans in their respective activities. One of the mothers, Máxima González, sells fruit. She goes very early to the supply places (Supply Market) where she takes her products to her customers. She has a small stall on the edge of the street where she displays the products she has for sale. Her customers are the people who pass through the area. That is about Máxima. The other members devote themselves to: 1 Dominga Duré Vegetable and clothing sales 2 Mirian Cañete Employee 3 Ma. Ramona Cañete Employee 4 Ma. Cecilia Cañete Sells food 5 Tomasa Cañete Sells vegetables 6 Clara I. Sells food 7 Andrea González Sells food 8 Norma I. Grocery store 9 Valentina P. Employee 10 Ma. Juana González Street vendor 11 Juliana Rolón Vegetable and clothing sales 12 Julia Duré Employee 13 Maxima González Sells fruit 14 Emilia Cañete Sells food 15 Critel R. Sells food 16 Vilma Cañete Grocery store

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their respective activities

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 52 years old, married and the mother of four children. Three of her children are currently in school and her first son is working. She is a food vendor who sells kenkey as well as cereals like maize and peanuts in bulk. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. Her major target groups are the travelers who ply the road to their destination. Those travelers purchase the kenkey in bulk. She treks to Kumasi in the Ashanti region to buy her stock of goods in bulk. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
El microempresario: Francisco José B. tiene 50 años de edad, es casado con 3 hijos dos mayores y uno menor de edad. Este señor se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la comprar y venta de productos derivados de la leche tales como el queso y la crema, dicho producto viaja al departamento de Chontales y lo compra, posteriormente viene a entregarlo a distintas pulperías de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Este producto lo entrega a sus clientes y 15 días después les  cobra el 50 % y otros 15 días mas tarde el 50% restante, para tal actividad cuenta con un capital el cual invierte en sus compras. Sin embargo su capital no es suficiente para la demanda que tiene de este producto, por lo que necesita se le apoye con financiamiento para el mismo. Además aprovecha para agradecer a todos los prestamistas que depositaron  su confianza en el dándole un préstamo, ya que el año pasado fue beneficiado con un préstamo por parte de kiva.

Solicita poder comprar: 8 quintales de queso cada quintal tiene un precio de US 90 dólares y 100 libras de crema, comprando cada libra de crema a US 0.80 dólar cada una.
texts.en:
The microentrepeneur: Francisco José B. is 50 years old and is married with three children (two older children and one young child). He has worked for 20 years in the purchase and sale of milk-based products such as cheese and cream. He travels to the Department of Chontales to buy the products and then delivers them to various grocery stores in the city of Bluefields. Francisco delivers his product to his clients, and then 15 days later charges them 50% of the price. 15 days after that he charges them the remaining 50%. In order to do this he relies on capital which he invests in his purchases. Without a doubt, his capital is not sufficient to meet the demand for the product which is why he needs help with financing. He would like to thank all the lenders who have given him their trust in him by giving him a loan - last year he was the recipient of a loan from Kiva. He would like to be able to buy: 8 quintales (equal to 100 pounds) of cheese, each of which costs $90 and 100 pounds of cream, each of which costs $.80.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese and cream

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla, 41, runs a sari-sari store to provide financial assistance to her family. She is currently a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. with a loan request of 10,000 PHP. The loan will be used for more groceries for her store. She has six children in the family. She wants to expand her business and at the same time send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa. She has been selling children's clothes since 2007. She sells dresses, shirts and sweaters; she also sells slippers, etc. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop since the new spring and summer collection has arrived. This is the first time that she has requested a loan.

A feature of Mariam's work is that she knows how to treat her clients and they feel comfortable purchasing from her. Her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had no difficulty since she had a large network and people knew her well. Mariam decided to set up her business because she wanted to improve her financiA. situation; she is a very active woman who does her best to improve her income and provide the best for her family. Therefore, she decided to have independent work. In the future, she plans to keep up the good work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Pemawathi

texts.en:
Pemawathi is a 42-year-old woman living with her husband and two children in southern Sri Lanka.

Pemawathi and her husband manage and run a toy shop in their village. The income they receive from the business helps to pay the family's day-to-day expenses. They started this toy shop two years ago, and the income it has provided has helped to educate their children, on top of paying daily expenses.

Pemawathi is a very hard worker and helps out other members in the village whenever the opportunity arises.

Pemawathi is asking for a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help expand the business. Her business has a good location within the village and her shop has lots of goods, which she hopes to expand with the help of this loan. Her clientele seems to be growing so she hopes this loan will help her expand.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy supplies for her toy shop

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya N. est une femme de 41 ans, elle est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a été 4 fois bénéficiaire de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait un petit commerce de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Rokhaya N. is 41 years old, divorced and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for two years and has been granted four loans, all reimbursed without a problem. She runs a small business selling firewood and charcoal. Her earnings enable her to take care of her children and meet her own needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Marasulova Tunuk`s Group

texts.ru:
Тунук является лидером этой группы. Ей 57 лет, она замужем. Ее супруг работает на мельнице, а также получает пенсию в размере 50 долларов. Клиент живет с младшим сыном, остальные дети переселились со своими семьями. Клиент предоставляет  услуги КДУ (переработка кукуруза в комбикорм). Кукурузу покупает у народа по 5 сом и реализует по 10 сом. На кредит она планирует закупить кукурузу для переработки и минеральные удобрения для выращивание картофеля.

Арыстанбеку 40 лет.  Его супруга имеет ларек возле школы. Клиент занимается Животноводством: откорм и перепродажа КРС. Клиент дополнительно занимается услугами трактора, доход в месяц составляет около 150 долларов. На кредит клиент планирует сделать мелкий ремонт дома.

Сагындыхон 45 лет. Ее супруг работает частным водителем. Старший сын на заработках в РФ, второй сын занимается животноводством, младший ходит в школу.Клиент активно занимается реализацией молока и сузьмы. На сей день имеют 1 быка, 2 доенной коровы с теленком. Также закупили автомобиль Audi. На кредит она планирует закупить минеральное удобрение.

Гулчехрахан 34 года. У нее 4 детей, старшие дети ходят в школу, младший в садик. Ее супруг работает на маслобойке.  Они предоставляют услуги маслобойки. Переработка подсолнуха и хлопчатника в масло. За месяц перерабатывает минимум 5 тонн подсолнуха. Масло реализует по 50 сом, а жмиху по 14 сом.  Она планирует закупить подсолнух для переработки в масло.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Tunuk is the leader of this group of borrowers. She is 57, married. Tunuk'a husband works at a mill and he also received a pension of $50. Tunuk's youngest son still lives with her--the other children have moved out with their families. Tunuk processes corn to produce cattle food. She buys corn for 5 som ($0.11) and sells the final product for 10 ($0.22). Tunuk plans to use this loan to purchase corn and mineral fertilizer to grow potatoes. Arystanbek, 40, is married. His wife has a vending stall near local school. Arystanbek is a cattle farmer. In addition, he provides services with his tractor making $150 a month. This loan Arystanbek will use to make small repairs to his house. Sagyndyhon is 45. Her husband is a car service driver. Sagyndyhon's oldest son is a migrant worker in Russia, the younger one is a cattle farmer, and the youngest is in school. Sagyndyhon sells milk and sour cream. She has a bull, two milk cows, and a calf. Sagyndyhon recently purchased an Audi. She plans to use this loan to purchase mineral fertilizer. Gulchehrahan, 34, is a mother of 4. The older children are in school and the youngest one is in kindergarten. Gulchehrahan's husband works at an oil processing plant, which processes sunflower and cotton seeds. The plant processes a minimum of 5 ton of sunflower seeds a month. The oil is then sold for 50 som ($1.10) per unit and oil cake sells for 14 som ($0.30). This loan Gulchehrahan will use to purchase sunflower seeds for oil processing.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kipmutai

texts.en:
Kipmutai is 24 years old and single. He is a dedicated young farmer from Western Kenya near Kitale town. He has been farming for 2 years and owns a kiosk where he sells his vegetables to the local people. He also earns income from a tree nursery business where he sells his tree seedlings of blue cypress to the local market. His main challenge in the farming business has been the high competition in the market and lack of capital for the project.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.20,000 to start a poultry project. He is confident that this loan will build a strong foundation economically before he starts a family. In future, he would like to acquire his personal farm in order to expand his farming.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn B. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old and widowed with three school-aged children. She runs a retail store selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish to sell and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Genalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell and for working capital

loans.name: Cheang

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a middle-aged woman whose husband is shown in the photo above. P. has two kids who are very young and not yet enrolled in school. Her husband is an ox-trader, buying animals to fatten for a while at their house. Then, he sells the animals to other people to earn a profit.

To pursue a daily revenue, P. owns a milling machine that she uses to provide a service to farmers for a fee. In addition, she buys rice in bulk to mill and sell. Mature rice commands a lowest price in this harvesting season, but she doesn’t have money to buy it for her stock. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to be used to buy rice in bulk to mill and sell.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to mill and sell

loans.name: Pioneta

texts.en:
Pioneta G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Pioneta is married and has a 13-year-old child. Pioneta owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Pioneta has been engaged in her business for over 13 years.

Pioneta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pioneta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to pay for the seeds she acquired and to purchase additional farm inputs. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Pioneta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and to purchase additional farm inputs

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun S. is a married woman who lives in Kor village, in Takeo province, and she is 27 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Sao S., are farmers who own a two point five-hectare piece of land where they can grow crops to sell to support their family. Aside from farming she is also a farm laborer while her husband is a construction worker, too. Their field infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Noeun S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the other is too small to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Milca

texts.en: Milca B. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products as well as different kinds of dried fish in her community. She is 39 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Kipaducan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Milca has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Milca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Milca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Milca is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
O. Mohira is 49 years old. She and her husband have raised four children. Mohira makes the embroidery of the national skull-cap for men and women. She is really hard working. Mohira gets up very early and goes to bed very late. When she is not embroidering the skull-caps, Mohira is selling them in the local market. Mohira is planning to expand her business. She requests $1500 USD. Mohira is planning to spend the loan on fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap. Mohira has received two preivous loans from IMON and has demonstrated that she is a reliable client. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Mr Enkhtur is 40 years old and lives with his wife, Mendbayar, and his two children aged 14 and 5. They live in Erdenet city which is the third largest city in Mongolia. His wife works in the local hospital as a cleaner. Mr Enkhtur owns a small garage. Since 2007 he has been running his auto repair business. In 2009 he bought tire repairing equipment and expanded his business. 

Enkhtur is very hard-working and is well-known in his local community. He has his own local customers, whose cars he fixes and services. 

Mr Enkhtur and his family live in their parents' old house which needs some improvement. They are requesting this loan as they want to buy some building, insulation and decorating materials and to do make some improvements to the house.

loans.use: to buy building, insulation and decorating materials to improve their house

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.es: El señor Oscar tiene un negocio que es una pequeña panadería ubicada en su casa de habitación, entrega su producto a diversas pulperías y sus comarcas todos los días de lunes a domingo. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ha sido muy importante para ella. El señor Oscar vive junto a su esposa la cual ayuda con el negocio, ya que cuando el sale a entregar ella vende el producto en su casa. Está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de materia prima del negocio como leña, harina huevos, mantequilla entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar's business is a small bakery located in his house. He delivers his products to various pulperías [small grocery stores] in his district every day of the week. This is not the first time that he is requesting a loan, and previous ones have been very important for him. Oscar lives with his wife, who helps him with the business. When he is out delivering bread she sells it from their house. He is requesting a new loan to buy staples like firewood, flour, eggs, butter, and other necessary items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood, flour, eggs, butter, and other necessary staples for baking

loans.name: Manibadraa

texts.en:
Manibadraa N. is 43 years old, a single man who lives with his mother, brother and nephew in Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His mother is retired while his brother works as a loader in the Bayangol Hotel. 

Manibadraa worked as a servant in the housing committee between 1985 and 1987, and in 1987-1988 he was employed as an assistant worker in Temuulen-Minj Co., Ltd. In 1988, he had an accident and became disabled. He started to operate a wireless phone service at the Huchit Shonhor, one of the main market in Ulaanbaatar in 2000 and since then has built up a stable operation. 

His earnings have enabled him to put up a building that will be used as a grocery shop from 2010. He says, " Nowadays, my old business is not operating very successfully because everyone has a cellphone today." Manibadraa is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more inventory to open his grocery shop, located in his own yard.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Lala

texts.ru:
Lala B. 29 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey sin kotoromu 7 let i doch kotoroy 5 let. Lala yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, paselok Gobcuk vmeste s semyoy.

Lala uje 4 qoda zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u brata. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Lala B. is 29 years old.  She is married and has 2 children: 7-year-old son and 5-year-old daughter.  Lala is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Gobcuk village in the Fuzuli region together with her family.

Lala has been involved in the food sales business for 4 years.  She learned this business from her brother.  Now she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy food products for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of products for resale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina P. is a married woman who lives in Zone 5, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Pig-fattening businesses. Her husband Ely P., who is 42 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 8 and 15 years old. 

Regina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Regina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children. 

Regina P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M., 30, is the sole proprietor of a barber shop in Mtwapa Mombasa. He is married to Caroline Steve and together they are blessed with one child. He has been in this business for the last seven years and has done great.

Stephen is requesting his second loan from KADET Ltd to buy another machine for haircuts and use the anticipated profit to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to be successful and own rental houses.

loans.use: To buy another machine for haircuts.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 27 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. Nadia's husband is an accountant. Nadia has had her general retail store in the Nyarugenge district of Rwanda for 2 years. She employs 2 people and her store is open from 7 am until 9 pm.  

Nadia has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can expand her shop by adding a large quantity of goods. These goods will mainly include foodstuffs like juice, notebooks, water, and different types of flour, etc. With these goods, Nadia will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to reinvest in her business so that her revenue can keep growing. If successful, Nadia will continue taking care of her children by providing more food for them as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase more juice, water, flour, etc.

loans.name: Timothy Olindo

texts.en:
Timothy Olindo I. is a hardworking man of 37 years, married to Janet Ikapyan. Together they have three children aged 10 years, 6 years and 3 years. He has been keeping poultry for the past three years and he earns a monthly income of KES. 35,000.

He learned about KADET LTD through marketing. He has no history with any other Microfinance Institution. He has applied for his third loan of KES. 83,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy poultry feed and more poultry to keep so that he will have more eggs to sell to his customers. He plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start Dairy farming.

Timothy hopes to grow his business and become the leading local investor in Lumakanda Eldoret-Kenya.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and more poultry.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 53 years old and is a widow. She is a proven entrepreneur who sells food in her village. She has been in this business for about 12 years and works from 8 am until 8 pm every day.

Chantal has requested a Kiva loan that will allow her to increase her sales, as well as her profits. With this loan, she hopes to start selling various fruits, vegetables, cooking oil, and onions because they are often purchased in her business area. With this additional business, which hopefully will attract many customers, Chantal will keep expanding her business with a vision of being financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nomer

texts.en:
Nomer R. lives in the village of Samonte. He is 24 years old, single and makes a living by growing rice. He has been in this business for more than nine years and earns about 30,000 PHP for each harvest.

In 2010, Nomer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for a new loan for 23,000 PHP to buy seeds and seedlings for his next crop. This loan is his first, and he plans to use the additional income it generates to support his family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for a new rice crop.

loans.name: Myrene

texts.en: Myrene is a married woman who lives in Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by fishing. Her husband, Mario L. Jr., is 27 years old and works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 1 and 5 years old. Myrene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Myrene is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Jose Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo tiene 45 años, es una persona humilde. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería y mercadería en general. El se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras en el mercado más cercano, el tiene sus clientes que le venden sus productos favorables. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio desde muy joven le gusto el comercio y ha trabajado en diferentes actividades pero necesitaba algún negocio que le proporcionara ganancias diarias y es así que decide establecer una pulpería. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para invertirlo en capital de trabajo y así comprar  productos de consumo diario para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, frijoles, azúcar y productos en general. Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio y además mantener su record crediticio.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, 45, is a humble person.  His economic activity is a grocery and general store.  He rises very early to make his purchases at the nearest market.  He has his customers that sell him favorable products.  He’s been in this business for over five years; he’s liked commerce since he was very young and has worked in a variety of jobs but needed a business that would produce daily profits and that’s how he decided to open a grocery store.

He is asking for a working capital loan to invest in daily use items for his grocery store like: rice, oil, beans, sugar and products in general.  His greatest wish is to continue growing in his business and to keep his good credit history.

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch V. was born in 1968, and she is a villager who lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. Aside from farming, she also earns her living by selling recycled items. 

Her husband, Mr. Thorn Thy, was born in 1970. He is a fisherman and he also supports his wife's businesses. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their five children: who all attend the local school.

During this dry season she wants to grow more rice, but she doesn’t have enough money to grow it. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to support her farming. She would use the rest of the loan to buy recycled items for selling. 

Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to support her farming

loans.name: Iris  Emili

texts.es: L. Srita  Iris Emili, es una joven que vive en casa D. sus padres elL. actualmente  trabaja  en una maquiladora para  solventar  sus  propios  gastos y también aporta para L. ayuda económica D. sus padres ya que forma parte D. su familia,  elL. solicito el crédito porque se quiere independizar un poco y tener un poco mas D. privacidad en su domicilio, platicando  con sus  padres decidieron construir una habitación mas en L. casa para que Emili  obtenga   un poco  mas  D.  privacidad  y al mismo tiempo adquiera  responsabilidad  en sus actos y en su persona.
texts.en: Iris Emili, is a young woman who lives in her parents' home.  She currently works in an assembly plant to earn money to pay her own expenses and to contribute financially to her parents, since they are all part of the same family.  She is requesting the loan because she wants to make herself a little more independent, and she wants a little more privacy in her home.  After discussing with her parents, they decided to add a room on to their house so that Emili can have a little more privacy and at the same time take more responsibiltiy for her actions and for herself.

loans.use: To add on a room to her house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is currently in the business of selling sugar. She is 26 years old. She and her husband, who works as a policeman, have two children, one of whom attends school. 

Ruth has requested a loan in order to stock more sugar to offer for sale. She hopes eventually to expand her business with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more sugar to offer for sale

loans.name: Nalukenge

texts.en:
Nalukenge M. is an individual client from the Mpigi Branch of Pearl Microfinance. She is 20 years old and married with 1 child aged 2. She has a business of buying, smoking and selling dry/smoked fish from Bukalunga, Ggolo. She sells her fish to fish buyers that come to her stall at the lake shore and her home. She is able to make an income of 1,200,000UGX in a month from a business that she has been operating for 3 years. She is hard working and devoted and she needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for smoking. Her future plan is to be able to build a house for her family.

In the photo, Nalukenge stands next to her smoked fish with the Loan officer on the left.

loans.use: to buy more fish for smoking and selling.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 42 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 23 years old. 

Juvy is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing corn and fruit for 16 years. Juvy works hard to improve her business and provide for her family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is the owner of a clothing shop where she sells women's and children's clothes. She is well known in her region. Most of her clients are relatives, friends and neighbors. She's a hard worker and seeks perfection for her family. 

Khadija is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time, in order to increase her spring/summer collection, which will help in saving the necessary money for a special surgery that she needs to have after increasing her income. 

Her previous loans were used to improve her business and they had a big positive effect in improving her income. She hopes to buy her own shop and move to it, so she can stop renting others' shops.

loans.use: to increase her spring/summer clothing collection.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Cecilia,   es una clienta antigua de la institución que por la  proximidad de su domicilio siempre solicita crédito en la agencia, demostró un trato amable y Cortez en la avaluación que se lo hizo, además por el buen historial crediticio que demostró en los anteriores créditos, La Sra. Cecilia vive en la zona alto San Pedro, de la ciudad de la paz Bolivia, la Sra. Cecilia se dedica a la elaboración y envasado de crema de árnica actividad donde le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela es muy trabajadora y además abnegada con su trabajo, ella tiene la voluntad de que con trabajo, va un día tener su negocio en un lugar mas comercial y con mayor producción y rentabilidad, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a long standing client of the institution that, because of the close proximity of her home to the agency, often requests loans.  She behaved kindly and courteously when she was evaluated.  Besides, she established good credit history with her previous loans.

Cecilia lives in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz, Bolivia.  She makes and packages Cream of Arnica (medicinal flower), a business she does well in because she has a lot of customers and she is very hard working and dedicated to her work.  

She hopes that through her work someday she will have a locale in a more commercial area and greater production and profits.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy packaging supplies for cream of arnica.

loans.name: Norma Estanislada

texts.es: Norma Estanislada tiene 64 años, su actividad es una farmacia. Tiene más de 15 años en su negocio ha logrado mejorar su negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Ella inicio este medio de vida porque no hay mucha competencia con este tipo de actividad, es una persona trabajadora y ha aprendido muchas cosas con este negocio. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de medicamentos variados como jarabes, pastillas, vitaminas, descartables entre otros.
texts.en: Norma Estanislada is 64 years old, and she runs a pharmacy. She has been engaging in this activity for 15 years, and she has succeeded in improving it with great effort. She opened her pharmacy because there is not so much competition in this field. She is a very hardworking woman, and she has learnt many things through her activity. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy various medical items such as syrups, tablets, vitamins and dispensable syringes.

loans.use: To buy various medical items suche as syrups, tablest, vitamins and dispensable syringes.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru:
Турсун родилась в селе Чорголо (Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). Мать пятерых детей -  двух сыновей и трех дочерей. Замужем и проживает со старшим сыном, снохой и внуком. 
Турсун родилась в простой семье фермера. Она с детства помогала маме по хозяйству и любила заниматься домашними хлопотами. После окончания школы устроилась в местном колхозе в качестве доярки. В 1971 году, через четыре года после окончания школы Турсун вышла замуж. В начале, вместе с мужем, проживали в доме его родителей в селе Сосновка (Жайылский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан) - муж работал в местном колхозе, а Турсун присматривала за хозяйством. Вскоре колхоз, в котором работал муж Турсун, выделил им участок земли под строительство дома. В течение 3-х лет муж Турсун строил дом и после рождения первого ребенка (дочь), они переехали от родителей. Хозяйством обзавелись не сразу, со временем появилась молодая телочка, а на выделенном им государством участке земли они стали выращивать клевер и ячмень. Спустя какое-то время Турсун устроилась в местной текстильной фабрике в качестве ткачихи, где проработала более 20 лет. Со временем семья росла, а также разрасталось хозяйство, за счет приплода скота, который продавали на рынке. В 2008 году Турсун выкупила торговый павильон по трассе Бишкек – Ош и начала торговать продуктами питания, по торговле ей помогает младший сын со снохой.
Сейчас в хозяйстве Турсун имеются 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 2 лошади и 12 овец. Для дальнейшего увеличения  поголовья скота, Турсун обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS). За счет доходов, она планирует дальнейшее расширение хозяйства и открытие новой торговой точки.
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Tursun was born in Chorgolo village (in the Chuysky region of Kyrgyzstan). She is the mother of five children—two sons and three daughters. She is married and lives with her eldest son, daughter-in-law and grandson.

Tursun was born into a simple farm family. Since childhood she helped her mother on the farm and like to do housework.  After leaving school, she started work on the local collective farm as a milkmaid. In 1971, four years after graduating, Tursun married. In the beginning, she and her husband lived with his parents in Sosnovka village (in the Zhaiylsky area of Chuysky, Kyrgyzstan).  Her husband worked on a local collective farm, and Tursun looked after their household. Soon the collective farm where Tursun’s husband worked allocated them a plot of land in order to build a home.  Within three years, Tursun’s husband built a house, and after the birth of their first child (a daughter), they have moved away from his parents. They did not get a farm all at once.  In due course, they acquired a calf and on ground allocated by the state they began to grow clover and barley.  After a time, Tursun found work at a local cotton mill as a weaver, where she has worked more than twenty years.  In due course, the family grew, as did the farm, which was expanded after the sale of some cattle at the market.  In 2008 Tursun purchased a shop in the Bishkek – Osh road, and started to sell groceries.  She is helped by her younger son and daughter-in-law.

Now on Tursun’s farm there is one milk cow, one calf, two horses and twelve sheep. Tursun has applied to  Bai-Tushum  and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock.  With her income, she plans to further expand the farm and to open a new shop.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Akufoé Mawusinu

texts.fr: Veuve de 53 ans et mère de cinq enfants, Akufoé est revendeuse de trousseau bébé au marché Assiyéyé  d’Adidogomé depuis 2001.elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Afin de pouvoir assurer les  besoins de ses enfants et  mieux supporter les charges de sa maisonnée Akufoé ne  lésine pas sur ses efforts pour accomplir ses tâches.
texts.en: A 53-year-old widow and the mother of five children, Akufoé has been a seller of baby accessories at the Assiyéyé market of Adidogomé since 2001. She gets her supplies from Lomé. To ensure the needs of her children are met and to cover household expenses better, Akufoé spares no effort to accomplish her tasks.

loans.use: to buy infant accessories

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Choeurn lives in Siem Reap Province. She has a small piece of land for rent for parking when villagers come to buy anything in the local market. From this business, she can make a profit of approximately $1.50 each day. 

She has a life partner in her husband who sells modern clothes modern for teenagers and cooking materials. They have two children who are studying in the school. Mrs. Choeurn will use the loan to purchase a used motorbike for her husband to transport cooking materials and also to buy additional cooking material to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike and to buy additional cooking materials to sell.

loans.name: Yamit Elena

texts.es: Yamit  tiene 32 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 13 años,  en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, conocido por las bellezas de sus manualidades, convertidas en hamacas, mochilas accesorios entre otros artículos de tradición cultural  transmitidas de mujer a mujer.  Este es el caso de Yamit que aprendió de su madre cuando ella tenía 12 años de edad y le han ayudado a generar ingresos para el bienestar de su hogar. . Las manualidades producidas por Yamit son de muy buena calidad, pues el Servicio Nacional de aprendizaje con apoyo del estado nacional, han logrado impactarlas suministrando aprendizaje de calidad en el manejo de las técnicas artesanales. El sueño de yamit es aumentar cada día sus ingresos, para continuar estudiando y terminar su sueño de ser enfermera, pero no es suficiente su capital de trabajo para aumentar su producción y con ello su venta. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará hilos para elaborar en tejido vertical bolsos, hamacas y mochilas, los cuales  serán elaboradas para responder a pedidos de sus hermanos quienes son los que venden a artesanías en la Isla de Barú a los turistas. Mientras Yamit trabaja esforzándose por aumentar sus ingresos manejando en su negocio una rentabilidad no menor al 58% que planea con el tiempo aumentar.
texts.en:
Yamit is 32 years old and lives with her two children who are three and thirteen years old. They live in the San Jacinto municipality in the department of Bolívar.  The area is known for its beautiful handicrafts such as hammocks, backpacks and accessories, among other elements of traditional culture that have been passed down from woman to woman.

This is the case for Yamit who learned from her mother when she was twelve years old. The handicrafts have helped in generating an income for the wellbeing of her home. The handicrafts Yamit makes are very good quality. The Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje [National Training Service], with help from the national government, has been able to impact the quality by providing quality training in artisanal techniques.  

Yamit’s dream is to increase her earnings each day so as to be able to continue studying and achieve her goal of becoming a nurse. However, her working capital is not sufficient to increase her production and therefore her sales. This is why she is getting a loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy thread to use in her vertical weaving of bags, hammocks and backpacks. She makes the crafts to respond to the orders made by her siblings who sell them on the Isla de Barú to the tourists.

Yamit works hard, making a great effort to increase her earnings while running her business at nothing less than a 58% profit margin which she plans to increase over time.

loans.use: to buy thread to use in her vertical weaving of bags, hammocks and backpacks.

loans.name: Musidal Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in the village of Yoni, in northern Sierra Leone about 45 years ago. He is married to a tailor and the couple has 3 children: 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. 

For over 6 years now, Mohamed has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, groundnuts, etc. This is first loan that Mohamed and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mohamed is going to use his share of the loan to buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts in bulk to add to his business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma  is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Emma  has a retail shop that sells used clothing or "ukay-ukay". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy used clothing to sell.

Emma  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emma  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alina

texts.es: Alina, de 33 años. Vive en concubinato con Diego. Ambos tiene 2 menores hijos: Sarai y Cristofer; a los que alimentan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Miraflores. Todas las mañanas como hace 8 años. Alina se dirige con su esposo al caserío de Ayapata, lugar donde se ubican los terrenos agrícolas que posee. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, maíz y demás hortalizas. Según cuenta, en temporadas de cosecha contratan con su esposo peones que les ayudan a extraer más rápido el fruto de la tierra, “eso me gusta”, afirma. Pero existen temporadas en los cuales las plagas azotan su sembrío por lo que pierden el dinero invertido. Pero eso no la amilana, ya que existen cosechas en las cuales obtiene buenas ganancias. Asimismo cuenta que siembra en terrenos extensos por lo que no tiene el capital necesario para la inversión de la cosecha. Por ello está planeando viajar a la capital del país a comercializar los alimentos por toneladas. Así ahorrará dinero para poder seguir sembrando. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Alina de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Alina, age 33, lives with her partner, Diego. They have two young children together, Sarai and Cristofer, whom they raise and educate in their own house in the Miraflores hamlet. Every morning for the past 8 years, Alina and her husband head to the Ayapata hamlet, where their crop fields are located. Their main crops are potatoes, corn, and other produce. According to her, for harvest, she and her husband hire farm workers to help them pick their crops faster. "I like that," she affirms. However, there are times when pests invade her crops, and she loses her investment, but this does not daunt her because there are other harvests which bring her good profits. She also states that she cultivates on vast fields, which means that she does not have the capital necessary for farming. For this reason, she is planning to travel to the capital to sell her crops by the ton. Thus, she will save enough money to continue farming. She is a member of the Señor de Muruhuay microfinance group, and this is her third loan with MFP, where she feels grateful for the support she receives. Furthermore, she promises to be punctual with her repayments. Upon receiving the loan, Alina will invest it in purchasing 3 sacks of pea seed and several sacks of organic fertilizer for the next planting season.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of pea seed and several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.ru:
Василь родом из Западной Украины. Он женат, живет в городе Ивано-Франковске. В свое время Василь торговал автомобилями на автобазаре. Но вот уже 12 лет Василь работает в службе такси и предоставляет пассажирские перевозки на территории Украины. Его ежемесячный доход составляет 6 000 гривен. Параллельно с работой в такси, Василь в первой половине дня работает в службе теплокоммунэнерго, в отделе работы с должниками.  

Используя кредит в размере 10 000 гривен, Василь планирует отремонтировать некоторые элементы кузова своего автомобиля, заменить салон и подготовить машину к продаже. В ближайшем будущем он планирует продать это транспортное средство и приобрести более новое, возможно, минивэн, который бы работал на метане или дизеле. Оставшуюся часть прибыли Василь планирует использовать для того, чтобы обустроить свое жилье. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Vasyl is from Western Ukraine.  He is married and lives in the town of Ivano-Frankivsk.  Previously, Vasyl used to sell cars at an auto market.  Since then, Vasyl has been working in the taxi service for 12 years and provides passenger transportation services on the territory of Ukraine.  His monthly income is 6000 hryvnia.  Parallel to the taxi work, Vasyl spends first half of his day working for a utility service, in the collections department.  Using the loan in the sum of 10000 hryvnia, Vasyl plans to repair various parts of his car trunk, replace the interior and prepare the car for sale.  In the near future, he plans to sell this car and purchase a newer vehicle, possible a minivan, that runs on methane or diesel.  Vasyl plans to use the remaining part of the profit to fix up his home.

loans.use: to repair various parts of his car trunk, replace the interior and prepare the car for sale

loans.name: Elsy Maribel

texts.es:
Elsy, continua en su negocio, por tal razon se ha decidido a solicitar nuevamente un prestamo, ya que los materiales que usa se le agotaron y ya habia cancelado buena parte del prestamo anterior.
El crédito lo necesita para fortalecer más su negocio y comprar más: leña, maíz, y de ese modo tendra insumos para la elaboracion de tortillas y siempre mantener dos empleadas que le ayuden debido a la demanda.
texts.en:
Elsy continues with her business which is why she has decided to ask for a new loan as the ingredients she uses are running out and she has already paid off a large part of her previous loan.

She needs the loan to further strengthen her business and buy more firewood and corn. In this way she will have the consumables needed to make tortillas and keep on the two employees that help due to the high demand.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, and gas

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married. She has two children. Jocelyn is 34 years old and she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Jocelyn sells soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and spices to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 6,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock for her store. Jocelyn has  been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jocelyn hope to improve  her business so that she can support her two children by sending them to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Reina, tiene 53 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora, se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana, para ordeñar sus vacas y darles de comer. Luego lleva los animales (vacas) al terreno (lugar donde pasteroan las vacas), este se encuentra a cuatro kilómetros de distancia de su casa. Posteriormente, ella se traslada donde esta su milpa y ahí trabaja durante todo el día, junto con su compañero de vida, ya tiene diez años de experiencia en esta actividad.

La Señora Reina junto con su esposo, viajan a la ciudad, con el objetivo de adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios, el viaje es autobús durante treinta minutos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Reina, es para comprar dos vacas, con esto ella producirá más leche y la venderá en la comunidad, de esta manera recibirá mejores ingresos, lo cual le serviría para el sustento de ella y su compañero de vida.

De los ingresos que reciba, terminara de pagar el terreno, donde ellos viven; al mismo tiempo, le permitirá mejorar su vivienda, ya que es de lámina y ella desea construirla de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Reina is 53 years old and lives with her life's companion.  She is a hardworking woman who gets up at 4:30 in the morning to milk her cows and feed them. Later she takes the animals (cows) to the lot where they pasture, located four kilometers from the house. Later, she goes to her cornfield and works there all day long with her life's companion, since she has been doing this for ten years.  

Reina, with her husband, travels to the city, with the objective of acquiring the necessary agricultural materials. The bus ride lasts thirty minutes.  

The loan Reina is asking for is to buy two cows. With this, she will produce more milk and sell it in the community. This will mean more income which will serve as support for her and her life's companion.  

From the income she receives, she will finish paying for the land. At the same time, it will allow her to improve her home. It is made of sheeting and she wants to re- build it with bricks.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Roeun and his wife, Khing, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1991 and have two sons and three daughters. Two are in school and the other three assist their parents in their farming business.

Roeun and his wife are vegetable farmers. He is asking for a loan of $600 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty sells banku at Eguafo. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is in security. Aunty has been selling banku for 10 years. She assists her husband in providing for their family. She will use her loan to buy maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Lazia's Group

texts.en:
Lazia's group is comprised of three hard working women. Lazia is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Lazia has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Lazia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for resale, and will help Lazia generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Lazia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Lazia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lazia's future prospects by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, "a woman with dedication for her work and obligation in life", she is 61 years old married to Eulogio. Rebecca is busy managing her vegetable store, where she sells different vegetables in the community. Rebecca is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional vegetables for her little store to have more to offer the people in the community. Rebecca hopes that someday she can achieve her dream for her children to have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans, cabbages, squash and bananas for her store.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 44, works as a butcher in the food market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling meat since 2008 and already has her own permanent customers. Her main stock is beef, and she takes it from her permanent suppliers in countryside. 

Now she needs to increase her sock before this Lunar New Year day, the respectful Mongolian traditional holiday. Because the price of lamb increases during this holiday and sales volume is increased largely for weeks, she is taking a loan to purchase a large amount of beef from her supplier to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of beef from her supplier to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 27 years to 34 years. He describes himself as honest. He provides taxi transportation. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a highly populated area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy taxi spare tires. His business goal is to expand his business and be the best provider of this service in the area within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy taxi spare tires.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés, de 46 años de edad, esta casado con Felicidad y fruto de relación tienen 03 hijos y juntos residen en su propia casa en la comunidad de Camunachari. Hace 18 años, cuando Moises era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, actualmente posee su propia parcela cultivados con plantas de cacao. La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación de los Ingenieros Agrónomos periódicamente. Su producto con mayor demanda es el grano del cacao por la calidad del producto que los ofrece y fruto de ello percibe buenos réditos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, de esa manera avanza con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en las cosechas y sacar la maleza. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para que de esa manera pueda seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en la cosecha y desmonte de maleza.
texts.en:
Moisés, age 46, is married to Felicidad and has three children.  They live together in their own house in the Camunachari community.  Eighteen years ago, when Moises was an adolescent, he worked the land with his parents.

He now has his own land where he cultivates cacao plants.  The key to his success stems from creativity and the desire to work.  He works with his plants in a high-tech way because he periodically gets training from the agricultural engineers.  His product that has the greatest demand is the cacao bean because of the quality of the product.  He gets good financial return from this product.

He normally works alone, but during the harvest time he hires day workers.  This way harvesting and sorting his products are done with more speed.

He will use the loan to contract day workers to help him during the harvests and to clear the fields.

His plan for the future is to continue increasing his agricultural production so that he is able to continue meeting his customer demand.

This will be his first loan with MFP.  He knows that the loan will be of great use to the progress of his work.  He will use the 1,000 soles to hire day workers to help him with the harvest and to clear the fields.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Sylivestre

texts.en:
Sylistre 43 years old. He is married with six children aged between 3 and 11 years, 1 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 18 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
About 35 years old, she is a widower and mother of three (3) children. Having not the chance to go to school, Madam Massan N. swore that none of her children will remain illiterate like her and is fighting for their education. Very clever and active, she remains one of the working women in the village of Ahonkpé where she lives with her orphans.
