Four members are forming this group loan. They are located in Svay Prey village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chak S., a married woman born in 1980,  was selected to be the group leader by the other members. 

She is a farmer who owns a field that she uses to grow rice. Her husband, Mr. Kek Thoeun, is a farm laborer who is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. This couple has three children. Two are attending the local school and one is too young to study or work. 

With their occupations, they still earn less than enough income to support the family. So in order to increase income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Chak S. would like to ask for a loan to buy chickens for breeding. The rest of the loan she would use to buy zinc for her house roof.

loans.use: To buy chickens for breeding

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita L. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children in Khokhana Dobato. The majority of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. L. has one daughter and one son. Her daughter is studying in grade 6 and her son is in primary school.

Mrs. L.'s husband's name is Lal Bahadur L.. He is a taxi driver and owns his own taxi. He drives his taxi in Kathmandu valley. All the members of her family depend on her husband's income. Now Mrs. Sunita L. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 20,000 to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.use: to repair their taxi

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo G. is from the village of Canabuan Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 44 years old and is married. To make a living, Reynaldo plants and harvests rice for sale. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2011, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be Reynaldo's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for his rice farm

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
Muhamadi is a forty-three year old married man with six children, who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of caring for seven household members solely rests on him, and his desire is to build a permanent house in place of the current semi-permanent one.

For seven years he has been running a spare parts shop and the business has been very profitable, despite challenges in limited funds. His desire is to set up a garage. Muhamadi needs the credit facility to buy motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañia Candia de la ciudad de Caacupe, que dista a 18 km de la oficina regional de la zona.
La presidenta del comité es la Sra. Gloria A., ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces, vive con su marido que es empleado público y sus hijos que son estudiantes.
La Sra. Gloria es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, elabora sus dulces semanalmente y sale a venderlos por la ciudad de Caacupe y Atyra, sin importar el calor o el frío, ni las lluvias fuertes que a veces vienen, pues su familia es muy pobre y ella necesita del dinero que gana como ingresos de sus ventas diarias.
Gloria y todas sus compañeras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo que les brinda para poder seguir aumentando sus ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida, por eso se animan a solicitar este crédito, porque saben que pueden contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas con el préstamo financiero.
Gloria, por ejemplo, solicitó el crédito para poder comprar más azúcar y frutas para la realización de los dulces caseros que prepara y para poder adquirir también gas para su garrafa, sin la cual no puede cocinar sus dulces.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Compañia Candia in the city of Caacupe, located 18 km from the regional office in the zone.
Gloria A. is the group’s president and makes and sells candies.  She lives with her husband who is a public employee and her children are students.

Gloria is a very hard working and sacrificing woman.  She makes her candy every week and sells it in the cities of Caacupe and Atyra, regardless of the weather (hot, cold, or hard rain).  Her family is very poor and she needs the money that she earns from her daily sales.

Gloria and all of her cohorts are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the support that they have given to help them increase their incomes and be able to improve their qualities of life.  They were motivated to request this loan because they know that they can count on the lenders’ assistance with the loan.

Gloria, for example, requested her loan to be able to buy more sugar and fruit to make more homemade candy.  She will also get a cylinder of gas, without which she cannot make her candy.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es: Sulma tiene 52 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años compra animales en un periodo aproximado de 4 meses de nacido para luego engordarlo y al cabo de un tiempo y cuando ya tiene el peso exacto, son vendidos a un mayor precio. Se considera una excelente vendedora, su facilidad de palabra y capacidad de convencer logra que pueda negociar la venta de estos animales. Las ganancias que adquiere le ayudan para el sustento de su familia. En ocasiones sus hijos lo apoyan en este trabajo, cuando tiene tiempo libre. Con el pasar del tiempo, su capital de trabajo ha ido incrementando y eso la mantiene tranquila y satisfecha de realizar un trabajo, que aunque duro debido a las muchas veces que da un cuidado minucioso en la alimentación e higiene de sus animales, es a la vez muy compensado. Desea tener más cantidad de animales para que continúe con esta actividad. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará un animal más para su establo.
texts.en:
Sulma is 52 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband and five children. For the past six years, she has been buying and raising animals. Within a period of approximately four months, she fattens the animals until they reach an exact weight and then sells them at a higher price. She is considered to be an excellent trader. Her speaking and persuasive abilities have enabled her to negotiate the sale of her animals. The earnings she generates helps her to support her family. Occasionally her children will help her with the work whenever they have free time. Her operating capital has increased over time and has allowed her to perform her work without problems. There have been several instances in which Sulma has found the work difficult because the feeding and health of the animals require meticulous detail, yet there are other times she finds very rewarding. She wants to produce better quality animals in order to continue with her business.

This is her 14th loan with MFP. Sulma is very pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because of all of its members are people she knows. They are responsible and supportive individuals. She is grateful to those responsible for approving her loan request because the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she is reqeusting will be used to buy another animal to add to her stable.

loans.use: to purchase one head of cattle.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, D. 23 años, es una joven muy sencilL. y alegre, vive en casa D. sus padres y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro, con tal D. sobresalir en L. vida. Visitando a sus clientes en su misma casa, Raquel realiza L. venta D. sus productos D. belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con L. venta D. sus cosméticos rápidamente. En el distrito D. Ancon es muy conocida y saben que los productos que venD. son D. muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedara a su rostro, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar por L. venta D. sus productos, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen plata para pagarle, pero elL. siempre se las arregL. para que le paguen completamente todas sus ventas. En adelante, espera poner su tienda D. cosméticos, donD. pueda vender mas cómoda y sin L. necesidad D. ir casa por casa. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo D. su banco comunal. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cosméticos, ya que últimamente esta teniendo una mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Raquel, age 23, is a simple, cheerful young woman who lives with her parents and wants to work hard to get ahead.  Visiting customers door-to-door, Raquel sells beauty products.  She is a persistent, convincing saleswoman and completes her sales quickly.  She is well-known in the district of Ancon where she has a reputation for selling high quality products.

What she likes best about her work is being able to give advice to her customers about what products are best for each type of complexion.  She has been in business for four years and feels that the hardest part of her job is collecting payment for the products because the customers do not always have the cash to pay upon ordering.  But she is always able to collect all payments completely.  In the future she would like to set up a cosmetics shop so she can sell more comfortably instead of having to go door-to-door.  

This is her first loan through MFP and she plans to use it to expand her activity.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time so she can take out future loans.  She knows she has the support of the communal bank.  She will use the 500 PEN to buy more cosmetics since she is seeing a rise in demand.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Ludis Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ludis Gutiérrez, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de  Masaya, desde hace quince años se dedica al cultivo de yuca, los planes futuros es poder diversificar el cultivo , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden las matas de yucas , el necesita un financiamiento para poder comprar insumos necesarios para combatir las malezas  , ya que es el recurso económico con el que cuenta para poder subsistir con sus tres hijos los cuales estudian y apoyan con las actividades del hogar .Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondos Kiva para poder realizar la inversión y llegar a mejorar tanto el cultivo como productos de calidad .
texts.en: Sr. Ludis G. has a small farm in Masaya where he has grown yucca for the past fifteen years.  In the future, he wants to plant other kinds of crops.  His biggest challenge is the plant disease that destroys yucca.  He will use this loan to buy the supplies he needs to fight the disease.  The farm is his main source of income for supporting his family and educating his three children, so the loan is important to the welfare of all of them.  He is grateful for Afodenic's support and trust.  Kiva funds will help him make the investment he needs to improve the quality of his crop.

loans.use: Buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en: Mateo is 55 years old and lives in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental Philippines. He is married and a father of two adult-aged children. Mateo owns and operates a motorcycle passenger transport service. According to Mateo, motorcycle transport is highly demanded mostly in sloping areas. Because of the dangerous road, the motorcycle can carry heavy goods and passengers at one time. He has had this type of service for 20 years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires. Mateo is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Mateo hopes to purchase more motorcycles for passenger transport.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Secundino Antonio

texts.es:
Don Secundino se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras con mas de cuatro años, iniciando este pequeño negocio cuando se jubilo, su esposa tambien se dedica al comercio en venta de ropa usada, pues ambos se ayudan para pagar los gastos basico y gastos personales.
El objetivo de Secundiono es el mejoramiento de su vivienda, en donde ha venido trabajando en doce ciclos de financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado. Logrando ampliar mas su casa.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo terminara de cerrar su bajaterte, y construcion de las paredes. Lo que comprara materiales de construccion como: bloques, hierro, arena, piedrin, laminas de zinc, perlines, y comenzar la obra. Contento ya que podra dar  a su familia mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en:
For the past four years Mr. Secundino has been selling fruits and vegetables. He began this small business when he retired. His wife also has a small business selling used clothes. In other words, both of them help to pay for their basic and personal expenses.
Mr. Secundino would like to improve his house. He has had twelve loans with the Afodenic Bank that he has used for this purpose. He would like to expand his house.
With this new loan he will enclose his shed and build walls. He would like to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, iron, sand, gravel, zinc sheets, and metal braces in order to begin this project. He is happy that he can provide his family with a better home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to finish the shed in front of his house. He will build walls in order to have a better space for his family.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is 54 years of age, married and blessed with four children. His family is harmoniously residing at the village of Naganacan. Rogelio has been engaged in rice farming for almost 20 years. His net income last cropping was 40,000 PHP. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. Rogelio would like to continue requesting loans from Kiva lenders and ASKI so that he can work towards his goals in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Amuziya

texts.en:
Amuziya is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children. All of her children are currently in school. Amuziya has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for 3 years.         
	
To help expand her business, Amuziya has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Amuziya hopes to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Amuziya hopes to expand her business. Amuziya is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: C9634 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Consolee is 46 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 8 and 16 years old but she is now a widow. Her business is well-organized and is well-known for selling fruit and vegetables. Consolee is the team leader of this group which is called "Abishyizehamwe" in local language which means in English "Being together". 

In the picture, Consolee is the second person in the second row from the right side. The picture  shows eight clients but one of them, Laurence Nzabonankura, the first person on the left in the second row, left the group.  Now there are seven.  

 Consolee`s business hours are from 7am until 2pm every day except on Saturday and she currently employs two people to help her. She has eight years of experience in this business.

Consolee and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more products (passion fruit, mangoes, vegetables and so on) for sale. With any additional profit, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Eraldo Ovando

texts.es:
Eraldo, vive con su familia, su madre y hermanos, es soltero, se dedica a la venta de medicinas, aprendió el negocio por el apoyo de familiares que se dedican al mismo negocio, trabaja de forma ambulante y no tiene un horario fijo.
Actualmente comprara medicina para salir a vender,  la compra será de analgésicos, antiinflamatorios, vitaminas, entre otros que según él le ayudaran para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo es tener el negocio bien establecido, en el futuro tener un local fijo donde instalarse con la mercadería y estar más pendiente de sus padres.
texts.en:
Eraldo lives with his family, his mother and siblings.  He is single and makes his living selling medications.  He learned the business from other family members who make their livings in the same line of work.  He works from a street stand and does not have set hours.
Eralado currently wants to purchase medications that he can go out and sell.  He will purchase additional pain-killers, anti-inflammatory medicines and vitamins, among other items, to help him meet his customers' demand.
Eraldo's goal is to have a well-established business.  In the future he would like to have a fixed location to set up with merchandise and to take better care of his parents.

loans.use: to purchase painkillers, anti-inflammatory medicines and vitamins for re-sale.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Meriam has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Meriam has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Meriam hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Glenis Aida

texts.es:
Glenis tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, reside en el Barrio La Soledad en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta basica, aseo personal y uso domestico.

Desde aproximadamente 15 años Glenis tiene su pulperia, inició su negocio porque vio la necesidad de sus vecinos de tener un lugar cercano donde comprar los productos de consumo alimenticio, de uso domestico entre otros. Su inversion inicial fue de 3,000 lempiras y poco a poco fueron mejorando sus ventas y con eso pudo incrementar el inventario de productos en su pulperia. Su horario de atencion comienza desde muy temprano por las mañanas y culmina a las 9:00 pm. 

El año pasado solicitó un prestamo para el mejoramiento de su negocio pero este no le alcanzó para terminar, asi que Glenis está solicitando este prestamo para pintar su pulperia y comprar varias vitrinas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio lucirá mas bonito y atractivo para sus clientes y sus productos estaran mejor exhibidos en las vitrinas.

Su meta es convertir su negocio en un mini-mercadito. Este es su ciclo 16 en FAMA y ha a pesar de que ha sido sometida tres veces a operaciones por la apendicitis, el pago de sus cuotas han sido puntuales.
texts.en:
Glenis is 46 years old and a single mother of two children. She resides in the neighborhood of La Soledad in the town of Juticalpa. Glenis sells basic food items, personal toiletries, and household products.

She has managed a store for approximately 15 years. Glenis started her business because she saw the need for her neighbors to have a place nearby where they could buy everyday consumer food products, household goods, and other items. Her initial investment was 3000 HNL and she gradually improved her sales. With her earnings, Glenis was able to increase the inventory of products in her store. Her schedule of operation starts very early in the morning and ends at 9pm.

Last year Glenis requested a loan to make improvements to her business, but she was not able to complete all of the work. She is now requesting a loan so that she can paint her store and buy several display cabinets. With the help of this loan, Glenis will be able to make her store nicer and more attractive to her customers. Her products will be well-displayed in their cases.

Her goal is to convert her business into a mini-market. This is her 16th loan with FAMA. Despite having undergone three operations for appendicitis, Glenis has been able to submit all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint and display cabinets for improving the appearance of her store.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom is an industrious and conscientious person who resides in Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh. She is 51 years old and the mother of five children. Four of them are single and live together with her, while the other one lives separately with a new family. 

Mom and her husband work in the same field, cultivating rice crops. Together, they usually generate around $4 per day from this business. It is an annual work of the family, so she has decided to create an additional business to support their living by raising some piglets. She is taking out her first loan from Kiva to buy some piglets for raising in the backyard of her house. This loan will help increase the income of her family. 

In the future, she plans to expand her pig raising business largely. With the increase in income, she wants to fix some broken parts of her house and send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy some piglets for raising.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 52 años de edad es casado, tiene su propio negocio de panaderia en el cual es el encargado de elaborar el pan. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda a administrar el negocio y con el de sus sobrinos que salen a las calles de la ciudad a vender el pan que con mucho esmero elabora.  

Esta solicitando su 12vo crédito, el cual necesita para acondicionar y mejorar el local de su panaderia, pues con  las lluvias constantes se le ha deteriorado el techo y necesita cambiar una parte para que no se le dañe el pan, ademas desea reparar parte del piso, y de esta manera dar mayor higiene a su negocio. 

Expresa que gracias a los créditos ha logrado crecer en el negocio y ha podido apoyar a que otros obtengas sus ingresos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Francisco, 52, is married.  He has his own bakery and he’s in charge of making the bread.  His wife helps him managing the business and his nephews help him by going out into the city streets to sell the bread which he makes with such dedication.

He is asking for his 12th loan which he needs to better furnish and equip his bakery because the constant rain has damaged the roof and he needs to replace part of it so that the bread won’t be damaged.  He also wants to repair part of the floor so that the business will be more hygienic.

He expresses his thanks for the loans which have helped his business grow and have helped others obtain income to support their families.

loans.use: to improve the business' infrastructure.

loans.name: Minea

texts.en:
Minea, who is pictured here, is 26 years old. She and her husband, Tharong, have been married since 2009 and have one young son. The family lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. Minea and her husband are garment workers.

Minea is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase a motorbike to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to get to work

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a young man with three children. Their ages range from 3 years to 10 years. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. 

Within the same shop, he has introduced a small restaurant in which he serves his customers with meat, soup, and other types of food. He has been involved in this business for five years now. His business is located in a shopping center. 

He describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and insufficient capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase seats to add at the restaurant. His goal is to grow his business and become the supplier of meat around an area called Gilgil. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more seats to be used at the restaurant.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a mother of five school-going children, is married to a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water, and her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Mary has operated a fabric-selling business for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of transportation, and dreams of establishing a shop to sell her products from.

Having decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business, Mary is requesting a loan of Kshs 70,000 to purchase more stocks of fabrics for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Living in a village located in the Ponhea Krek district, Ra is a 43-year-old mother of six children, five of whom are dependent and two of whom are still in school while the other three work at the farm and elsewhere.  She feeds her big family by planting cassava as her main source of income but she supplements this by working for others.  With her current business, she earns more than five U.S. dollars per day to feed her big nuclear family. 

Now Ra leads a group of two members and is requesting her first loan from VisionFund.  She will use this loan to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  This loan will enable her to grow cassava to increase her business for more income and to make a living better and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mane

texts.fr: Mané vit au Sénégal. Elle a 43 ans. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce et vend des accessoires de femmes. C’est une  activité qu’elle a choisi par amour. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis 9 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de nouveaux produits. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses gains financiers  en vue de mieux soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Mané lives in Sénégal. She is 43 years old. She is active in business and sells women's accessories. This is a business that she chose out of love. 

She has been a member of the UIMCEC branch for 9 years. She is requesting a 200,000f loan to buy new products. Her objective is to grow her financial gains with the aim of better supporting her husband in the management of daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy new products to resell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a married woman who has two children. Mary Jane is 34 years old and resides at Poblacion 3, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Mary Jane used her last loan to purchase materials needed to expand services. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan to purchase auto spare parts and accessories. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase auto spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en:
"Faapaia is a 28 year old married woman with 2 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years.Faapaia has requested a loan to buy wheelbarrow, manure chemicals,week killer and bushknives.She has been a member of SBPD in 2013.With her profits,Faapaia hopes to help support her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, manure chemicals,week killer and bushknives

loans.name: Faysuli

texts.es:
Ella es faysuli, les escribe para  contarles  la historia, quien pudo culminar el primer semestre de enfermería, ella muy feliz y dedicada,  nunca fallo a ninguna clase ya que era solo los sábados   y para ella era una gran prioridad ese día, cada cosa que aprendió la puso en practica, era muy reconfortante para ella saber todo lo maravilloso que el cuerpo humano puede hacer, puede sentir, como se conforma cada sistema del mismo, saber que podría salvar muchas vidas.
Por cada conocimiento mínimo que tuviera  para ella nada pasaba desapercibido,  sandra pensaba que el perderse cinco segundos de clase podía perder algún conocimiento importante,  la importancia de lavar bien nuestras manos antes de cualquier procedimiento, en fin, todo lo que ella  aprendió la apasiono mas por seguir adelante y ahora inicia el segundo semestre y quiere vincularse nuevamente con ustedes para recibir esa gran ayuda brindada el semestre pasado.
texts.en: Faysuli is studying to become a nurse and successfully completed the first semester. She is very happy about it and shows a lot of dedication. She never missed class, and she always looks forward to Saturdays, which are the days on which the course takes place. She put into practice everything she learned, and she is awed at all the human body can do and feel, and at how neatly everything works. She is happy knowing that she will be able to save many lives once she becomes a nurse. She never missed even five seconds of class for fear of missing some important bit of information. She is especially careful about applying what she learned, for instance the need to wash one's hands before any procedure. Everything she learned has only reinforced her desire to keep going. The second semester is about to start and she asks Kiva lenders to once again help her as they did last semester.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Améyo

texts.en:
At 45 years old, Mrs S. Ameyo is the only caretaker for seven children out of the thirteen her husband has with his polygamous wives, and whose husband is currently unemployed as well. The main source of income for the family is the sales of manioc(cassava root) flour, and a source of income with too much instability to assure the education of the children. Mrs Ameyo's work, preparing the manioc paste is very difficult. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of $1,000.00 in order to buy a rough mill that will be able to be used by other women in her area as well. The loan will also be used to buy some manioc fields from the farmers, who have large fields. She proposes repaying the loan in 12 months. The loan will have a positive impact in her economic activities but above all, the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Agée de 45 ans ; Madame S. Améyo a à sa seule charge sept (07) enfants sur les treize enfants de son mari polygame et sans emploi. La source de revenu de cette femme est la vente de farine de manioc, une ressource très insuffisante pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Ce métier de tonification de la pâte de manioc en gari est très difficile. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit $1000 pour s’acheter un moulin râpeuse qui sera aussi très utile pour les femmes de sa localité. Ce crédit servira également à s’acheter des champs de manioc auprès des agriculteurs qui ont de grands champs. Elle se propose de rembourser ce crédit en 12 mois. Ce financement aura un impact positif sur son activité commerciale et surtout sur l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie familiale.

loans.use: To purchase a rough mill.

loans.name: Charkaz

texts.en: Charkaz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Jabrail district of Azerbaijan.  His wife is pictured in photo. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has two children. He started his family business of cattle breeding in 2000. He has no funds to develop his business and now would like to borrow $1,000 from Normicro Baku branch.

loans.use: To expand the volume of business

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. Recently her elder son married, and her daughter, after graduating from school, looks after the house and sometimes goes to help her mother. Rano started her business by trading female clothes and footwear, then she rented a department in a big supermarket and turned to a new assortment of goods – trading gift sets and bed-clothes. The profit from the trade allows her to cover family expenses.

Receiving a loan from Microinvest, she included kids' toys in her inventory. For the goods Rano goes to Kora-suw, which is located ten hours from her house. Rano plans to expand her business and therefore she hopes to receive a loan from KIVA investors.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Maria Elisa is 45 years old and separated from her husband. She has one child. Maria Elisa works selling catalog shoes, and in this way she is able to cover the monthly bills. She also works in an office which offers a service of temporary help. She is part of a group called Genesis 2, together with Maria de Jesus Perez, who also works selling the catalog shoes. With the loan, they hope to invest in more quantity of shoes, divide them between the two so that they have stock in their houses and can grow their sales.

MARIA ELISA , tiene 45 años , separada , 1 hijo , ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo y de esta forma apoya con los gastos del hogar aparte ella trabaja en una oficina haciendo servicios temporales . Pertenece al grupo Génesis 2 junto con doña Maria de Jesús Pérez quien también trabaja en la venta de calzados por catálogos.. Con el préstamo esperan las dos invertir comprando mayor cantidad de calzados, repartirse entre ellas y así poder tener un stock en sus casas para aumentar las ventas.

loans.use: Sales of footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise and a display case

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
She started her business selling basic necessity products as a mini-mart 10 years ago with the goal of helping her husband with the household expenses, as these were starting to increase when their two children grew and were asked for a lot of materials for school. Being a stay-at-home mom, Maria de Jesus decided to do something that would make her money in addition to giving her the opportunity to use her time in a commercial activity.

Maria de Jesus is requesting a loan for US $925, which she is willing to pay within a period of 6 months. With this money, Maria will be able to improve the walls of her locale, which are made out of wood and are in very bad shape. Maria de Jesus wants to make them out of concrete so that the merchandise is not affected by the humidity sometimes brought by wood. With your help, Maria de Jesus will be able to support her children and renovate her locale for the benefit of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ella inicio el negocio de la venta de abarrotes en la modalidad de mini super hace 10 años, con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares puesto que comenzaban a incrementarse ya que sus dos hijos crecieron y les pedían muchos materiales para la escuela. Al ser ama de casa María de Jesús decidió hacer algo que le retribuyera dinero además de ocupar su tiempo libre en una actividad comercial.

María de Jesús está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá mejorar las paredes de su local ya que son de madera y están muy maltratadas. María de Jesús desea construirlo de material para que la mercancía no se moleste con la humedad que a veces provoca la madera. Con tu ayuda María de Jesús podrá sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y renovará su local para el bien del negocio.

loans.use: Remodeling her business (remodelar su negocio)

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Mrs. Concepción T. is known as Conchita, has been selling clothing for 20 long years in the city of Managua. She is a married mother of two children who are the most precious things she has.

Mrs. T. began her business with the goal of bettering the condition of her home as there were few resources and only the low income her husband provided, which was not enough to maintain their home.

She has worked with Ceprodel for 2 years and she says that she has had great opportunities to improve her business. Because of the loans she has experienced greater volumes of sales that have benefited her business, but above all, have provided the support for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Concepción T. conocida como conchita se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 largos años en la ciudad de Managua. Es una madre casada y con dos hijos que son lo más preciado que ella tiene.

La señora T. inició su negocio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que ha sido de escasos recursos y solamente con los bajos ingresos que obtenía su esposo no podían mantener el hogar.

Ha trabajado con Ceprodel desde hace dos años y según comenta, ha obtenido grandes oportunidades para mejorar su negocio. Por medio de estos ha adquirido mayores volúmenes de venta que le han beneficiado en su negocio pero sobre todo en el apoyo de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ties to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a member of the community bank called “Friendship and Peace.” She lives in San Martín, which is located in the province of Mariscal Cáceres in the district of Juanjui, Peru. The business she owns is located in her own home in block three of Jirón, Lima. Her business sells groceries and general goods including a diverse selection of hygiene products for personal and home use.

Carmen, who is separated from her husband, is motivated to help her five children get ahead. She is thankful for the loan she received from the community bank which she used to start selling groceries out of her home. Little by little she has put the money to use and today her store is well known in the area.

With a loan of 1,700 Peruvian Nuevo Sol (approximately $580 US), which she will repay in six months, she will be able to buy items to sell in her store such as rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, candies, cleaning products and personal hygiene items. These will supply the business and fill the needs of Carmen and her clients.

Carmen is 53 years old and is currently living with one of her daughters who helps with chores and the business. Through perseverance, Carmen hopes to eventually open a sewing shop because sewing is a talent of hers that she would like to develop.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Bevington, Alyssa Sanow, and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Carmen es socia del banco comunal “ Amistad y Paz”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa ubicado en el Jirón Lima Cuadra 3, tiene una bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, productos diversos de aseo personal y para el hogar. Al separarse de su esposo y motivada por sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos y gracias al préstamo que recibió en el banco comunal se inicia en la venta de abarrotes en un ambiente de su propia casa, poco a poco lo ha ido implementando, hoy ya es bastante conocida en la zona. Con el préstamo de S/.1,700, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros, también comprará productos para la limpieza del hogar y de aseo personal para así surtir su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. La señora Carmen tiene 53 años, vive actualmente con una de sus hijas, quien le ayuda en las tareas domésticas y en el negocio. Con su perseverancia sueña en un futuro tener un taller de costura, ya que esta es una de sus habilidades que quiere desarrollar.

loans.use: To purchase groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Seeds Of Hope Group

texts.es:
The committee "Seeds of Hope" is a group of enterprising women that retains the majority of its first members. This group is now in the 7th cycle of its program titled "Committee of Enterprising Women" run by the Paraguayan Foundation.

The committee has saved 789,053 Paraguayan Guarani (approximately USD 185) that has been deposited in a cooperative in the city. The ladies who belong to the committee are dedicated to a variety of activities. They use the loan as operating capital to purchase merchandise and other necessary supplies to improve upon their businesses.

Among the activities that these women carry out are: selling clothes; selling food; selling lingerie for ladies; recycling; selling jewels; and selling pigs. They take care of everything and sacrifice all in order to guarantee their children have a better life than they had themselves. They want their children to be able to dedicate their time to studying so that they can help themselves to move up. Today, these women are committed to pouring their efforts into their enterprises in order to improve the lives of themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sedloff, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité “Semillas de Esperanza” es un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que aún mantiene a la mayoría de sus primeras integrantes. Este grupo se encuentra ahora en el 7º ciclo del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras” que maneja la Fundación Paraguaya.

El comité lleva ahorrado Gs. 789.053 que se encuentra depositado en una cooperativa de la ciudad. Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades productivas para llevar adelante a sus familias, ellas utilizan el préstamo como capital operativo, es decir, invierten su dinero en la compra de mercaderías e insumos necesarios para sus respectivos negocios.

Entre las actividades que realizan estas mujeres podemos citar: venta de ropas, comestibles, lencería para damas, reciclaje, venta de joyas y cría y venta de cerdos. Todas se esmeran y sacrifican para sacar adelante a sus hijos, desean que ellos logren estudiar y superarse, ya que ellas no corrieron con esa suerte y hoy día deben redoblar sus esfuerzos para salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase: cardboard; plastics; aluminum; iron (to recycle); fruits (oranges, bananas, pineapple, melon, watermelons); cosmetics; beverages for sale (such as beer, carbonated water and other refreshments); balanced food for hogs; among others things.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Phin C. is a 45 year old widow. She makes a good living in Phnom Penh selling scallops. She earns US$27 per day. However, this amount represents her total sales, not profit, and most of her money goes back into buying the scallops to sell. She has five children. Two of her children are already married. Two of her sons are professional dancers earning US$5 per day. She also has a daughter who goes to school on a scholarship that also pays US$3.50 per day so she can devote herself fully to her studies. Phin C. wants to take out a loan specifically to increase her profits from her scallop selling business. She will use the loan to purchase scallops cheaply and in bulk and thereby maximize her later profits. She also will use some of the money to invest in mechanic tools for one of her sons who wants to start working with motorbikes for a living.

loans.use: To buy scallops in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To inject capital in her grocery store so as to move it forward.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem R. lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat Temples. Mrs. Chhem is a farmer and earns up to $3/day. Her husband, Mom Vun, sells firewood and can earn up to $6/day. The couple has six children, two of whom are single and live with them. 

Mrs. Chem is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase land to farm on. She believes that this will greatly help her farming business and be a beneficial addition to her family support.

loans.use: Purchase land to farm

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina B. had a pants-making business for about a year and a half before beginning the loan process with Esperanza. She had one sewing machine and was hardly making any money. Even with the business, both she and her husband had to work second jobs to be able to proviD. for their four children. With her first loan of about US$ 200 she was able to buy enough fabric to begin making shirts as well as pants.

Her second loan consisted of almost US$ 600 and with it, she was able to buy more machines and more fabric to produce more shirts and pants faster. With her third loan of over US$ 1,000 she has been able to hire three workers and buy more machines.

As of now she has three workers apart from family members and a total of five machines. Her business is thriving and neither she nor her husband needs to work outsiD. of their business. With the money they have earned from their business, they have maD. many improvements to their house, and they have been able to buy a clothes washing machine. They are also saving as much as they can so that they will be able to build a second floor on their house and be able to put the business up on the second floor.

As of now the work center is in the kitchen. Because they must share the space of the kitchen to work, production is greatly reduced, as well as living space. Florentina's business has grown rapidly and is a great example of how well these loans work, however, she still has lots of room to grow and improve.

loans.use: build a second floor onto her house and purchase more fabric for clothes production

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira (her saleswoman is pictured) was born in 1966. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the town of Khirdalan, where she has been running a spare parts business for ten years.

Tahira is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy additional spare parts to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional spare parts to increase and improve her business

loans.name: António Filipe

texts.pt:
António Filipe Z. é natural da cidade da Matola uma zona que dista a 15 km da cidade de Maputo, tem 46 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 3 filhos com idade entre primeiro 14, 12 e 6 meses de idade respectivamente. Para alem dos seus filhos e esposa sustenta a sogra e a sua mãe enviando dinheiros mensalmente.

António estudou até 10ªclasse quando jovem e abandonou para ir a Republica Sul-africana trabalhar e neste momento frequenta 11ªclasse. Sempre viveu em Boane excepto quando foi trabalhar na RSA como infiltrado.( pessoas que entra no pais ilegalmente).

António é funcionário da educação a 10 anos como docente,  tendo se formado no instituto do magistério primário de Maputo. Tem um salário mensal de 2900,00mt trabalha das 12:10 as 17:30h. Este é o terceiro empréstimo para António e os dois primeiros destinou para compra de material de construção e este é para continuação com projecto. constitui grande sonho para António a continuar com os estudos aumentando assim o seu nível académico.
texts.en:
António Filipe Z. is from the city of Matola, an area situated 15 kilometers away from Maputo. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children that are a 6-month-old baby and two boys, a 12-year-old and a 14-year-old. Besides his children he also supports his mother-in-law and his mother by sending them monthly allowances. Antonio attended school until the 10th grade when he dropped out to find work in South Africa. He is back in school now, attending the 11th grade. Except when he lived in South Africa as an illegal immigrant, he has always resided in Boane. Antonio is an education professional, a graduate from Maputo's Institute of High School Education. His monthly salary is 2900,00mt and his shift goes from 12:10pm until 5:30pm. This will be Antonio's third loan request and it will be applied to purchase construction material, as it was done with the previous two loans. Antonio's biggest dream is to continue his education and, therefore, improve his academic level.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña Cecilia tiene 30 años de edad, estudió Enfermería Técnica hasta el  quinto semestre, es soltera y vive en el Jr. 3 de Mayo Nº 235, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde hace dos años es una de las Socias del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”. Con el préstamo inicial de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc., para  su tienda. 

Desde los 23 años de edad empezó con su negocio, su padre falleció y dejo todo a cargo de su madre, quién no pudo apoyarla a concluir sus estudios por que eran varios hermanos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará  02 sacos de arroz, 03 sacos de harina, 02 sacos de azúcar, 03 cajas de leche, 02 cajas de aceite, gaseosas, galletas, etc.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de distribución al por mayor y muchas sucursales.
texts.en:
Ms. Cecilia L. is 30 years old. She studied in a medical assistant program up to the fifth semester. She is single and lives in Jr. 3 de Mayo Nº 235, in the Ilave district of the El Collao, Puno province. She has been a member of the “San Miguel” Microfinance Institute for two years. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, she increased her capital and purchased soft drinks, rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, and other goods for her general store. She started her business at age 23. Her father passed away and left her mother in charge of everything. She was unable help Cecilia complete her studies because she had many siblings. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 3 monthly installments, she will purchase 2 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of flour, 2 sacks of sugar, 3 crates of milk, 2 boxes of cooking oil, soft drinks, cookies, etc. She dreams of having many branches of a wholesale store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, flour, sugar, milk, cooking oil, soft drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey O. is a 28-year-old farmer in Ang Thnout Koeut village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Muong Shat, repairs cars.  They have 3 young children. Mrs. Srey O.'s business is going well and she wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to request a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Née vers 1948 à Sèhouè,dame DEKPAMAKO Marguérite est originaire d'Abomey.D'une mère revendeuse ,elle fut très tôt initiée par cette dernière  et ne mit jamais pied à l'école. Ainsi ,dame D. Marguérite  aidait sa mère à revendre des tissus, pagnes, et autres articles dans sa tendre enfance .Par la suite,à son propre compte,elle se mit à vendre des médicaments au marché noir ,mais aussi des liqueurs .Cette activité ,elle va l'abandonner pour la vente  de fleurs,chaussures,articles de solde s des grands magasins et autres .C'est pour renforcer cette activité,qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour s'approvisionner en chaussure pour homme,femme et enfants.Mariée,elle est mère de 6 enfants.
texts.en:
Originaire d'Abomey,dame HEKOUINON Clarisse est née vers 1975 à Porto-Novo.Elle n'a pas été à l'école et très tôt elle a été initiée par sa mère au commerce.En effet ,cette dernière était revendeuse de médicament au marché noir.Ainsi dame HEKOUINON a commencé à vendre de médicament avant de se lancer dans la vente divers articles:fournitures scolaires ,chaussures,pots et bouquets de fleur.Cela fait presque 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité et c'est pour la renforcer à l'approche des fêtes qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 100000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en fleur et chaussure.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Approvisionnement:2 cartons de chaussures

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson A. is 31 years old, he is married and father with three children. One is breastfeeding while the rest are getting schooling. He is an Urvan driver or what we call a Trotro driver, and he uses this for commercial purposes, which generates an income for him to support his household. He has been driving for one year. It is a common misconception that only people with low incomes take the Trotro. Schoolchildren, workers and everyone takes it because it is affordable, as compared to a taxi. But many people also believe that it is better. Wilson says he has had a recent breakdown which is keeping him from making sufficient income to run the business. He requests a loan to buy vehicle parts to mend his car. With the loan he also believes he can make more profits so that within two years he can buy additional cars. This, he believes, would help him in taking care of his kids in school. Wilson would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: Wilson wants the loan to buy vehicle parts to maintain his commercial car.

loans.name: Khalilullah

texts.en:
Khalilullah is the son of A. R.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has five children, two of whom are studying at school while the others are still small. He has got a metal shop where he works hard and earns income to cover the necessities for his household and children.

He would like to expand his business, so he is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months and he is confident that after receiving the loan, he can work well and will progress in a good way.

loans.use: causing his business to progress

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Ashura A. owns a small shop and charcoal store in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more charcoal and to improve her business. She is hoping with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Ashura is 23 years old, widowed with two children, ages 5 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and to improve her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to become a successful businesswoman,” says Elsa, a 46-year-old entrepreneur and a mother of two children. Her husband, Jaime, is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and their two children are: Evangeline, who is 18 years old and a second-year college student, and Jaime Jr., who is 10 years old and now in grade four. She and her family live in the rural village of Saranay in Cabatuan, Isabela.

Elsa has been a direct seller of personal products for almost two years in their village. Her business has greatly helped her in providing the school allowance of their two children and some of their basic needs at home. When she learned that there are lenders who are willing to finance micro-entrepreneur like her, she was motivated to borrow a loan of PHP7,000.00 that she can use to improve her business and somehow become successful.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy A., 29, married with two children, both of whom are still in the basic school, lives with her family in a rented apartment in Aquase in the Central Region of Ghana. Dorothy works as a hairdresser to support her husband financially. She owns a shop in her community where many women come daily to have their hair fixed, her busiest times being weekends. Dorothy says the clients like her services due to her skill, experience and good customer relations. 

In business for over five years and with a few apprentices training under her, she is requesting a loan to procure products such as shampoo, lotion, and artificial hair to improve upon her services.  She also sells phone credits in front of her shop.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, cream, artificial hair, etc

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Wilma Dávalos de 36 años de edad. Ella vive con Don Lider Cañete de 36 años, con éste tiene dos dos hijos, ambos adolescentes, en edad escolar.

Tiene mas de veinte años de experiencia en el rubro de vender frutas. En base a esos conocimientos, la venta informal tiene una competencia salvaje en estos tiempos de crisis. Por esa razon, ahora, arrienda dos locales (mesas) en el mercado de abasto de la capital, donde comparte el trabajo con su conyuge; la actividad no cesa aun en su domicilio, pues ahi es donde fraccionan y envasan su productos para la venta del día siguiente. 

El objetivo de este crédito es adquirir otro espacio físico mas en el mercado de abasto, para mejorar su venta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wilma Dávalos is 36 years old and lives with her husband, Don Lider Cañete (also 36) and their two adolescent children who attend school. She has more than 20 years experience in the fruit selling business. Competition is fierce during these tough economic times, which is why she now has two tables where she sells fruit at the city market in the capitol, where she shares the work with her husband. The business activity continues at home where they separate and package their products for sale the next day. The target of the loan is to acquire a third location in the city market to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, legumes, vegetables and a space from which to sell at the city market.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Mrs. Guillerma S., 50, is a business-minded person, living at P-2 Gango Ozamiz City. She is happily married to Paulino S. with 7 children as fruit of their love. Of her 7 children, 4 are married and 3 are still single. Her husband is a carpenter and mason. The salary of her husband is not enough to cover their daily expenses, so she decided to start a Sari–sari Store to earn extra income to support their family’s needs. Eight years ago, around 2001, she was able to start a small sari-sari store at their home with a starting capital of only PHP 3,000 borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Now, she is applying for a loan worth PHP 20,000. With this amount she can buy more grocery items. Her future plan for her family is to send her children to school for their good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store.

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria D. is single and resides at Poblacion in Leon B. Postigo, which is in Zamboanga Del Norte province of the Philippines.  Currently she is engaged in tailoring and dress repair services and it serves as her livelihood.  She inherited a house and her niece lives with her and also helps her in running her business. She started with only one sewing machine, catering to dress repair and smaller clothing items such as school uniforms and short pants. She is planning to buy an additional machine so that she can accept more clients. She is very positive that her business will continue to grow.  Her business is really viable and sustainable in their community because of their quality tailoring service.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine.

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Helena Francisco

texts.pt:
Helena Francisco N. nasceu no distrito de matutuine, casada, e pai de 2 filhos (de 19 e 13 anos de idade) sendo o mais novo estudante numa das escolas oficiais de boane.
 Estudou ate 7 classe por causa de ter perdido os pais muito cedo. Vive em boane a mais de 20 anos com seu marido, matural de cidade de maputo.

Aprendeu a fazer negocio há 5 anos sem empregado, tendo aprendido a fazer o negocio com o seu irmão mais velho que também exerce esta actividade com bastante experiência.
O seu forte é de venda de refrigerantes e obtém um rendimento mensal de 3.00,00MT. Vive na casa própria e este é o seu segundo empréstimo com a hluvuku e o primeiro com o KIVA para compra de produtos diversos.
Esta não é a sua primeira relação com instituições de credito, foi cliente de um dos pequenos bancos que operam no distrito. Na hluvuku, gosta de bom atendimento e de prestações mensais a sua medida. O primeiro empréstimo de foi de 13.000,00MT que aplicou no reforço do negocio. Com o credito de 15.000,00MT, o negocio vai melhorar porque poderá satisfazer a demanda e manter, positivamente, a estabilidade do negocio e com clientes cada vez mais satisfeitos.
O seu sonho é de fazer um estabelecimento, feito de material convencional, para desenvolver a actividade em ambiente digno. Diz que o pressuposto para atingir os objectivos futuros, é de pagar bem os empréstimos.
texts.en:
Helena Francisco N. was born in Matatuine district. She is married and the mother of two children (19 and 13 years old), one who is the youngest student at one of the official schools in Boane. Helena studied through seventh grade because she lost her parents very early. A native of the city Maputo, she has lived in Boane for more than 20 years with her husband. They live in their own home.

She learned how to run a business during five years of unemployment, having to learn this with her older sibling who also learned by experience. Her specialty is selling sodas, and she makes a monthly income of 300 MT (meticais). This is Elena's second loan with Hluvuku (Kiva's Field Partner) and her first with Kiva. She will use it to buy a variety of products. This is not her first experience with a lending institution; she was a client of two small banks that work in the district. At Hluvuku, she likes the good service and using monthly installments. Her first loan was for 13,000 MT (meticais), which she used to strengthen her business. With the loan of 15,000 MT, the business will improve because she will be able to meet the demand and positively maintain the stability of her business with clients who are more and more satisfied.

Helena's dream is to build an establishment with conventional materials to develop her business in a dignified setting. She says that requisite for reaching her future objectives is paying her loans properly.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia S. is 49 years of age and is married to Manuel S.. Manuel is a laborer while Cecilia sells food in their neighborhood. The couple has six children to raise and to work hard for.

Their eldest daughter, Mipa, (26 years old) was sent to college. However she chose not to continue with her studies because she knew that her parents have to send her five other siblings to school also and it will be very hard for them to cope with their financial needs. Mipa therefore, worked as a housemaid to at least augment their family income. Cecilia and her husband's income was not stable then, so that even their second child's education in high school was suspended. 

In 2005, Cecilia joined a group of women in ASHI to avail themselves with the opportunity of getting a loan. Her decision was supported by her husband, since they both need a more stable source of income, which means they need to have their own business. Previous loans Cecilia obtained have been very helpful to her and her family. They were able to start up their rice farming business and were able to send their five children to school. Presently, their second child and the third child are in high school, the fourth child is in elementary and two are preschoolers. 

Cecilia's farming business has grown so well that it requires a bigger amount of capital for sustainability. She needs to obtain a bigger loan from ASHI in order to purchase all the necessary farm inputs such as rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticides. Also she needs to spend money on the land preparation and labor charges.

With this business, Cecilia has greater hopes and dreams for herself, her family, and her children. Being the owner and business manager, she believes that in the future her personality will be developed and she will become more sociable. Most importantly, all of her children will graduate from college and she will have more rice field to manage with the help of her husband so that they will harvest more rice and can supply the demands of their consumers.

Despite having a farming business, Cecilia did not let go of her food selling business. The food she sells offers convenience to farmers during planting season. During this time, she can have a big income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay expenses for land preparation

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 31 years old and she is married with 3 children. She sells sarongs and she is also a tailor. She hopes for the loan amount 0 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon M. is a 27-year-old man and a married father of two. He lives in Shanzu, Mombasa, where he runs a clothing stall. He has been in the business of selling clothes for eight years and he also owns a passenger service motorbike, which supplements his household income.

Gideon was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET member. This will be his first loan. With the money, he plans to increase the clothing and bedding stock for his business and to also service his motorbike.

In the future he hopes to expand his business into a large clothing store and to also venture more into the transport industry by acquiring more motorbikes.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing and bedding for resale

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile F. est une femme mariée de 59 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes et de poissons séchés et fumés. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son capital afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Cécile F. is a married woman of 59, mother of 6 children. Her business is selling vegetables and smoked and dried fish. She is asking for this loan to bolster her working capital so that she can better improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling vegetables and smoked and dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 43 years old and married with 6 children. she sells bunches of plantain and potatoes to make a living.  She hopes for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more bunches of plantain and potatoes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuff to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: George Otieno

texts.en:
George Otieno is 47 years-old and married with one child. He has a retail shop that sells non-perishable food and other home goods. He also has a cafe that serves people in the ngomongo slums. He makes a profit of about 30000 Kenyan shillings from both businesses. He has been running the cafe business for about 10 years now.

He has never borrowed from another MFI, and was introduced to KADET by a friend. He wants to use the loan to add more stock to his retail shop and to buy meat to serve at his cafe. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy meat for his cafe and add general goods to his retail shop

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
A. Said has worked in agriculture since he was young. He works even harder at it now because he has made his home with his wife and their four lovely children, whom he loves very much. Due to his high level of knowledge, Said takes full advantage of his parcels of land and also leaves them fallow sometimes so that the land will grow excellent products for him. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan of $1000 to invest in seeds and mineral fertilizer for his crops (wheat and potatoes) and to take good care of his land. Said feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that his children can stay in school and have a bright future. Support this man of much strength and courage to keep working.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Lindaura

texts.es:
Lindaura P. es una mujer carismática y perseverante, vive en la carretera Federico Basadre -AA.HH Nueva Magdalena, región de Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre de cuatro hijos que ya son mayores de edad, es viuda. 
Se dedica a la venta de chupetes (helados de hielo), gelatinas y gaseosas , actividad que realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Del Futuro” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de gaseosas. Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar gaseosas, frutas y otros insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes. La meta de Lindaura es tener una bodega bien surtida y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Lindaura P. is a charismatic and persevering woman who lives along the Federico Basadre Highway in the District of Nueva Magdalena, Ucayali Region. She is 53 years old, widowed, and the mother of four adult children.

Lindaura sells popsicles, gelatins, and sodas out of her home. She joined the Communal Bank “Del Futuro” (Of the Future) two years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and used the money to buy sodas.

She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy sodas, fruit, and other ingredients for making popsicles. Lindaura’s goal is to open a well-stocked grocery store so that she can continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, fruit, and other ingredients for making popsicles

loans.name: Kame Vendors Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Nuru is 30 years old and married with 4 children aged 12 – 2 years. She also helps to take care of some orphans including paying their school fees and general welfare. She is a business lady involved in selling produce and her business is mostly affected by the changing seasons and price fluctuations. She is able to make 140,000 Ugandan shillings (about $21 US) as profits a week, which help in restocking her business and paying her children’s school fees. She hopes to have a variety of produce in her stall as well as build her own house for a better life. She needs a loan to help boost her produce business with more foods for the season. 

(In the small photo is Nuru N. who was interviewed and she is a part of the group).

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz C. de 33 años de edad, su vivienda es de ladrillos esta ubicada en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo es mecánico hace 10 años atrás, tienen  2 hijos que estudian en un colegio fiscal.

Luz empezó hace 4 años con $ 100.00 vendiendo cremas y perfumes, ahora ella trabaja como vendedora Yanbal con una revista de catalogo en la que vende perfumes, cremas, maquillajes, trabaja dos horas en la mañana y tres en la tarde uno de los inconvenientes son sus piedras ya que le causa inflamación cuando camina mucho.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas y maquillajes para poder tener todo lo que le piden los clientes, en el futuro quiere ser Directora Yanbal para poder ganarse un carro como premio y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Luz C. is 33 years old. Her brick home is located in Paraíso, an area just outside the city of Guayaquil. Her husband has worked as a mechanic for 10 years, and they have 2 children who study in a public school. Luz started 4 years ago with $100 selling creams and perfumes. Now she works as a Yanbal salesperson, selling perfumes, creams, and makeup through a catalog. She works 2 hours in the morning and 3 hours in the afternoon; one of the drawbacks is that she has gallstones, and it causes inflammation when she walks a lot. With the loan she wants to buy perfumes, creams and makeup so that she can have everything that her customers ask for. In the future she wants to be a Yanbal Director so that she will be able to win a car as a prize, and so that her children can continue to study.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams and makeup

loans.name: Ana Lila

texts.es: Ana Lila R. M. de 49 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango, una de las ciudades más importantes del departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, junto a su madre y una hija. Ana posee una venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, la cual esta ubicada en el centro de San Salvador, uno de los mejores sitios para comerciantes, debido a que muchas personas transitan por este lugar. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, en varios colores estilos y tamaños, de manera que pueda ofrecer mejor calidad de prendas de vestir. Para Ana es muy importante obtener mayores ganancias debido a que es por este que tanto ella como su esposo logran solventar muchos gastos en el hogar, Ana cuenta con la ventaja que sus ganancias son diarias a diferencia de su esposo quien debe tocar puertas para obtener algún trabajo, razón por la cual ella desea mejorar su venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Ana Lila R. M. is 49 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, one of the most important cities in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, and his mother and a daughter. Ana has a business selling clothing for men and women, which is located in the center of San Salvador. This is one of the best sites for trade, since many people pass through this place. She requests a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothing, in various colors, styles and sizes, so that she can offer better quality garments to her customers. For Ana it is very important to have better earnings since this will allow her to help her husband cover the household expenses. Ana has the advantage of having daily earnings, which is different from her husband, who must knock on doors to get some work, and for this reason she wants to improve her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae M. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 29 years old. Mae is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mae owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the market. She also has a tricycle that provides transport in the local community. Mae has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mae is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Burul's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is a little town and everything is spread before the eyes. There are not any factories or huge companies. However, the citizens are laborious and ambitious.
