Burul J., a leader of this group, is a great example to be followed. Burul is delicate woman but has really unimaginable will and strength because she went through a hard trial. Unfortunately, a few years ago her husband died. 

After the death of her husband, life seemed already cracked, and she lost heart, but the future of her daughter really forced her to go ahead. Now, Burul has a daughter who is 16. Her daughter attends a local school in Balykchy. About five years ago, she got a loan of 7,000 Kyrgyzstani som (about $156) and she opened up her business, which is located just inside the house. Since then her life became normal. Now she sells foodstuffs such as macaroni, rice, sugar, salt, oil, fizzy drinks and detergent. 

At present, her net income is about 5,000 KGS (about $110). She wants to get a loan to increase the stock of foodstuffs prior to a holiday season in order to make enough earnings to buy a trade pavilion in the future. Her future plan is to give an education to her daughter, to whom she dedicated her life, and buy and place her own pavilion in her yard.

Nazgul K. is 38. She is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a driver in the administration of reservoir. She works as a security officer in the administration of reservoir. At present, they are increasing the number of their cattle. Their revenue is 4,000 KGS (about $90). They want to get a loan to buy young plants of apricots and apples to plant in the field. 

Ardakbek K. is 42. He is married and has four children; two of them are sons and two are daughters. His wife is a housewife. He works as a clerk in the city hall. He inherited 20 sheep and, little by little, increased the number of sheep. Now he is just fattening them. He wants to get a loan to buy another sheep and sell them all in the future.

Salima A. is 24. She has two children and a brilliant husband who works as radio operator at the station. Now they are reselling cattle. At first, they bought five of them and after fattening them, they resold them. Their revenue is 4,000 KGS (about $90). They want to get a loan to buy horses.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To increase the stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Arelys Alicia

texts.es:
Arelys tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el sector Licapa del distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, ubicada a a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su menor hijo hizo que desde hace seis años empezara a trabajar como costurera, aprendió el oficio de su padre, que también se dedica a esta labor desde hace muchos años y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar una máquina de coser, actualmente tiene instalado un pequeño taller en su vivienda, donde atiende los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes.

Arelys confecciona prendas nuevas y también repara las dañadas. Su negocio ha ido creciendo y ya está recibiendo pedidos de confección de uniformes escolares, ya que la temporada escolar ya empezó en todo el país. Por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de hilos y telas para continuar con su trabajo.

Arelys es una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades. Ella ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Arelys, age 25, is a single mother. She has a six year old son, and she lives with her parents in the Licapa section of the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Because of the need to get her minor son ahead, she started working as a seamstress six years ago. She learned this trade from her father, who has also done this work for many years. With a lot of effort she was able to buy a sewing machine. She currently has a small shop set up in her home. That is where she takes care of her customers’ orders. Arelys makes new clothes, and she repairs damaged clothes. Her business has been growing, and she is now receiving orders to make school uniforms. The school season has started everywhere in the country. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 PEN. She plans to use it to buy thread and fabric to continue with her work. Arelys is a tenacious woman who has known how to get ahead in spite of difficulties. She has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and fabric to make school uniforms

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is a 47-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in college. To earn a living, she operates a car wash in Rongai, which is in the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. She has two employees to assist her with the business. She also offers catering services for events, including weddings and parties. She explains that she is determined, hardworking, and diligent.

She hopes that the loan she is requesting will have a positive effect on both her business and her life in general. Bessie hopes to expand her business in order to general more income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to buy a car wash pressure pump.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing a car wash pressure pump

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca P. D. V. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a sus 3 hijos D. 11, 5 y 4 años D. edad. Francisca posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, la cual posee una ubicación muy buena, ya que se encuentra en su propia casa D. habitación donD. esta es la única tienda del lugar, así mismo esto le permite poder estar al tanto D. sus hijos y poder cuidarlos y ayudarles con las tareas. Francisca es madre soltera quien trabaja para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus pequeños hijos quienes dependen por completo D. ella. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad, lo cual le permita percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisca P. D. V. is 33 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 3 children of 11, 5, and 4 years of age. Francisca has a store for basic household goods which is in a very good location since it is in her own home and it is the only store in the area. Because her store is in her home, she can take care of her children and help them with their homework. Francisca is a single mother who works hard to give her children all the essentials since they completely depend on her. She needs the loan so that she can have the necessary amount of money to invest in her business, by buying a greater quantity of food products and basic household goods, which will allow her to have greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic household goods.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
S. Trương Thị (20203980013) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  S. is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn nhóm 03 (3).

S. is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, S. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  S. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  S. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA in the amount of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20203980014) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Đào Thị Trinh (20203980015) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Trương Thị L. (20203980016) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her recycling services.

4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203980017) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her recycling services.

5.  Chu Thị T. (20203980018) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her recycling services.

6.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203980019) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

7.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203980020) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her recycling services.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


S. Trương Thị (20203980013) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  S. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm H. trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thượng Thôn nhóm 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  S. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, S. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  S. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  S. đã H. trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20203980014) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Đào Thị Trinh (20203980015) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Trương Thị L. (20203980016) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203980017) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


5.  Chu Thị T. (20203980018) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


6.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203980019) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203980020) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to expand recycling services

loans.name: Merlyn Esther

texts.es:
Merlyn C. Gutiérrez tiene 43 años  vive con sus padres y su hijo de 13 años; ella es una mujer que no se queda quieta en cuanto a   buscar nuevos ingresos y  de capacitarse se trata, asì es  como ha realizado cursos de mercadeo y ventas, peluquera y belleza, preparación de alimentos y elaboración de calzado y de todos ellos obtiene frutos pues genera ingresos como comerciante  de calzado, ropa y accesorios que fortalecen la imagen de damas caballeros y niños y niñas, trabaja la peluquería a domicilio, prepara hayacas, deditos y frituras los fines de semana  ayudada por su mama, elabora calzado cuando le llevan el modelo que sus clientes le piden y también trabaja  parte de su tiempo en una empresa de manera provisional en oficios varios,  donde ha logrado adquirir su clientela que son principalmente empleados de empresas, aunque  también tiene amas de casa, vecinos, amigos y familiares. Últimamente  su hermana que es cliente de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, como le ha ido muy bien con esta organización le recomendó acceder al programa de créditos para que continúe expandiendo su mercado,  asì es como está solicitando una financiación por valor de $ 1.500.000 para comprar ropa femenina y calzado mixto.   
El entorno habitacional de Marlyn es en el barrio José Antonio Galán, Localidad Suroriente de Barranquilla,  caracterizado por la gran alegría de su gente y el espíritu de solidaridad, que demostraron cuando lograron apoyar al gobierno local para la pavimentación de sus calles,a través de recursos obtenidos mediante paseos, bingos, rifas, festivales y otras actividades comunitarias; es justamente en este ambiente, donde Merlyn desarrolla su negocio, que  inició cuando al trabajar en una empresa, ayudaba a su primo a conseguir clientes para   venderle sus  mercancía, allí  observó la posibilidad de un ingreso adicional y empezó la misma actividad vendiéndole a amigas, vecinas e incrementó su clientela ofreciéndole mercancías a todo el que  se le acercara; su primo continuó proveyéndola hasta que ahorró $150.000,que le permitieron negociar directamente con almacenes y bodegas, como hasta  ahora lo hace mediante una sana relación comercial. Ahora su gran desafío es realizar una  expansión comercial sostenida y más adelante su sueño es tener un local donde pueda integrar todas sus actividades  y su meta principal es ofrecerle a Yosimar,  su  hijo, una educación de la más alta calidad y siempre ser su soporte afectivo.
texts.en:
Merlyn C. Gutiérrez is 43 years old she lives with her parents and her 13 year old son. She is a woman who does not stand still as regards looking for new income and becoming qualified, therefore she has done courses in marketing and sales, hairdressing and beauty, food preparation and footwear manufacturing and she has got a return from all of them. Then she earned income selling shoes, clothing and accessories that stregthen the image of women, men and children. She does hairdressing at home, she makes "hayacas" (meat wrapped in cornmeal dough and banana leaves), "deditos" (finger shaped pastries) and "frituras" (fried food) in the weekends helped by her mother. She makes shoes when her customers take her the model they ask her for and she also works part time in a company provisionally in various roles, where she has managed to acquire her cusomers who are mainly company employees, although she also has housewives, neighbours, friends and family. Recently, her sister who is a customer of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, as things have gone well with this organization, advised her to access the loan programme so that she can keep expanding her market, therefore she is asking for financing to the value of $ 1,500,000 to buy women's clothing and footwear for men and women. Marlyn lives in the suburb of José Antonio Galán, in the Suroriente de Barranquilla locality. It is characterized by the great joy of its people and the spirit of solidarity that they demonstrated when they succeeded in supporting local government for the paving of their streets, through resources obtained from walks, bingo, raffles, festivals and other community activities. It is in this environment where Merlyn has developed her business, which started when working in a company. She used to help her cousin to win customers in order to sell them his goods, and there she saw the possibility of an additional income and started the same business selling to friends, neighbors and grew her customer base offering goods to all that came near; her cousin continued to supply her until she saved the $150,000 that allowed her to negotiate directly with department stores and local stores, as up until now she did it through a healthy business connection. Now her great challenge is to complete a sustainable business expansion and in the future her dream is to have a local store where she can integrate all her businesses and her main goal is to offer Yosimar, her son, the highest quality education and always be his emotional support.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's clothing and footwear for men and women.

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
Amos G., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Faithful. A senior student at a university, Amos is 32 years old, married and cares for one sibling. For eight years, he has been selling phone cards in the Parker Paint community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business with the limited funds he received while serving as a private security guard.

Amos plans to use his 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 42,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more phone cards, hoping to eventually expand the business and make more profit to be able to continue to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more phone cards.

loans.name: Tourn

texts.en: Tourn C., 44, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She produces brooms to sell for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her husband’s business.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Alione Fandiere

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune Fandiere S. est un vulgarisateur   de 41 ans qui habite à Yeumbeul  Nord  dans les environs du quartier de Baye Laye. Mais il est en même  temps transporteur depuis plusieurs années. Chacune de ses activités  a sa période  de rentabilité. Pendant la période  de chaleur c’est la vulgarisation qui marche fort alors que pendant la période  de vacance le secteur du transport connaît un ralentissement de ses activités. Il  est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis février 2007. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu  pour réparer  un de ses véhicules  en panne. Ce financement pourra ainsi l’aider a accroitre ses bénéfices, a régulariser  ses revenus, a  mieux gérer sa famille et ses problèmes  personnels et aussi  a renforcer son épargne.Monsieur S. est marie,pere de 3 enfants et a aussi 3 autres parents a sa charge.
texts.en:
Mr Alioune Fandiere S. is a 41-year-old extension worker living in Yeumbeul Nord, close to the Baye Laye neighbourhood. He has also worked in the transportation field for several years. Each of his activities has its own earning season. During the warm season extension work is very busy while the transportation field slows down for vacations. He is a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since February 2007. He seeks 500 000 francs in order to repair a broken down vehicle. This loan could also help him increase his profit, steady his revenue, better manage his family and his problems and boost his savings. Mr S. is a married father of three, with three other family members in his care.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: refection vehicule

loans.name: Bendiya 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Bendiya 5 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41  ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kegne, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, le dah,   le petit mil et le maïs. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FATOUMATA S. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 32500FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group "Bendiya 5" are married women averaging 41 years of age and two children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Kegne, a village in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of winter.  They are now on their fifth farm loan, and all the previous loans have been repaid.  The crops they grow include peanuts, dah (hibiscus flowers), pearl millet, and corn. With this new loan, Ms. Fatoumata S. intends to buy supplies (ahead of price increases) and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of labor for maintaining about a hectare of peanuts.  After harvesting, the produce is sold in Dioïla City and Fana City to a customer base composed of women and men.  The group members plan on making an average profit of about 32,500 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, manure, herbicide, weeding, and equipment

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita E. is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Charita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Charita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Charita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Charita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Charita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora L. P. tiene 55 años y vive en el barrio Los Almendros de Soledad, es una mujer casada y con tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 32 años, allí en su casa tiene un negocio donde prepara y vende comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, sánduches, chuzos, fritos, que elabora con los más deliciosos aderezos y salsas. 

Hace 10 años inició su actividad con una tienda en otro barrio del municipio de soledad; ella hizo su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para fortalecer este negocio y prosperó con 3 financiamientos mas, pero en su cuarto crédito entristecida  por la pérdida de su hijo al enfermar, terminó con su negocio y  se mudó de su casa y cinco años mas tarde, inició el negocio de venta de fritos y posteriormente cuando una vecina  le enseñó   técnicas de preparación de comidas rápidas para la venta, inició su actual negocio  en reemplazo de su antigua tienda. 

Con la venta de comidas rápidas gradualmente su negocio ha ido creciendo y Dora ha aprovechando muy bien su punto de ventas, primero  alquiló un carro de perros calientes por  sesenta mil pesos mensuales,  y  en el desarrollo de todas estas actividades compró   su carro de perros calientes por un valor de un millón doscientos mil pesos Colombianos y   gradualmente ha ido agregando otros equipos que han ampliado su infraestructura,  primero un calentador, luego sillas y finalmente el horno microondas. 

Actualmente  quiere ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece y adicionar otros  como los de heladería,  venta de masa de maíz, chichas y por eso solicita su credikiva; con el realizará  su primer pedido de helados y comprará al por mayor y de contado las salsas, aderezos  y la harina indispensable en la preparación de sus productos; no obstante, su meta es continuar prosperando su negocio, mediante la diversificación de productos y adicionarle además de heladería, productos de la canasta familiar para emular la prospera tienda que antes tenía.
texts.en:
Dora is 55 years old and lives in the community of Los Almendros de Soledad. She is married and has three children between the ages of 10 and 32. She runs a business out of her home preparing and selling fast food, such as hot dogs, sandwiches, kebabs and french fries, that she makes with the most delicious seasonings and sauces. She started a business 10 years ago with a shop in another neighborhood in Soledad. She used her first loan from Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to strengthen her business and further prospered with three more loans, but during her fourth loan she lost her son to an illness and she closed the business and moved to her home. Five years later, she started her business selling french fries and later when a neighbor showed her the techniques to prepare other fast foods she started her current business in place of the old one. Selling the different kinds of fast foods, her business gradually grew and Dora took advantage of her sales points very well. First, she rented a hot dog cart for 60,000 pesos a month, and later on she purchased a cart for 1.2 million Colombian pesos. She gradually kept adding other equipment to expand her infrastructure, first a heater, then chairs and finally a microwave oven. Currently she wants to expand the range of products she offers and add others like ice cream, pastries and beverages, and that is why she is turning to Kiva. She plans to make her first order of ice cream and purchase the sauces, seasonings and flour necessary to make her products. Her goal is to keep her business prospering by diversifying her products and adding other familiar staples so she can emulate the success of the shop she once had.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make her first order of ice cream and purchase the sauces, seasonings and flour necessary to make her products

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: Salama Immaculée est  secrétaire du groupe Tuungane, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, son mari est  enseignant. Son fils ainé a 17 ans et le cadet a 7 ans et tous étudient. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce son business de vente de divers. Elle a commencé avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari environ 100$. Elle vend de sucre, Omo, riz, Fanta, etc. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché central de Virunga. Ce crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter  son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 10 sacs de Riz, 5 sacs d’Omo, de Fanta, etc. Le grand obstacle est qu’elle vend parfois en crédit et que certains clients ne lui payent pas ou parfois payent avec retard. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants et y construire. La cliente Salama Immaculée remercie  Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Tuungane est composé de 16 membres.
texts.en:
Immaculée Salama is the secretary of the Tuungane solidarity group, which has 16 members. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Her husband is a teacher. Her eldest son is 17, the youngest 7, and all children attend school. She has been in the retail business for five years, selling miscellaneous items. She started out with her own funds, approximately $100, which her husband gave her. She sells sugar, Omo, rice, Fanta, etc. She has a booth at the central market of Virunga. With this loan, she will increase her sales by purchasing 10 bags of rice, 5 bags of Omo, Fanta, etc. Her biggest challenge is that she occasionally sells on credit, and some customers delay payment, or do not pay at all. She wants to buy a plot of land and build on it, for her children. Immaculée Salama wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for supporting underprivileged people who do not have access to traditional banks.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of rice, 5 bags of Omo, Fanta, etc.

loans.name: 02.07.18 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en: Ngat N. T. (33) is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Ngat is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 18-Hanh Phuc (02-07-18-Nam Ngan). Ngat is married and has 1 adult child. To making a living, Ngat operates a family member's business raising cattL. for saL.. Ngat has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2010, Ngat joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ngat has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngat plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. L. T. Nguyet (38) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. L. T. Nga (34) is a 18 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. 3. C. T. Hue (35) is a 32 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 4. L. T. Luong (36) is a 41 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. N. T. Quyet (37) is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her specialized retail store. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ngat N. T. (33) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Ngat là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 18-Hanh Phuc (02-07-18-Nam Ngan). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Ngat thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Ngat kiếm được khoảng 3500000 VND. Vào 2010, Ngat đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Ngat đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Nguyet (38) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Nga (34) là 18 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 3. C. T. Hue (35) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 4. L. T. Luong (36) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. N. T. Quyet (37) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Kameme Bakyara Kweterana, Kihihi Group

texts.en: N. Moses, aged 40, (with hand raised) operates a retail shop for general merchandise in Kihihi trading centre. He manages to earn some money, (400,000 a month) to fulfill his life and feed his family of six children. It is always difficult to build a strong businesses from scratch and Moses began his business with very little capital. He is seeking a loan to expand his business and purchase enough stock to meet the needs of his customers. With more stock, he will be able to earn profits. Moses belongs to Kameme Bakyara kweterana, Kihihi.

loans.use: Increase his inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother with five children, one of whom still attends school (the other four have graduated). She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is her water bills. 

Mama Rose Kiosk (her retail shop) has been in operation for over one year. Before that she was selling dumplings. Her customers are her neighbours. She also plants peas and beans, which provide her with another source of income. Rose faces a supply challenge, as she sometimes gets inadequate stock for resale. She hopes to expand her business and start a vegetable stall in the future.

Rose decided to join Yehu to get loans to start her retail shop.  With this KES 15,000 loan she wants to purchase two bundles of maize flour, one bundle of wheat flour, sugar and paraffin.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of maize flour, one bundle of wheat flour, sugar and paraffin
